positionName: Data Analyst - Security, Integrity, and Investigations
description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Do you like working with big data? Do you want to use data to help drive the direction of products that impact the lives of over 1 billion people every day? If yes, we want to talk to you. The Security, Integrity, and Investigations (SI2) team ensures Facebook maintains a healthy balance between community safety, user privacy, and its legal obligations. The team focuses on reporting and using data to forecast, build insights and draw correlations between our external and internal sites. We are looking for an experienced individual with a strong background in analytics, automation, and reporting. The SI2 Data Analyst will work with a team of data professionals that assist other Trust & Safety oriented teams by providing deep technical solutions to highly complex and real-world impacting problems. They will also work on the formation of pipelines and transport mechanisms for existing systems. In this role, the team will see a direct link between the work and Facebook’s efforts to thwart real-world harm. This candidate will be highly organized, productive, and able to thrive in high-pressure, time-sensitive scenarios, with a people-centric approach to problem solving.

Support multiple specialist teams across the Security, Investigations and Integrity Organization
Serve as an escalation point for frontline difficulties where the next step to resolution is missing or ambiguous
Leverage data to identify, understand, troubleshoot, and report on areas of opportunity in Facebook SI2 across multiple specialist Teams within the Security, Investigations and Integrity Organization
Monitor key metrics to forecast and explain the root causes of changes in internal and external conditions that drive those metrics
Analyze large data sets to identify trends and patterns that require deeper analysis or policy changes
Use data and analysis to provide strategic direction to the broader SI2 teams and their leaders
Receive and respond to requests for data requests
Receive and respond to requests for ad-hoc reporting
Convert ad-hoc reporting to normalized/automated reports when the need arises
Retrofit outdated/cumbersome existing reports

B.S. in a technical discipline (e.g. Math, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, or equivalent)
5+ years of quantitative or statistical analysis experience
3+ years of experience in business strategy, finance, engineering, or analytics
2+ years of experience in technology focused project management
Experience working within sensitive data systems (e.g. banking, medical, government restricted, etc.)
Experience processing and analyzing complex data sets, and interpreting them for making business decisions
Experience creating ad hoc queries to answer unique questions from a diverse set of stakeholders
Data visualization experience with an intuitive knowledge of data storytelling, communication skills, and experience working as part of a team and collaborating with cross-functional partners

Who we are: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.
Job Description Summary: The PayPal Developer Experience team ensures the 1,000+ internal product delivery teams developing and delivering PayPal software can do so with minimal friction and maximum speed. It provides the tools, processes, and best practices that guide the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) for all developers and all software stacks. This group helps simplify the process of delivering software so that engineers can spend more time developing and less time managing infrastructure and their pipeline. This is a critical function that ensures every team has the tools and support they need to stay in flow and deliver products globally to compete and win the $5 Trillian dollar FinTech market. This critical role helps quantify the process of software development at PayPal and develops insights that drive investment strategy for ongoing improvement. It requires an understanding of the key feedback loops that drive developers daily, knowledge of what factors contribute to software quality, and development of hypothesis that will enable developers to work more productively. By deeply understanding these processes, designing the data strategy, and turning the resulting data into useful intelligence that can inform product strategy, you will play an important role in PayPal’s ability to deliver market-winning products. It requires partnering closely with key leaders in the groups delivering developer services and helping them build strong, data-driven strategies to drive their roadmap.
Job Description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
Translate business questions into structured analysis and data analytics into business insights
Strong communication with business acumen who can work efficiently and effectively with key stakeholders across multiple teams and geographies to define and produce business metrics and insights within a given time frame
Develop a strong understanding of different data sources, and strategically implement data flows for robustness and scalability
Perform analysis on key business trends from different perspectives and package the insights into easily consumable presentations and documents
Own the production, development, and maintenance of all aspects of BI solutions – ETL, Data Quality, Visualization, Documentation, and Support
Design and build BI dashboards in short timeframes via rapid prototyping and agile development
Apply advanced visualization techniques to reveal business insights
Perform rigorous data analysis to proactively identify any inconsistencies or data quality issues. Provide recommendations for improvements
Work to improve the day-to-day activities of the analytics team with technology and automation
Desired Skills and Experience:
A persistent person who has the willingness to spend time in an area and become a SME in that domain
4+ years of experience in analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets and synthesizing insights into actionable solutions
Minimum 3 years of experience managing ETL of data from multiple sources using Advanced SQL and Jupyter Notebooks
Strong analytical skills including experience, familiarity, and ease with analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to engage with multiple stakeholders and different teams to deliver BI solutions efficiently
Highly motivated, result-oriented self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-pace environment. Proven ability to function well independently as well as in a team
Data driven mindset with degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics or Economics
Experience in Fintech/Banking/Credit/Payment industry a strong plus
Experience with a statistical programming language like R or Python is a plus
For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Location: Anywhere in the US

Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work you'll do


US Cyber Data Protection team is responsible for securing and protecting confidential data of Deloitte US Member Firm, our Clients and our Employees. Team's core mission is to implement consistent security controls to protect Firm's data and data entrusted to us by our Clients to build their trust and protect our brand. We are seeking an experienced and energetic US Cybersecurity Data Protection Analyst with outstanding communication, analytical and cyber security technical skills to join our Cyber Data Protection team within Information Technology Services (ITS) Organization.

If you're an experienced, hands-on IT professional with strong systems administration, engineering and cyber security technical skills who's interested in growing in the cybersecurity field, this may be the job for you. As part of our Cyber Data Protection team, you will be assisting in designing, deploying and managing technology and process solutions to reduce the potential of data compromise. You will be assisting with testing of data protection and data security solutions. You will work to enhance and mature cyber security data protection capabilities for Deloitte US Member Firm. You will require an understanding of the entire ecosystem of data protection including well-rounded understanding of the information security domains and their inter-relations across that ecosystem. You will be responsible for providing technical product and troubleshooting assistance to Deloitte Employees. You will work closely with management, leads, peers, development teams, business analysts, and end users to ensure data protection for systems are used by all areas the organization.

Responsibilities:

As part of the US Cyber Data Protection team, you will have the following core responsibilities:
Assist with the development, deployment and support of data protection solutions
Assist with the implementation of data security controls and design principles
Provide Tier 2 support to end users for cyber data protection services including, but not limited to web security, cloud access security broker, date encryption, key and certificate management, advanced threat protection, digital code signing, endpoint detection and remediation, data loss prevention, data classification and rights management, data retention and destruction, data access governance, data discovery etc.
Assist in maturing data protection solutions protecting against data exfiltration
Assist in rolling out new data protection services to employees, getting them adopted and providing on-going support for those services
Assist with technology and software reviews based on data protection and endpoint risks
Provide technical engineering and troubleshooting support to employees for data protection services

The team


Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The ~3,000 professionals in ITS deliver services including:

About the job
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.
Google Works is a team for Googlers by Googlers. Our internal products touch every employee’s life “from hire to retire” including Finance, People Operations, Marketing, Google Cloud, and more. We invest heavily in engineering excellence through our teams, such as Data Works, who are tasked with making it easier for Googlers to do self-service analytics and reporting.
Due to the central role of the team, we interface with a diverse set of businesses, engineering, and product teams across Google Cloud, Google external apps, proprietary products as well as third party tools, to pave the way for enterprise-class solutions.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Work with our Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and Engineers to plan and execute towards corporate data governance goals.
Influence and communicate cross-functionally with partner teams, Alphabet-wide users, and senior leaders.

The Data Operations Tableau Analyst (Data Analyst IV) is selected by and reports to the Assistant Deputy Inspector General for Fraud, Waste and Abuse Research and Analytics (FWARA). The position performs highly complex (senior-level) data analysis and data research work in support of investigative and audit functions for the Office of the Inspector General (OIG). Work involves the design, development, implementation and maintenance of the OIG Tableau dashboard sites. The Tableau dashboards are used to track and monitor performance and metrics for the OIG organization. Leads collaboration of technology initiatives, builds and administers Tableau dashboards and related technologies. Responsibilities also include the design and development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations, which are used to conduct detailed analysis of and extensive research on Medicaid and other health and human services data and systems. The Data Operations Tableau Analyst will support all business areas with the objective to maximize effective communications and business processes using Tableau and other BI technologies. The Tableau Analyst will also perform some functions using SharePoint and provide support for SharePoint when needed. Works under limited supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.


Essential Job Functions:
Responsible for the design, development, implementation and maintenance of the OIG Tableau dashboards. Add/Delete/Modify user access permissions to Tableau dashboards. Regular review, cleanup, management and configuration of Tableau content and dashboards. Support and maintain software integration between Tableau and other in-house business applications. (40%)


Effectively train, troubleshoot and provide user support for Tableau dashboards. Monitor Tableau utilization trends. Work with team to develop user friendly front-end processes for accessing dashboards. Work with cross functional business areas to develop process improvements using Tableau. Consults with management on and makes recommendations for the most useful ways to integrate Tableau dashboards in OIG business practices. (30%)


Create, design, and develop SharePoint sites. Responsible for coordinating with business areas to obtain data metrics and specifications for use in creating SharePoint sites. (15%)


Maintain operational documentation detailing technical environment, configuration and support processes for Tableau activities and dashboards. (10%)


Performs other duties necessary to achieve the mission of the Office of the Inspector General. Statewide travel of about 5% may be required. (5%)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of statistics and analyzing data sets; of running queries, report writing, and presenting findings; of data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques; and of record keeping, including security procedures for handling, protecting, and distributing confidential data.

Knowledge of Tableau.

Knowledge of Windows operation systems, as well as SQL Server, Power BI, PowerShell, and Office 365.

Skill in designing, building and maintaining Tableau dashboards.

Skill in using Tableau to create dashboards using various types of data.

Skill in the use of a computer and applicable software, in analyzing problems and devising effective solutions, in conducting data searches, in evaluating and translating large amounts of data, and in critical thinking.

Skill in time management and task prioritization abilities

Ability to solve complex software and data issues.

Ability to pay attention to detail and strong in organizational skills

Ability to be flexible to changing project assignments, requirements, deadlines, and projects.

Ability to compile, review, and analyze data; to prepare reports; to maintain accuracy and attention to detail; to communicate effectively; and to supervise the work of others.

Registration or Licensure Requirements:
None


Initial Selection Criteria:
At least 2 years of experience designing and developing business intelligence dashboards using Tableau is required. Experience designing and using SharePoint is preferred. Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in data science, business analytics, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, accounting, or a related field is required.


Additional Information:
A copy of college transcript will be required. Selected candidate must be able to pass a background check. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee service center at 1-888-894-4747. The OIG is responsible for preventing, detecting, auditing, inspecting, reviewing, and investigating fraud, waste, and abuse in the provision of HHS in Medicaid and other HHS programs. positionName: Feb 2022 hire - Associate Data analyst - Financial Services
description:
About RiskSpan
RiskSpan is a leading source of analytics, modeling, data and risk management solutions for the consumer and institutional Finance industries. We solve business problems for clients such as banks, mortgage-backed and asset-backed securities issuers, equity and fixed-income portfolio managers, servicers, and regulators that require our expertise in the market risk, credit risk, operational risk and information technology domains.
 Primary Responsibilities
Identify, analyze, document and interpret trends or patterns in complex business processes using data analysis software and techniques.
Analyze large data sets to facilitate management reporting. Data analysis activities may include data cleansing and transformation, developing trend reports and forecasts, and bench marking results against competing data sets.
Analyze and document complex business processes and technical problems that result in development and implementation of end-user computing applications.
Support the development of business requirements and completion of software testing activities associated with the delivery of applications and financial models to clients.
Interpret and communicate results of data analysis and model output to clients accurately and effectively.
Support analysis related to client business problems using valid statistical methods and tools.
Qualifications
Strong academic record (3.3 GPA out of 4.0) from top university with degree in Computer Science, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Information Management Systems or Computer Science.
0 – 1 years of work experience, with an interest in finance.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications. Experience developing reports, models or applications in Excel VBA. (skills assessment required).
Experience working with data sets in mySQL or other databases preferred, but not required.
Experience with R or Python for data manipulation preferred, but not required.
Experience with data visualization software such as Qlik, Tableau, or PowerBI preferred, but not required.
Ablility to thrive on multiple projects/tasks at one time. Must be detail-oriented and enjoy aspects of research and finance analytics.
Willingness to travel up to 50%.
RiskSpan is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States on an unrestricted basis.

About the Data Analyst position
We are looking for a certified Data Analyst who will help us turning data into information, getting insights and developing business decisions based on the analysis results. Your responsibilities will include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design and also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
We expect you to possess analytical mindset with creative approach to tasks and the ability to find patterns and correlation when dealing with big volumes of information. You should also be able to work under a flexible schedule and report on your findings in a detailed and straightforward manner.
Data Analyst responsibilities are:
Manage databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Collect required data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Retrieve information from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Collaborate with management to prioritize business and information needs
Find and evaluate new process improvement opportunities
Data Analyst requirements are:
2+ years' experience of working on a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst position
Significant experience of working with data analytical models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Excellent knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets, including Excel, SPSS, SAS and so on
Good practical experience with reporting packages (e.g. Business Objects), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Precise and effective written and verbal communication skills
BS degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Company Description
Dentsu is a modern marketing solutions company. Our mission is to help clients navigate, progress and thrive in a world of change. Businesses rely on our integrated network of agencies and specialized practices to champion meaningful progress through creative, media, commerce, data and technology. Part of Dentsu Group, our global network comprises 66,000 diverse people in 143 countries, who are dedicated to teaming for growth and good. Some of our award-winning agencies include 360i, Carat, dentsumcgarrybowen, DEG, dentsuX, iProspect and Merkle. Follow us on Twitter @DentsuUSA and visit dentsu.com/us.
We are champions for meaningful progress and we strive to be a force for good—for our people, for our clients, for the industry and for our society. We keep our people at the center, creating space for growth, understanding and learning so they can thrive. We embed diversity, in our mindset, in our solutions and in our teams to empower an inclusive, equitable and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators with each other and with our clients, driving better outcomes for all.

Job Description
Applicants
“Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. No sponsorship is available for this position.”
Location to work
Must live in the USA - Remote USA Only!
The dentsu Automation COE’s mission is to elevate our people’s potential by integrating automation and AI into everything we do. Our AI Powered Process Mining Program supports this mission by leveraging advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) capabilities to streamline process discovery across observation cycles. The outputs from these observation cycles enable technology and operations teams to take the appropriate actions to augment and elevate ways of working. These outputs are intended to create transparency into business operations and identify opportunities for process improvement including automation use cases.
This position will report into our Process Data Scientist and work closely with that role to deliver unprecedented insights into our business operations by analyzing, visualizing, and articulating patterns, trends, and anomalies within our terabytes upon terabytes of observed data by utilizing specialized platform and tools. It’s easy to get lost in this volume of data and the Process Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that business stakeholders are able to get the optimal value and insights from our process data ocean.
This is an excellent role for the right person looking to enter the world of applied data science. A successful candidate will have a passion for identifying and clearly articulating insights found from complex data sets through the lens of business operations.
Responsibilities:
Design mines with the goal to discover and isolate processes based on cycle focus
Translating cycle focus into mining strategy
Learn & lead sustainable mining design to ensure continuous value creation
Analyses specialize & productivity applications and detail main functions
Support applications classifications by querying on scale to find signals from database
Test new mining approaches to identify unique pattens
Maintain current KPIs and discover more to assess cycle success and team’s performance
Explore and test new features (front and back end) released or prerelease by vendors
Discover unclaimed applications observed and document relationships from cycles
Document screen signatures in relationship of unique screens within applications
Ensure members are on boarded and offboarded with the cycle stages with the goal to maximize data captured
Analyze groups and clusters to connect commonality and differences between them
Work with IT on SCCM related tasks to support deployment and rollback
Work with media platform teams and vendor providers as needed
Managing standard end to end process mining observation cycles
Brokering information between technical data science team and business operations stakeholders
Executing process mining queries given desired outputs and parameters provided by business operations stakeholders
Maintaining and creating visualization interfaces so that business stakeholders can easily understand insights and help refine desired process mining outputs
Managing Process Definition Document library and identifying trends/discrepancies between Process Definition Documents (PDDs)
Partnering with Automation Solution Architects to understand automation use cases and refine process mining runs to generate refined PDDs
Ensuring that PDDs are entered into the appropriate use case pipelines for actioning by the right teams (BPO, Automation, Point Software, Offshoring, etc.)
Classifying and indexing previously unencountered digital entities including but not limited to application and screen signatures
Additional AI Powered Process Mining Program support as needed

1-2 years of data analysis experience or coursework

Why Convey by project44?

From parcel to freight, and first to final mile, Convey by project44 helps the world’s largest retailers, manufacturers, and logistics service providers reduce costs, improve visibility, and transform transportation into their next competitive advantage. We power better customer delivery experiences for brands such as Walmart, The Home Depot, Nordstrom, Abercrombie & Fitch, and Casper Mattresses. The transportation and logistics industry is massive, as is the opportunity. We’re looking for bright, ambitious individuals to help us change the way the world ships.

The Role

The RevOps Data Analyst will partner closely with members of the Revenue Operations, Finance and Go-to-Market Leadership, serving as a subject matter expert on key business data and Go-To-Market metrics. This role is essential to the success of accurately reporting on progress against goals, both at the company and individual level, and proactively identifying strategic opportunities to accelerate progress through data analysis.

Responsibilities

Combine data from various sources into reporting & visualizations that empower our teams to make educated, data-driven decisions
Lead the effort to identify, categorize, and evaluate all existing standards reports
Serve as the point person for new data or reporting requests and output of those deliverables
Own and improve key customer data and revenue reporting
Responsible for auditing current data flows, validating accuracy and maintaining data hygiene across systems
Supporting data mapping activities in conjunction with the Systems Administrator

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of work as an Analyst or work within a Sales/GTM/Revenue Ops org
Proficient with data visualization tools, as well as deep familiarity with Salesforce and data mapping to other systems
Excel guru
Thrives in metrics and data-driven environments and capable of succinctly summarizing data
Champion of data hygiene
Great teammate who thrives in ambiguity, adapts quickly to evolving needs, and has a strong attention-to-detail
Exceptional communication and liaison skills
Must be located in the US or Canada

Why work for Freebirds?
1. We are in our 3rd year of top 1% of industry performance.
2. For the second year in a row, we were awarded the #1 consumer choice for craveable food by National Restaurant News.
3. We are growing and creating tremendous job opportunities.
4. We believe in creating exceptional culture, continued product innovation, training enhancements, and exceptional Texas hospitality.

Freebirds Benefits for the Restaurant Support Center (RSC)

Low-cost healthcare, 401K, and PTO options
Closed for 14 holidays every year
Company cell phone re-imbursements
Cell phone, ticket, event, and gym partnership discounts
Free Freebirds meals

Responsibilities

Hospitality can be fast-paced, and our job at the RSC is to support our restaurant operators. This means short-term urgent projects & duties will come up, including:

o Ad-hoc financial & non-financial analysis
o Explaining key performance metrics to our operators and other stakeholders
o Tracking how short-term marketing or operational initiatives are performing

Maintain recurring reporting to our operators and to other departments at the RSC:

o Some Excel reporting
o Some reporting in Domo
o Troubleshooting any issues that arise with our data feeds that interfere with the accuracy and timeliness of these reports

We frequently accept new datasets into Domo. This will require some medium-term projects & duties including:

o Data accuracy audits against source systems
o Data variance audits against existing datasets (what is the impact of switching sources)
o Replacing old datasets with new datasets in our existing reports & dashboards
o Assistance cleaning and structuring/building new datasets

We continue to make our reporting more actionable, our data more accurate and nuanced, and our data feeds more stable. Some long-term projects & duties that support these goals will include:

o Research & discovery of source systems, including troubleshooting anything we or our software vendors could be doing to improve data accuracy within the source systems
o Enhancing & standardizing existing reporting / dashboards
o Getting to know our datasets in detail, and being able to speak to our reporting capabilities with other departments at the RSC
What will make you successful at this job

Able to prioritize and manage urgent, recurring, and long-term projects
Inclined to reach out if you are stuck, versus grinding
Concerned with accuracy and able to offer productive solutions (inclined to spot data inaccuracies as part of your process, and able to suggest reproducible data workarounds if perfect accuracy is not possible)
Able to explain data and results, visually as well as verbally, to a range of people (both subject matter experts and non-experts)
Inclined to tinker (you do not shy from regularly occurring tasks, but if some busywork could be automated, you explore those possibilities)
Able to recommend ways to clean and structure new data

What tools you will be using

Domo (for recurring Operations reporting, for ad-hoc reporting, and you will manage our data feeds into this system)
Excel (for some recurring RSC reporting, ad-hoc reporting, and audits)
Helpful to know R or Python to explore larger datasets

Technical skills preferred

Advanced Excel (able to do a pivot table, write a macro, and make an Excel report clear to someone who doesn’t stare at spreadsheets all day)
SQL
Domo or other BI tool
Experience getting data from an API
Experience managing data pipelines
Basic to moderate familiarity with statistics (able to run regression analysis)
Proven ability to analyze data from various angles based on business needs
Proven ability to explain the data being analyzed (verbally, in writing, and visually)

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or higher
Experience in customer-facing retail or food service
3 or more years of office experience, exhibiting soft skills and technical skills
Work product to support technical skills

Business Analyst I

The Business Analyst I work under the general direction of the Office of Area Agencies on Aging Data Management and Reporting Manager, Access and Eligibility Services, with limited supervision and considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

AES is driven by its vision to provide an integrated and streamlined approach to connect people to services and supports that reduce institutionalization, allow people to remain in their communities, and promote economic and personal self-sufficiency. The ideal candidate will thrive in an environment that emphasizes innovation through new ideas, striving for excellence by taking pride in their work, embracing differences as a source of strength, accomplishing more through partnership, leading by example, and learning for continuous improvement. In addition to rewarding, meaningful work, HHSC offers a variety of benefits, which can be found at https://ers.texas.gov/Benefits-at-a-Glance, and generous leave based on years of service. A list of State of Texas holidays is available at: https://hr.sao.texas.gov/Documents/Holidays/Holidays2021.pdf.

The Business Analyst (BA) I provide technical support for the Information Management System (IMS) statewide system to facilitate efficient and accurate reporting of the substantial amount of data to federal and state entities. Performs all activities related to the validation of quarterly performance data and conducts monthly validation activities to ensures data accuracy. Work involves support for planning, scheduling and coordinating submission of annual reports to the Administration on Aging (AoA). Work involves planning, organizing, securing, monitoring and managing resources to bring about the successful completion of specific project goals and objectives within the constraints of scope, time, and budget. It also involves development of processes and procedures; generating internal and external data reports; and performing in-depth program data analysis and evaluation of grant performance and reported services activities. Work involves preparation of state and federal reports; coordination and development of Area Agencies on Aging (AAA) performance measures; analysis and review of performance measure targets completed; and preparation and monitoring of performance measures. The BA I tasks include the development of AAA performance measure reporting; performs all activities related to validation of quarterly performance data, and maintenance of performance data files to ensure complete and accurate reporting.



Essential Job Functions:
Develops and maintains internal and external processes and tools in consultation with internal and external stakeholders. Ensures changes to processes, manuals and tools are communicated appropriately to internal and external stakeholders. Manages and performs all activities related to validation of quarterly data to ensure accuracy of IMS data and quarterly performance data. Conducts analysis of quarterly performance data to ensure accurate reporting of expenditure data and trends. Develops processes and procedures; generates internal and external data reports; and conducts data analysis. (25%)

Supports program aspects of the IMS; plans, schedules and coordinates activities related to performance data reporting; monitors and manages resources to facilitate efficient reporting of extensive data to federal and state entities. (25%)

Manages the performance measure projections process. Develops, maintains, reviews, and revises reports necessary for AAA performance projections; and reviews and approves performance measure targets, and target modifications, as appropriate, submitted by the AAAs. (15%)

Manages the AAA monthly data review and validation activities and schedules and coordinates activities related to preparation and submission of reported results. Provides input and oversight of compliance of validation requirements. (15%)

Develops and implements techniques for evaluating agency programs and outcomes; conducts special studies to define problems experienced by agency programs, documents and provides findings for management decisions and develops recommended solutions. Researches technical questions related to program compliance with applicable state and federal statutes, and regulations to support basis for responses. (10%)

Develops and maintains the processes related to the nutrition services annual rate setting activities, instructions, budget templates, waivers, and reporting tools in coordination with internal staff, Texas Department of Agriculture, and the Area Agencies on Aging. (10%)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of aging and disability programs and service systems; Area Agencies on Aging or other health and human service organizations serving older individuals or persons with disabilities with knowledge in reporting requirements for federal and state entities.

Knowledge of federal and state laws, policies, rules and requirements for health and human services programs.

Knowledge of the legislative appropriations process.

Knowledge (technical) of information security practices and procedures.

Skill in MS Office Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

Skill in SQL, MS Access and other programming languages.

Skill in Crystal Reports, or other report development programs.

Skill in the use of computer hardware and software, with ability to recognize, analyze and resolve application and network problems related to IMS.

Ability to automate processes, create, update and perform Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) and macros.

Skill in reviewing, analyzing and evaluating large volumes of data.

Skills in analyzing measures or indicators of program performance, program performance projections, and progress in meeting program goals.

Ability to exercise sound judgment, take initiative, work independently, and think innovatively.

Ability to train others and to communicate complex information to a variety of individuals and groups through oral presentations and through written instructions.

Ability to efficiently coordinate multiple projects, prioritize work and meet time frames.

Ability to analyze functional business needs of a group and to identify strategies to enhance efficiency.

Ability to effectively and professionally communicate, verbally and in writing, complex information to a variety of stakeholders.

Ability to analyze IMS systems, develop and implement business processes.


Registration or Licensure Requirements:


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in the field of finance, public administration, or another related field is preferred. Five years of experience with working with Older Americans Act services or other health and human services organizations or programs serving older persons (people 60 years old and over) will be considered in lieu of the education requirement.

Experience in using Microsoft Office software.

Experience in data reporting.

Experience in communicating complex information orally and, in writing to a variety of audiences


Additional Information:
Applicants may not have a history of substantiated fraudulent activity against HHSC or any programs it administers. Applicants who have a non-fraud overpayment with an outstanding balance must agree to repay the overpayment balance as a condition of employment.

positionName: eCommerce Product Data Analyst - Austin, TX or Remote
description:
Other World Computing is seeking an individual to join our Merchandising Team to support our growing product information management needs. The Product Information Specialist will be responsible for the integrity and processing of product data, as well as various support projects for the Merchandising Department.
Responsibilities
Data integrity ownership, including:
Ensure the accuracy of all product content within the PIM, including key data fields, attributes, product descriptions, images, and documents needed to support online sales.
Identify product data issues and proactively make necessary data revisions.
Create and perform data cleansing activities, including identifying and resolving product data and/or processing issues.
Perform data integrity audits as needed.
Review product data needs and implement new attributes, data models, and processes to address those needs.
Enhance product data and data models, including collection of additional product data as needed (i.e. contacting vendors, performing web searches, etc.)
Develop reports related to product information and data quality, and other projects as assigned by eCommerce Marketing Manager.
Work with PIM users to troubleshoot and resolve system problems.
Develop training materials and processes for new and existing PIM users.
Participate as subject matter expert in projects/meetings to determine immediate or future data management or reporting needs.
Assist eCommerce Marketing Manager in developing product data roadmaps, including recommendations for data enhancements, and new ways to leverage product data across other data systems (both internal and external).
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with one to three years of experience managing complex product data, preferably in a manufacturing/distribution/computer hardware environment; or minimum three years of related experience in lieu of education
Proficiency working with large amounts of product data and/or PIM/BI tools, including data management and manipulation
Proficiency managing data with Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets (using advanced functions, such as filters, pivot tables, vlookups, etc.)
Experience with scripting (JavaScript, etc.) and/or front-end markup (HTML, etc.) languages
Highly competent computer skills
Teamwork and interdepartmental communication skills are critical
Exceptional organization skills and attention to detail
Working knowledge of scientific terms, abbreviations, and characters.
Excellent spelling, grammar, and other language skills required to create and edit consumer-facing content.
Working experience leveraging product data to support an eCommerce platform also a plus.
Pay Rate: Competitive Salary, negotiable/based on experience
About OWC:
OWC is a fast-paced, friendly atmosphere that advocates ingenuity and encourages every employee to contribute ideas towards the discovery of the next innovative concept that could change the world of technology. Our shared vision of the ultimate customer experience is a key component to achieving the industry-leading results OWC has become known for around the globe. We firmly believe that the best in life is obtained through dedicated teamwork and creativity.
OWC is an environmentally conscious company committed to the conservation of our planet's resources through the use of renewable energy and company-wide recycling programs. Today OWC is recognized as a leading zero-emissions Mac and PC technology company. Other World Computing (OWC) has been providing the highest quality hardware products and support to the computer industry since 1988, specializing in Mac upgrades and expansion products to extend the useful life of Macs and reduce e-waste. We have one of the largest online catalogs for computer and iDevice enhancement products through our e-commerce portal www.macsales.com and have been steadily expanding the software solutions we provide as well through our brands SoftRAID and Mediafour.
OWC offers great benefits such as medical, dental, vision, 401K, short/long term disability, HSA and FSA accounts and a wellness program. We provide paid time off and 6 paid holidays as well as flexible schedule and work from home opportunities. We value our employees so there is potential for career growth, cross functional training, stretch assignments and ongoing educational opportunities.

Description
MISSION: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) will improve outcomes for all public-school students in the state by providing leadership, guidance, and support to school systems.
ABOUT OUR DIVISION: The Analytics division resides within the Department of Strategy and Analytics in the Office of School Programs. This division serves and supports program leaders across the Office of School Programs. As an internal customer service organization, the division is both a decision-making engine and an operations support provider for program leaders to save time and increase impact. The Office of School Programs is made up over 150 staff members and is responsible for various programmatic areas including Student Assessment; College, Career, and Military Preparation; Early Childhood Education; Instructional Strategy; and Standards and Support Services.
This position is funded through September 30, 2024 with federal stimulus funds. Continuation of the position beyond that date is contingent upon available funding. This federally funded role will provide critical support for the agency to urgently address student learning loss due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
POSITION OVERVIEW: The Data Analyst is responsible for leading analytical projects from definition to execution that impact over 5.5 million Texas students. The Data Analyst will collaborate with partners across the Office of School Programs and TEA to analyze and maintain complex data sets, align metric outputs, and identify actionable insights and program opportunities.
Within TEA’s School Programs Office, research, data, and analytical support are crucial for statewide programs affecting college and college access, early childhood, student assessment, and instructional training and effectiveness. The Data Analyst is responsible for conducting qualitative and quantitative analysis on large datasets (e.g., the Texas Student Data System (TSDS), STAAR, etc.), as well as integrating and analyzing data from statewide initiatives including Texas Home Learning (THL), Reading Academies, and innovative school models, among others.

This position helps establish and drive next-level improvements in the Office of School Programs operations. The position is additionally responsible for conducting detailed analysis and extensive research, providing results, and monitoring and implementing data quality. This position may provide guidance to others and works under limited supervision, with latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
Flexible work location within the state of Texas may be considered for qualified candidates.
Please note that a resume and tailored cover letter are required attachments for applying to this position. Incomplete applications will not be considered.
Applicants who are strongly being considered for employment must submit to a national criminal history background check.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Generates insights through the collection, analysis, and evaluation of programmatic and other research data to inform policy, determine strategy, and improve effectiveness of programmatic operations; applies statistical models and causal inference methods to uncover trends, measure impact, and predict outcomes; provides recommendations to maximize student impact; writes SQL/Python queries to extract, blend, clean, and analyze data.
Conducts primary research aimed at solving particular programmatic questions and policy choices; develops qualitative and quantitative data collection instruments and processes including surveys and web analytics that ensure foundational data are available and accurate for insights; contributes to all phases of research and evaluation projects.
Creates and maintains analytical tools and user-friendly dashboards that empower senior leaders with effective support for decision-making; builds analytics and reporting capabilities to support ongoing program evaluation and operations; helps establish operating goals and targets; Supports product design and process by providing user research and related input on features.
Supports data quality assurance exercises including validation and creation of data dictionaries.
Communicates insights and presents conclusions to key partners across the organization.

Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:


Education: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university. Bachelor’s degree in an analytical field (e.g., Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or another related field) preferred.
Experience: At least one [1] year of experience in an analytical role. Consulting, data science, or other equally rigorous and quantitative experience preferred.
Substitutions: Education and experience may substitute for one another on a year-for-year basis.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Superior project and time management ability
Passionate about working with data, measuring performance, and making decisions based on quantitative or deductive reasoning
Advanced Excel knowledge with expertise in data analysis functions
Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Proficiency with R or Python
Proficiency with SQL
Incredible attention to detail
Self-starter with an outcomes-based approach to management
Fast learner who thrives in a high-performing environment
High intellectual ceiling with the ability to solve new and dynamic operating problems
A desire to self-reflect, give/receive feedback and continuously improve
Share the belief that all Texas students can achieve at high levels and are able to succeed in college, career or the military

As an equal opportunity employer, we hire without consideration to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, disability, or veteran status, unless an applicant is entitled to the veteran’s preference.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
Campus Advantage is seeking a Jr. Business Intelligence Analyst to support strategic design and implementation activities for business intelligence applications, including integration with databases and data warehouses. You will be working with a team to integrate and aggregate data for the development of analytical tools to support property and corporate operations.

Our Company
Campus Advantage is a student housing management company that specializes in fostering financially prosperous communities through its property management, investments, and consulting services. Since its founding in 2003, Campus Advantage has been creating successful communities that provide rewarding living, learning, and career experiences, and as a result has become one of the fastest-growing private student housing companies in the nation. The company’s asset acquisition and management strategies combined with its dedication to residence life and student development has made Campus Advantage one of the largest student housing and property management companies in the United States.

Through our M.V.P and Core Values, we create better team and resident experiences, which in turn result in the financial success of Campus Advantage and our partners.

Exceptional analytical skills

Description
GENERAL DESCRIPTION
Performs audit related work for the Office of the Attorney General - Audit Division, a state agency with over 4000 employees. Work involves non-audit and audit activities related to conducting organizational studies and evaluations, conducting work simplification studies, and recommending potential enhancements to operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. OAG employees enjoy excellent benefits along with tremendous opportunities to do important work and make a positive difference in the lives of all Texans.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Performs audit-related activities under close supervision of an audit project manager or chief audit executive such as: participating in the planning and execution of the agency’s internal audit plan; assisting in researching, composing, designing or editing division reports and briefing documents or presentation materials; assisting in performance of simple-to-routine audits; assisting in statistical analysis of data as needed; organizing audit documentation and working papers; filing, photocopying, and transmitting information; scheduling audit meetings and phone conferences
Monitors and reviews current organizational, procedural, or operational systems as part of audit and non-audit services; conducts studies of employee or organizational efficiency and productivity and recommends changes or improvements in organization, staffing, work methods and procedures; prepares comprehensive technical records and reports to present and interpret data; works on special projects; collects and analyzes data through research in areas such as workload, administrative practices, staff utilization, organizational structure, or development
Participates in training curriculum development and conducts formal training courses on new methods and procedures
Performs related work as assigned
Maintains relevant knowledge necessary to perform essential job functions
Attends work regularly in compliance with agreed-upon work schedule
Ensures security and confidentiality of sensitive and/or protected information
Complies with all agency policies and procedures, including those pertaining to ethics and integrity

Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education: Graduation from high school or equivalent
Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; experience in the following (or closely related) fields may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis: accounting, business administration, finance, economics, management

Experience researching, analyzing and writing of reports or Web content related to state and/or local government data, financial data.
Experience with local, state and federal laws relating to public procurement.
Internship that included any of the above-preferred experiences.

Solid analytical and problem-solving skills

Capable Microsoft Excel user, including pivot tables, v-lookups, and joins

Enjoying learning; ability to thrive in an ever-evolving role

positionName: Data Analyst, Legal & Premier Partner Operations
description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Legal & Premier Partner Operations team protects and supports content creators and high-profile partners, creates a secure environment for rights owners, and upholds user privacy and data rights on the platform. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving complex problems, and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We are seeking an analytical and data-savvy self-starter with a passion for helping others, protecting our community and mitigating risk.

Effectively plan and collaborate with a global team on data driven initiatives to solve complex operational and integrity problems
Apply quantitative expertise to mine massive amounts of data and extract impactful insights that influence the strategy
Identify and drive scalable solutions for building infrastructure, dashboards and models to monitor and improve key performance metrics
Establish short and long-term goals that will advance the organization’s impact through data and analytics
Communicate data-driven results and recommendations clearly to technical and non-technical audience
Partner with Data Science, Legal, Partnerships, Product, Engineering, and Operations teams to manage multiple complex projects and solve problems at scale

B.A. or B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or equivalent experience
2+ years of professional experience, with a background in end-to-end project management and/or operations
2+ years experience in using SQL or equivalent
2+ years experience using statistical analysis languages (R, Python, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)

CNO Financial Group is hiring a Data and Reporting Analyst to provide our internal and external customers with routine and ad-hoc reporting as well as project level data analysis used to monitor performance metrics.
This is your opportunity to examine the impact of process changes, help production and management personnel better understand and identify risks, validate key assumptions, and support business decisions.
As a Data and Reporting Analyst, your responsibilities will include:
Gathering data and analyzing business and user reporting requirements in consultation with both business managers and end users.
Collecting, analyzing, mining and leveraging data stored in data warehouse universes and databases utilizing Alteryx Compiling detailed reports using data reporting tools such as Business Objects/Tableau and providing insights on based on their findings.
Performing quality assurance on reporting to ensure output as accurate and within control parameters.
Facilitation of collection and distribution of report inputs and commentary with the Operations Leadership Team (Directors / VPs).
Providing reporting support for regulatory and compliance activities.
Updating, modifying, developing and automating new reports using Business Objects, Excel, Tableau, Access, Alteryx.
Participating on cross-functional projects working with individual contributors as well senior managers.
Stays abreast of changes in reporting / analytic tools and techniques to grow and expand their capabilities.
The Data and Reporting Analyst position is well-suited for you if you:
Hold technical skills including Excel, Access, Power Point, Word, Business Objects or similar tool, R or SAS, Tableau, Alteryx or similar tool.
Effectively manage small to midsized report development projects.
Possess Strong, independent critical thinking skills.
Have strong verbal and written communication skills as it relates to presenting complex, fact-based analyses.
Thrive and are willing to work independently and as part of a team.

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative discipline.
A minimum of one year of data analysis experience preferably in Insurance, Financial Services or Operations Consulting role.

positionName: Senior Data Analyst - Post Market Surveillance
description:
As a healthcare company committed to protecting the health and safety for our employees, contractors, customers and communities, employees in this role are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless an accommodation has been granted for a medical reason or sincerely held religious belief.


Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.


As part of the One Agilent initiative and to sustain the company's growth, the organization is building and investing in a Complaint Management Center (CMC). You will be part of this first of its kind centralized approach for Agilent and as it continues to be a trusted leader in diagnostic life sciences and increases its footprint in the medical device space.

We seek an individual who is looking for an opportunity to work in a dynamic and progressive environment as a Data Analyst. In this role you will have the opportunity to develop and implement effective data analysis and visualization for all Post Market Surveillance product complaints within and support Agilent businesses. Activities would be in direct support of monitoring and detecting quality and safety signals associated with fielded product performance (e.g., adverse events, product malfunctions). The role ensures on-going regulatory, the quality of our products for our customers and can help serve to identify early signs of potential issues and contributes to continuous product/process improvements. You will have the ability to engage and work closely with Agilent's Quality and Regulatory teams as well as the Field Service Engineers, Product Support, Research & Development, and manufacturing organizations.

Come join our team of regulatory compliance professionals who are on the frontline of investigating global product performance, assuring Agilent's products are safe and effective for use for loved one's who are being diagnosed.

You are responsible for:
Managing the Post Market Surveillance trending processes and assuring proper statistical techniques are applied to all trending methods
Developing and deliver dashboards and data visualizations needed to optimally monitor Post Market Surveillance data to assure Patient Safety and Product Quality
Developing methods needed to effectively supervise PMS data to assure Patient Safety and Product Quality
Crafting reports for internal teams. Use graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize data
Establishing tools to analyze data, make acceptance decisions, and improve process capability (Six Sigma, Statistical Process Control (SPC), DOE)
Automating data analysis methods
Working with the various KPI owners to maintain oversight of all KPIs and ensuring accuracy of data reported to the leadership team
Assuring the data integrity of all output via appropriate verification and validation activities
Detailing statistical-based trending procedures and trending analysis validation in compliance with regulatory requirements
Developing and delivering training materials to aid teams with their understanding of statistical-based trending methods
Explaining statistical rationale and trending procedures during regulatory audits, if vital
Prioritizing requests for ad hoc data & reports
Translating data and trends into actions to drive business decisions
Build presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings
Help identify product trends and drive measurable insights

Summary
Posted: Jun 21, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200254722
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just craft products - they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. As a part of the AppleCare Support organization, you will ensure that we are delivering outstanding customer support experiences while also driving cost saving measures and organizational improvements.
Key Qualifications
Demonstrated experience with quantitative analysis, with an aptitude for synthesizing complex data into key components that drive informed decisions.
Strong writing, visualization and interpersonal skills with ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, detailed, and impactful manner to senior executives.
Comfortable working in positions of ambiguity with muddy data
Ability to work with and realize the limitations of small samples, in addition to working with large volumes of data.
Strong eye for business with the ability to see beyond the data to translate information into impactful business insight.
Flexible and able to multitask in a very dynamic environment regularly balancing ad-hoc requests with long term projects and initiatives.
Comfortable working cross-functionally, and across organizational levels in different geographies.
Description
This role will be tasked with analyzing data and processes to gain insights that improve operations of the global contact center support business. This will include synthesizing data and helping to align teams across our organization. You will become a subject matter expert in the related lines of business and use that knowledge, combined with your business acumen, to determine what is most important in the data and what we as a team should be focusing on. Through this, you will work to identify, evaluate, and prioritize opportunities to drive efficiency and build higher quality experiences for the customer. To perform this job, you possess strong analytical skills and can efficiently communicate your insight to the highest levels of the company. Strong public speaking and presentation skills are a requirement. You should be comfortable supporting, collaborating and communicating with senior leadership teams and a have a demonstrated ability to build solid working relationships through active listening, delivering promised results, and establishing trust. You will collaborate with many cross-functional teams in and out of AppleCare’s contact center. We’ll expect you to ask questions and challenge legacy processes — all in the aim of improving our AppleCare business.
Education & Experience
BA/BS in mathematics, economics, finance, statistics, engineering, operations research, or related quantitative social/physical science MBA/MS a plus
Additional Requirements
3+ years of data analytics experience.
Demonstrated ability with SQL and Tableau.
High level proficiency with Excel
Experience and familiarity with Apple's products also desired.

Position Purpose:
The Data Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis and reporting of client/customer data using complex analysis of datasets in areas of research, development, product enhancement or other targeted business objectives. This position will use advanced mathematical methods to analyze and interpret data from various sources with an outcome to solve critical business needs for internal or external clients. This position will ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices, gathering and entering missing data, and resolving any anomalies and use established statistical methods to determine data sources, sample sizes and appropriate methods to create and interpret reports.
Essential Job Responsibilities:
Performs analysis activities of current data to provide critical information to our internal and/or external clients. This data will help the business become more efficient, more targeted, and more responsive to our clients and/or customers. Success will be measured by successful implementation of recommendations and client satisfaction scores.
Collaborates with stakeholders (internal/external clients) and team members at all levels to clarify, detail, and manage reporting needs and activities.
Work independently on small, medium or large analytics with little supervision.
Understand where data comes from, able to utilize data to resolve business issues in the most effective manner providing best reporting through dashboards and other means of communication through data.
Generates client facing and operational performance reports, including Critical to Quality KPI’s
Proactively identifies performance metrics and recommends to business line
Six Sigma Green Belt (or ability to become on within 6 months)
Identify, recommend, and assist operation in automating manual operational processes to be measured by a minimum of 10% decrease in manual operations year over year
Proactively recommend operational efficiency and performance enhancements based upon data analysis to be measured by a minimum of 10% increase if efficiencies year over year
Participates in post-project and “Lessons Learned” for project wrap meeting and document for review and process consideration to recommending best course of action for continual improvement.
Will confirm project scoping for internal and external client solutions; communicate effectively to identify options, explain issues, recommend solutions, manage risks, and reduce escalations during project design and delivery
Design and develop structured and ad-hoc reports for operations analysis using the SSRS reporting environment and SQL
Analyze business requirements to design, model, and implement centralized data warehouses utilizing Visual Studio and SQL-T to develop in-depth cost savings analytics
Will provide solutions that improve business efficiency and enable access to data and total collaboration at the organization level in various formats including MS Office, SharePoint, and Robot Process Automation (RPA)
The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.
Required Qualifications:
Education:

Minimum Qualifications

Graduation with a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in a field related to the job.

Notes to Applicants
The Austin Transportation Department’s Vision Zero Program leads the coordination of community efforts to reduce traffic-related injuries and fatalities. We work with other City departments, County and State partners, nonprofits, and community advocates on a regular basis to make progress towards our goal. Our highly motivated and passionate team seeks someone who embraces this ambitious goal and is ready to make a significant contribution to saving lives in the Austin community. The Vision Zero Program has an opening for an IT Geospatial Analyst Sr. to address a core element of the overall safe systems approach of Austin’s Vision Zero program: Data Evaluation and Analysis. Significant program decisions depend on high quality data analysis to inform our initiatives and collaborations with ATD’s other divisions and other key partner agencies.
The IT GIS Analyst Sr. will perform regular and rigorous data analyses to identify opportunities to reduce the future occurrence of severe car crashes. The position will be responsible for developing reports and GIS-based applications to inform operational decision-making as well as informing the public. The recently adopted Austin Strategic Mobility Plan and Strategic Direction 2023 provide the policy guidance and define the performance measures for Vision Zero efforts.

The ideal candidate is passionate about achieving Vision Zero goals, has an in-depth understanding of data management best practices, is comfortable with flexibility, and can work in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. The candidate will bring curiosity and passion about data, geospatial visualization of data, and solving problems through robust analysis and creative strategic thinking.

Regarding your Application:

A detailed and complete employment application is required to help us better evaluate your qualifications and will be used to determine salary if you are selected for this position. Please list your complete employment history (to include all job duties responsibilities and employment dates) on your online application.
