Job Description:

We are looking for a skilled analyst who can use data to help us tell the story of Wayfair’s Security & IT Risk Management program using data, statistics, and analytics. This data analyst must have experience with a variety of data problems and be able to work towards solutions that address operational, business, and technical requirements. They will be expected to report and analyze the data and derive conclusions to highlight key takeaways and important trends. The analyst will work across teams to deliver data visibility through enhanced data reports and automated solutions that streamline the reporting process. The analyst will be expected to understand business requirements and deliver innovative solutions that inform on our current data processes and metrics. We are an organization interested in continuous improvements and growing the maturity of our reporting program; we need an innovative individual who can deliver quick results to address current needs, while simultaneously planning for future improvement and ways to enhance our processes.
What You’ll Do:

Deliver solutions to improve Security, Privacy, Identity Access, and Risk operational tasks by streamlining data access, reporting, and automation
Manage and update a monthly dashboard that highlights key performance indicators and trends across the Security & IT Risk teams
Implement innovative and automated data solutions that reduce labor and level of effort requirements
Perform exploratory data analyses to investigate data sets, capture key data findings, and propose solutions to stakeholders
Create and track relevant key risk metrics across teams to support the security and risk enterprise management programs and projects
Build reports to capture trends and design reporting dashboards to visualize metrics
Write scripts or data pipelines to extract, combine, and analyze data from multiple systems
Establish conclusive evidence, supported by data, to present to senior management

What You’ll Need:
At least 2-5 years of data analytics experience
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in a related field or equivalent work experience
Extensive spreadsheet experience required (pivot tables, functions, and visualizations)
Experience with SQL joins, aggregations, pivots, window functions, and other advanced functionality required (Google BigQuery SQL, PostgreSQL and/or T-SQL are a plus).
Python or other programming skills preferred for enhanced data analytics and process automation
Preferred experience with visualization data tools (Looker, Data Studio, Tableau, etc.)
Experience with data extraction, manipulation,and blending across different data sources to build new data sets
Highly analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving difficult problems
Familiarity with different database schemas (structured & unstructured), ETL processes, ability to work with large data sets
Familiarity with concepts related to Docker, Kubernetes, and other microservice development tools are a plus.
Experience with reporting in RSA Archer or similar GRC tools is a plus.
Ability to hit the ground running – a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter
Possess an affinity for data, and resourcefulness in obtaining data when clean and or complete information is not available
Rudimentary understanding of statistical concepts
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience working with cross-functional business and engineering stakeholders
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and resources with a sense of urgency
Success working in fast-paced, innovative, agile, global culture
About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.

Company Description
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description
Client Services works with issuers, acquirers, processors, and merchants worldwide to develop and deliver on our commitment to be the best way to pay and be paid. To deliver on this critical mission, we must continually assess and improve our performance both internally and how we support our clients.
Reporting to the Director of Service Level Management within the Global Service Excellence function, this role will help transform data into actionable insights that drive both internal business and client value. In this role, you will use strong analytical skills, contextual business sense and a creative flair to develop robust data assets, reporting capabilities, and KPI dashboards to monitor and report on the service level performance for Visa’s products and services, whilst uncovering critical insights to ensure our clients satisfaction is maintained.
Architect and build data assets, reporting tools, and dashboards utilizing Visa’s big data capabilities
Provide automated or streamlined solutions for our data and reporting service level management needs
Analyze data to draw accurate conclusions regarding product and services performance, trends, and issues (current and/or potential)
Use experience, expertise, and data analysis to collaborate with manager, team members and stakeholders in the identification of corrective action to increase efficiency, improve performance and meet or exceed targets.
Provide information to convey trends, consumption, and performance consistently and succinctly to leadership, business partners and clients
Configure new Service Level Agreements within tool and ensure linkage to Operational Level Agreements
Manage and triage service level requests

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Requires minimum of 2 or more years of experience working in analytics or related field, and a 4-year advanced college degree (e.g. bachelor’s or Master)Strong analytical ability with proven proficiency in synthesizing data into meaningful and digestible data points and actions, with SQL skills requiredExperience with automation is mandatoryExperience visualizing data with Tableau is highly desirable or familiarity with similar tools such as Power BI, MicroStrategy, etc. are nice to haveFamiliarity with CRM tools such Microsoft Dynamics and ServiceNow are good to haveDemonstrated ability to communicate clearly and persuasively (verbal and written) ideas, issues, and recommendations.Experience in working with clients and stakeholders located at different geographies of the worldMust be proficient in all MS Office applications with advanced Excel spreadsheet skills
Strong, proven ability to multi-task
Preferred Qualifications
3 or more years of work experience in analytics or related field with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
Additional Information
Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department
Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.
Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

positionName: Industry Solutions Data and Program Senior Analyst
description:
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. About IDEA Public Schools:
At IDEA Public Schools, we believe in college for ALL and we are committed to ensuring that all our students graduate from college. IDEA Public Schools has grown from a small school to the fastest-growing network of tuition-free Pre-K-12 public charter schools in the United States sending 100% of our students to college. 50% of our students graduate from college in 6 years – that’s 8 times the national rate for students in our communities!


IDEA was founded in 2000 as a single school with 150 students in the Rio Grande Valley. When interest exceeded building capacity, to meet the demands, IDEA’s co-founders committed to serving more students in the Rio Grande Valley of Texas and beyond. We now serve nearly 53,000 students across Texas and Louisiana. By 2022, IDEA will serve 100,000 students. Be on the lookout for IDEA schools opening near you—with continued growth in our current regions and new launches in Houston (2020), Permian Basin (2020), and Tampa Bay (2021)!
When you choose to work at IDEA, you are part of our IDEA Team and Family. You will work alongside team members who set and reach ambitious goals every day, are excited to continue to grow with IDEA, and work relentlessly to make college for all a reality.
To learn more about IDEA, check out this video.
Role Mission: The Human Resources/New Hires (HR/NH) Data Analyst supports the Talent Acquisition team by developing the data infrastructure that allows the team to make data-driven decisions around effectiveness, efficiency, and equity of our staff onboarding, policy application, substitutes, discipline, separation and retention efforts. This is accomplished through developing and maintaining dashboards and reports that are user-friendly and accessible to a broader audience, understanding processes and making recommendations for improvement, and providing meaningful analysis and insights to drive the work of our Human Assets team.
Accountabilities
Develop, maintain, refine, and manage Human Resources and New Hires dashboards

Internalize our onboarding, new hires, substitutes, performance management, offboarding and retention processes and metrics
Provide efficient strategies for our team to collect the appropriate data
Understand data and their uses in order to make recommendations about the best ways to visualize data for stakeholders
Develop reports to compile the relevant data and insights on a weekly and/or monthly basis (depending on the metric)
Continually improve dashboards and reports based on feedback and trends
Provide training and support to the team to ensure that data is being leveraged appropriately
Deeply understand the what, why, how, and when of the goals
Refine and manage current dashboards
Partner across the HR, New Hires, EIS, Tech Ops, Payroll, Schools team and Budget teams to maximize dashboard effectiveness
Analyze data for gaps in equity

Analyze discipline, exit, substitute and onboarding data with the lens of equity
Work with Staffing Analyst to determine gaps on new hire retention based on lines of difference and generate hypothesis on such gaps by region and/or functional groups.
Mine for actionable insight
Communicate gaps found and problem solve with team leaders to address them
We look for Team and Family who embody the following values and characteristics:

Believes and is committed to our mission and being an agent of change: that all students are capable of getting to and through college
Has demonstrated effective outcomes and results, and wants to be held accountable for them
Has a propensity for action, willing to make mistakes by doing in order to learn and improve quickly
Works with urgency and purpose to drive student outcomes
Thrives in an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment; is comfortable with ambiguity and change
Seeks and responds well to feedback, which is shared often and freely across all levels of the organization
Works through silos and forges strong cross-departmental relationships in order to achieve outcomes
We believe in education as a profession and hold ourselves to high level of conduct, professionalism and behaviors as models for our colleagues and students.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree required
Experience: 2+ years of professional experience in a data analysis and management role
Knowledge and Skills:
Efficient computer skills with thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office
Advanced to expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel and/or other data tools to analyze data and provide appropriate visualizations and insights
SQL experience preferred
Experience working with HRIS, ATS and Talent Management software preferred
Ability to work across diverse teams in a high-growth organization
Ability to work with numbers in an accurate and rapid manner
Ability to read, analyze, and apply mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference
Ability to research, analyze, report and make sound judgments and work on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation
Strong work ethic with personal drive for success exemplifying “whatever it takes” attitude in a high-growth organization
Attention to detail
Excellent customer service skills, both written and oral, and maintain confidentiality in all matters.

About Us


At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About the Role

Are you curious by nature and passionate about data, analytics, and digital marketing? We are looking for a rock-star data analyst, who will offer analysis and insights to help us acquire customers at scale. As a data analyst, you will help streamline and maintain reporting, data analysis deliverables, pipeline, and processes. You will extensively interact with other teams such as Sales, Sales Operations, Product, and Finance. Your input will help shape business decisions and marketing budget investments.

Responsibilities

Leverage data through SQL to understand and identify areas of growth for in-depth paid marketing channel performance across different regions and countries
Extract and analyze data to interpret the impact of tests on marketing performance (e.g. number of leads, cost per acquisition, pipeline growth, ROI)
Collaborate with regional marketers to analyze campaign performance and global pipeline growth
Create reports/dashboards using BI tools like Tableau by compiling data from different platforms (Salesforce, Marketo, Google Analytics, etc.)
Document key findings for growth opportunities. Conduct ad-hoc analyses on key areas of the business

Requirements

5+ years of analytics experience at fast-growing technology companies, preferably with B2B business models.
Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools like Tableau
Prior work or academic experience with SQL and data visualization tools like Tableau
Analytically inclined, exceptional organizational skills, with rigorous attention to detail
Passion for delivering actionable insights
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to learn and thrive in a fast-paced environment

Bonus points

Hands-on experience with Salesforce reports
Prior internship experience in a high growth company in the SaaS, security, or network space, combined with knowledge of how the Internet works is a plus

What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers-at no cost.

Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!

We’re constantly working towards making Canva the best place to work, for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community all around the world. We celebrate uniqueness and whatever makes you, you and encourage everyone who wants to help us transform the way the world designs, to join us on this journey. We value all different types of experiences. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we’d still love to hear from you.
About Us
At Canva, our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.
Since launch in August 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 60 million monthly active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 6 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we want to do.
This role is part of the Business Systems team within Information Technology (“IT”) that drives secure and scalable adoption of technologies that enable Canva’s scale. As part of IT you will be on the ground floor of a rapidly expanding team as we aim to radically innovate the foundational infrastructure of our technology supporting critical groups throughout the business.
As Canva grows, there is an increasing need to provide stakeholders in the business with timely, accurate and granular data enabling agile decisions to be made as required.
What you'll do:
Partner with various teams to understand their needs and challenges in order to deliver projects that will allow them to focus more on people and less on process
Get to the core of problems in order to define unambiguous requirements and propose solutions that will address the root cause and not the symptoms
Bring clarity to chaos by understanding and documenting processes in order to identify opportunities for optimization
Work closely with vendors to evaluate their offerings and ensure they will meet the requirements of the business
Present your analysis and proposals to key stakeholders and guide alignment on the best path forward
Collaborate with members of the Business Systems team on the implementation and verification of requirements
What we are looking for:
3+ years of experience in a role where analyzed, proposed and delivered projects that improved how the business worked
An eager learner who can pick up new skills quickly
Experience gathering requirements and documenting processes while coordinating with cross-departmental and non technical teams
An understanding of how systems can be used to improve delivery
Curiosity and a desire to understand the root cause of problems
Bias for action with a focus on delivering value
Strong communication and organization skills
Proven ability to work in fast-paced, ever changing environment
Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas
Natural curiosity for learning
As part of the Business Systems team you will have the opportunity to:
Gain experience working at one of the world’s fastest growing tech companies; your work will impact millions of Canva’s global users
Learn from and work with some of Canva’s best talent, including Canva’s founders, engineers, product & growth professionals
Develop and grow in a newly created role with the ability to make and support decisions that impact the development of the business
Being a Force for good. One of our core values at Canva, “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few, but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. To achieve this, we need to constantly work towards making Canva the best place to work, for everyone.
We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. If you’re keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

positionName: Advanced Data Insight Analyst II (Product Analytics)
description:
Advanced Data Insight Analyst II (Product Analytics)
Are you passionate about uncovering opportunities to improve the customer experience and conversion through the power of data?
Expedia Group is a truly data-driven company and as such we use data to support every decision. We use analytics methods that range from simple to very sophisticated, depending on the business need.
What you’ll do:
We are looking for a motivated, hardworking individual to be part of the Expedia Product Analytics Team that enables product optimization for 80+ localized websites in 35+ languages. In this exciting role, you will contribute to the team’s success in analyzing, measuring, and evaluating the performance of our websites and mobile apps. Success in this role requires a data driven approach to understanding the opportunities to optimize the product experience across a broad customer base in the context of a growing and increasingly varied product portfolio.
This role will partner with our product, technology, and customer teams, providing meaningful behavioral insights to deliver material improvements to business performance through fast and effective change. Your responsibilities will primarily focus on Product Analysis in relation to the optimization of our onsite customer experience. This ranges from the definition and application of product success metrics to owning live-site experiments (AB/Multivariate) which includes test conceptualization, analysis, and recommendations.
Who you are:
Experienced in conversion optimization
A sharp focus on getting results and insights using the fastest and most practical approach (even if it’s not the most complicated)
Experience of data analysis using (at least one of) Qubole/R/Python/Spark (Notebooks)
Experience of data visualizations tools using (at least one of) Tableau/Adobe Analytics/ Power BI/ Mixpanel
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present the business value of analysis concisely and clearly
Experience with online experimentation via proprietary or off-the-shelf products (e.g. SiteSpect, Test&Target, Optimizely, Maxymizer etc.) is preferred
Excellent logical thinking, a very strong background in a quantitative field such as mathematics, physics, engineering, operations research, data science or similar field
Demonstrates a scientific approach to problem-solving (i.e. ability to ask the right questions and craft appropriate analyses to answer them)
Expertise in Web Analytics, using Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics Premium
Ability to perform in a fast paced, active environment
High energy and a can-do attitude
Curiosity and passion for making an impact. Combining this with strong attention to detailLI – MS1
About Expedia Group
Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, Egencia®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

positionName: Administrative Assistant IV – Data Analyst Assistant/Technical Assistant
description: General Description: Provides advanced administrative and technical support to the Office of the Chief Disciplinary Counsel in the maintenance, management, and dissemination of data related to the attorney discipline process. This position involves frequent contact with State Bar departments, the Texas Supreme Court, attorneys, the general public and other external agencies and organizations.Primary Functions: 1. Statewide responsibility with respect to the final discipline judgment closing process, coordinating with staff statewide from the entry of a disciplinary judgment to file closing. Ensures timely and accurate dissemination of related information to appropriate entities, including the Texas Supreme Court, the American Bar Association’s National Databank.2. Updates and corrects sanction and case information maintained in the Case Management System.3. Responsible for the statewide database file retention records management, including updates and revisions to current retention schedules.4. Prepares statistical and informational reports for dissemination to stakeholders to the Texas attorney discipline system and in response to public information requests.5. Responsible for updating and maintaining the case management software standard operating procedures manual for the attorney discipline system.6. Assists with training employees on the case management software, and provides routine technical assistance to department employees, troubleshooting software problems.7. Researches and drafts responses to requests to expunge records of dismissed grievances received from Texas attorneys.8. Performs other responsibilities as required.Position Requirements: Graduation from an accredited four-year college preferred. Minimum of four years of related administrative, technical, office experience preferred. Experience in using case management software, knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of computer databases, and experience in preparing statistical reports is required. Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and Access. Skill in problem solving ad critical thinking. Must be able to communicate effectively and professionally on the telephone, in person, and in writing. Must be proficient in typing. Requires attention to detail, critical thinking, and the ability to perform responsibilities with minimal supervision. Requires exceptional customer service skills. Requires knowledge of personal computers, Word software, filing systems, telephone systems, and scanning/fax equipment. Requires valid Texas driver’s license.Job Type: Full-timeWork Location: Multiple Locations

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
We are searching for a Digital Marketing Web Analyst to join our Marketing Analytics team! We drive clarity and insight through reporting and analytics into WP Engine’s digital marketing initiatives and global website properties. This role will own website tagging and data acquisition and will work closely with internal digital marketing channel owners to hone targeting and budget strategies. You will work closely with WP Engine’s web development, product and marketing teams for website and targeting data collection and strategies. Digital Marketing Analyst will be highly analytical, deeply detailed, strive for consistent data accuracy across multiple systems, and effectively work across the company to drive business results.
A look at your day-to-day:
Empower marketing channel owners (email, paid search, organic search, social, affiliate, display, retargeting) with impactful insights to drive website performance.
A/B Testing: Identify and help structure test opportunities, and collaborate with the Finance and Website Teams to design, implement and analyze.
Analyze key site metrics such as website traffic, conversion rate, average order value, and units per transaction. Break these metrics into defined funnel steps to develop focused targets.
Own site data acquisition through Google Tag Manager, and set processes for campaign tracking. Work with developers to implement new tracking and ensure current tagging is consistent and accurate.
System Owner for Google Analytics implementation including data governance, tagging, user settings/permissions, etc.
Build out sophisticated reporting and segmentation using different visualization tools, including real-time dashboards, user-level reporting, and blending with non-GA data sources.
About you:
You go out of your way to level up those around you about the significance of data.
You have excellent Communication, Collaboration and Presentation skills
Strong sense of prioritization and focus on key business drivers
You have a proven capability in e-commerce, website, marketing or digital analytics role
Expert knowledge of Google Tag Manager, including Server Side, Google Analytics or related site metrics ecosystem (Adobe Analytics, etc)
Advanced Excel knowledge, including nested formulas, lookups, pivot tables, flexible models, and macros
Proficient in SQL and comfortable with querying and sanitizing data from relational databases, including Google BigQuery
Advanced experience using Looker (or other BI tool) with LookML, table calculations, dimensions, measures, etc.
Experience with JavaScript, HTML, Python, SQL, dbt, Google Cloud is a plus.
The Perks and Benefits:
Stock Options (Every employee is an owner in the company)
Health Benefits (100% Paid Employee Medical, Dental, and Vision)
Fertility Benefits (IVF/Fertility drug coverage)
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a match
Life and Disability Insurance
Paid Family and Caregiver’s Leave
Employee Assistance Program

One-time $500 Home Office Stipend
Company Wellness Days
Wellness Program

positionName: DDS Spec Proj Sys Analyst V
description:
DDS Spec Proj Sys Analyst V

This position is part of the Data and Decision Support (DDS) division within the Office of Data and Systems Improvement (DSI). The DSI mission is to ensure effective coordination, communication and consistency around data reporting and how it’s used in understanding and improving performance and outcomes. DDS supports that mission by suppling data and SQL based / Tableau based reports that empower DFPS leadership and stakeholders to the best decisions backed by relevant, high-quality information. The person in this position reports to manager of the DDS Business Intelligence and Special Projects team (BISP).


Essential Job Functions:
We’re looking for someone who wants to dedicate their data and reporting skills to serving and protecting the most vulnerable Texans. Someone who is excited to be a part of an established team of highly skilled, capable, and motivated individuals. We want someone who is intellectually curious, wanting to understand not just what is happening but why, and who’s not afraid to think outside the box for innovative and new ways of doing things. At DDS we take the data collected during the critical field work done by DFPS, and work to make that data available and digestible in order to help the agency make better data driven decisions.


The specific job functions:
- The person in this position will develop a variety of reports and visualizations in an understandable, useable format. They will assist in the development and deployment of the DFPS online interactive data book. They will also use their flexible skill set to complete many other special projects assigned to the unit.
-The person in this position will help troubleshoot advanced technical issues and provide excellent customer support to staff with questions about agency dashboards.
- The person in this position will extract data from IMPACT, PIERS, CAPPS (HR) and other agency and external databases, and documents, designs, validates and implements reports for multiple areas of specialization using selected DFPS methodology and reporting tools, such as with Tableau Desktop and SQL queries.
- The person in this position will review work products of other analysts and will interact routinely DFPS staff and analysts to ensure requirements are met and work products are appropriately validated.
- The person in this position may train or mentor other analysts in DDS.


- -The person in this position will perform their job duties remotely (telework, work from home) and will keep regular work hours in accordance with agency policy.



Knowledge Skills Abilities:
We’re looking for someone who wants to dedicate their data and reporting skills to serving and protecting the most vulnerable Texans. Someone who is excited to be a part of an established team of highly skilled, capable, and motivated individuals. We want someone who is intellectually curious, wanting to understand not just what is happening but why, and who’s not afraid to think outside the box for innovative and new ways of doing things. At DDS we take the data collected during the critical field work done by DFPS, and work to make that data available and digestible in order to help the agency make better data driven decisions.


The specific job functions:
- The person in this position will develop a variety of reports and visualizations in an understandable, useable format. They will assist in the development and deployment of the DFPS online interactive data book. They will also use their flexible skill set to complete many other special projects assigned to the unit.
-The person in this position will help troubleshoot advanced technical issues and provide excellent customer support to staff with questions about agency dashboards.
- The person in this position will extract data from IMPACT, PIERS, CAPPS (HR) and other agency and external databases, and documents, designs, validates and implements reports for multiple areas of specialization using selected DFPS methodology and reporting tools, such as with Tableau Desktop and SQL queries.
- The person in this position will review work products of other analysts and will interact routinely DFPS staff and analysts to ensure requirements are met and work products are appropriately validated.
- The person in this position may train or mentor other analysts in DDS.


- -The person in this position will perform their job duties remotely (telework, work from home) and will keep regular work hours in accordance with agency policy.




Knowledge of DFPS programs and operations.


Skill in using selected software such as Tableau Desktop, SQL, PL/SQL, Excel, TOAD and/or Oracle SQL Developer.


Ability to effectively manage workload and work schedule while working remotely.


Knowledge of relational databases.


Ability to be customer service focused.


Ability to analyze systems, procedures and troubleshoot problems to help develop solutions.


Ability to perform detailed work accurately.


Ability to learn and apply new technology.


Ability to draft concise reports, with visual representations, and to make oral presentations to a variety of audiences.


Experience extracting, organizing, quality checking and managing datasets.


Ability to work constructively in a team, and on one's own.


Ability to adapt and modify behavior in response to changes in situations or priorities.


Promotes and demonstrates appropriate respect for cultural diversity among coworkers and all work-related contacts.


Attends work regularly in accordance with agency leave policy.


Performs other duties as assigned and required to maintain unit operations.



Registration or Licensure Requirements:


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university, with a relevant degree such as research, statistics, social sciences, public administration, policy analysis, computer science, computer information systems or management information systems. Master's degree preferred.


Minimum of 5 years of experience in data extraction and report layout and design. Minimum of 3 years of applied experience analyzing data using various software. Experience with writing SQL and/or PL/SQL, and building complex reports using Tableau Desktop. Minimum 1 year of experience working at DFPS or in a state agency setting.


Additional Information:
Requisition Number 499973


Applicants selected for an interview will be required to complete a written exercise to demonstrate knowledge, skills, and abilities.

positionName: HR Data & Reporting Analyst - Spectrum Networks
description:
** This position can be based out of any station within the Spectrum Networks footprint **


JOB SUMMARY
The HR Data & Reporting Analyst is responsible for analyzing processes and data. Assists the team in identifying and reporting on trends and patterns found within the data, and makes recommendations for business and process improvement. Works with business users to understand requirements and expectations for permanent and ad hoc requests, to meet the analytical data needs of the business unit.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.

Demonstrate consultative and client-oriented approach to the HR data analysis and interpretation


Assist with interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources for use in analysis and trending

Responsible for identifying what reporting solutions will fulfill business unit needs

Experienced in handling confidential data by following security/confidentiality standards

Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

Produce ad hoc reports to answer business questions quickly and thoroughly. Create reports and data driven presentations


Drive process efficiencies/best practices which promote data integrity and ensure delivery of accurate reporting of data

Work independently with internal clients to determine their reporting requirements


Assist with the investigation and perform root cause analysis.

Define, document, implement and track process flows for all processes, procedures, and policies for the department

Interact with cross-functional teams to ensure business processes and rules are aligned, adjusting documentation accordingly

Document processes using Microsoft Office Suite of tools including Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc.

Interact with internal teams to ensure systems/tools are in accordance with business processes and rules; adjust systems/documentation accordingly

Perform a cross-functional role to facilitate business process changes with stakeholders in other departments

Assist with working with stakeholders to support the integration of new processes, into existing operations.

Audit and recommend updates to existing methods, procedures and process documentation on an as needed basis

Participate in developing and communicate tips, tricks and best practices to support goals

Participate in process requirements, planning and validation through operational testing to ensure plan changes meet business sponsor needs

Manage the process review and signoff of new methods and procedures

Support testing and roll out of all projects/process improvements that impact the department

Understand policies, procedures and practices for analysis of business performance and impact

Identify trends and occurrences in data and translate findings into various mediums including text, charts, graphs, displays and tables

Perform other duties as requested by management

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge

Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Knowledge of HR database/reporting systems

Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

Ability to self-train and pick up new skills quickly
Advanced skills using PC software applications (Access, Excel and PowerPoint)
Ability to create and maintain spreadsheets
Commitment to quality service through appropriate follow through, urgency and persistence
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to present information in an understandable format
Ability to effectively consult with department managers and leaders
Attention to detail and ability to problem solve
HR acumen and technical aptitude, with proven experience in reporting HR/HRIS
Ability to multitask
Ability to prioritize and organize effectively
Knowledge of local, state and federal laws regarding employment
Working knowledge of HRMS database systems
Maintain working knowledge of all HR areas (i.e. Benefits, Talent Acquisition, Training, Compensation)

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field or equivalent experience

Related Work Experience

3+ years of Business Analyst/Data Analyst experience

1+ years of HRIS and Applicant Tracking System experience


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Related Work Experience

1 year of PeopleSoft and BrassRing

1 year of Data collection and database design experience


WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment HDA315 288380-5 288380BR

Who we are: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.
Job Description Summary: The Compensation Analyst will have primary responsibility for carrying out activities in support of PayPal’s annual rewards cycle, the market pricing function, and job architecture design and maintenance.
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Support the annual and ongoing global rewards cycle in Workday including requirements documentation, system and program administration, user acceptance testing, data audits, rewards letters.
Participate in annual global market pricing activities, analyzing market data to develop and maintain salary ranges, short-term incentive targets and equity ranges based on established compensation strategy. Develop employee impact and costing analysis.
Conduct ad hoc benchmarking analysis as needed for new or changing roles or to address specific market concerns.
Prepare and submit data to multiple third-party surveys, collect data output, manage invoicing and payment.
Serve as day-to-day owner of compensation software MarketPay. Update, maintain, and ensure the accuracy of data. Create reports and analytics to meet internal needs.
Partner with the Compensation Operations team to ensure Workday is updated to reflect needed changes to job profiles, salary structures, bonus and equity targets, etc.
Serve as project team member in support of job architecture and leveling project and initiatives, including analytical and systems support on any changes to the career level framework.
Lead or participate in other compensation-related project and activities.
Requirements:
5 + years of compensation related experience preferably within the technology industry
Proven success in market pricing and knowledge of global job architecture mechanics
Experience with job analysis, benchmarking and market pricing. Experience with Radford a plus
Advanced Excel skills are required to analyze data and create meaningful, understandable models and reports; ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound decision-making
Must be organized with the ability to multi-task and prioritize
Strong communication skills and ability to partner and work cross-functionally
Experience supporting internal customers, such as compensation partners and HRBPs to support business initiatives
Preferred:
Experience with Workday especially the advanced compensation module
Experience with MarketPay
Experience working with a multinational company
CCP certification
For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

positionName: Data Analyst, Scaled Ops Technology, Analytics & Reporting
description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Global Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. Scaled Operations (within Global Operations) manages the human expertise required for the integrity and experience of our community and business. If you like helping people, Global Operations is for you.Scaled Ops, Technology, Analytics and Reporting is focused on surfacing strategic problems, building technology and analytics solutions, and making actionable recommendations to support a large global partner workforce. We’re looking for an analyst with strong analytics and collaboration skills to join our growing, global team. You’ll have the opportunity to do exciting, impactful, and highly visible work that directly impacts Facebook Global Operations.

Independently plan, lead and perform analysis of data and trends to provide actionable insights
Proactively make recommendations for improving tools/processes and influencing/supporting Scaled Ops strategy
Effectively plan and collaborate with a global team on analytics projects to solve complex operational problems
Collaborate with Operations, Engineering and data-focused teams (DS, DE etc.) to solve problems, influence solution development, and identify opportunities
Develop and monitor key metrics of the org, and perform root cause analysis

5+ years of experience in solving large problems using data and analytics
4+ years of hands-on experience using programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R
Hands-on experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Basic understanding of project management fundamentals and experience leading data-centric projects across a wide cross-functional landscape
Experience explaining technical concepts to both technical and business partners

The Sales Tools and Enablement team provides Global Sales and Marketing (GSM) with tools and analysis to optimize Sales productivity, effectiveness, and enhance decision making. The team implements solutions through third-party software platforms and services as well as through custom development. Implementations encompass the full lifecycle from process design and procurement through training and operational support. The solution environment includes advanced analytics, business intelligence (BI) reports and dashboards, Salesforce CRM, targeted Excel VBA applications, as well as Azure SQL and Teradata databases and cubes. The team adheres to agile principles to deliver continuous and optimal value to our internal customers in response to dynamic changes in business requirements.
Job Description
Enhances the effectiveness and agility of the Global Sales and Marketing (GSM) organization and thus contributes to revenue and margin growth.
Collaborates in cross-functional project teams with stakeholders in Sales, Marketing, Operations, IT, and external vendors.
Builds in-depth business function and technical knowledge and identifies opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Gathers cross-functional business requirements and communicates solution designs.
Implements and supports Excel VBA business applications that consolidate inputs from global Sales users.
Implements SQL database models and procedures, and safeguards Sales data through effective data security.
Leverage SQL, BI tools, and Excel to produce ad-hoc data analyses and presentations.
Employs Advanced Analytics tools and methodologies to identify opportunities for revenue growth and process improvements.
Provides training and support to the Global Sales and Marketing organizations.
Evaluates new platforms, tools, and features.
Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Masters degrees or similar work experience.
Experience with application development and configuration management in SQL, Excel VBA, or other programming languages. Alternatively, demonstrated in-depth technical development experience and a willingness to acquire new programming languages. Experience in Salesforce and Azure are a plus.
Knowledge in methods and tools to wrangle and analyze large sets of data, including statistical methods. Knowledge in advanced analytics tools, such Python, R, Einstein Plus, Dataiku a plus.
Experience with BI tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, and/or Salesforce dashboards.
Experience with business analysis methods to gather and document requirements.
Collaborate successfully as a team member. Willingness and flexibility to perform tasks and fill roles as necessary for the project and team success.

Facebook is seeking an experienced analyst responsible for gathering, sharing and ensuring the integrity of the location data used by partner teams. The successful candidate will be an energetic, highly driven, solution-focused individual that can work well with internal and external partners at the highest levels of the organization. Simply put, this role is responsible for ensuring that the teams creating and directing the location strategy have the tools and data necessary to do their job.

Establish FCS as an equal partner for providing input and key data points to support Facebook’s location strategy decision making processes
Serve as the central point for all of FCS’s data efforts around location strategy pulling information from FCS leaders as well as acting as the main POC for the People Analytics and Workforce Strategy (PAWS), Location Strategy, Finance, and Mission Control teams
Establish a centralized program, dataset and research capability for all data around location strategy globally. Key data points include: Headcount data and forecasting (long-range planning), Portfolio data (current locations, capacities, costs), Market Data (costs/trends in market, availability), and Additional overlays: commute times, serviced offices, cost of living, indirect costs
Lead the development of two FCS datasets: one for existing sites and one that can be incorporated into the PAWS location model for future sites: Partner with FCS transaction teams to build a custom dataset that uses market data for future locations and create a survey for FCS leadership to identify a list of items to add to and prioritize in a location model (commute times, housing prices, public transit access, etc.)
Leverage FCS dataset to support semi-annual LRP discussions and roll-up
Support a globally consistent data-driven location strategy approach across the FCS organization
In partnership with People Analytics and Workforce Strategy (PAWS), support the establishment of a Location Strategy Governance Board that meets quarterly
Serve on the Location Strategy Governance Board and participate in all location strategy meetings — both tech location strategy and Biz/GMS
Establish a communication plan for all relevant FCS stakeholders to ensure relevant information data points, and decisioning from Governance Board and location strategy meetings is shared back with key internal FCS teams (i.e., Regional Leads, Space Planning, Transactions, etc.)
Identify economic development opportunities for new locations
Collaborate with internal business partners and stakeholders (e.g., Finance, HR, Mission Control, Space Planning Transactions, Portfolio Management, etc.) to continually evaluate and improve FCS location strategy program

10+ years in commercial real estate research, transactions management or related experience
Experience interpreting and implementing policies and processes
Experience with leveraging data analytics and using automation for monitoring
Experience building working relationships across the organization and with outside vendors
Experience leading and motivating teams

Business Analyst II


The Texas Department of Family and Protective Services (DFPS) is currently seeking a Business Analyst for a full-time position within the Systems Development Resources (SDR) team of our IT Department. This position will work collaboratively with the business stakeholders and the development teams related to the agency program IT requests. The position will perform complex (journey-level) business analysis work that includes coordination of the gathering, development, and documentation of user requirements, facilitation of work sessions with functional staff and project team members to capture and document requirements, and review and assessment of business processes to ensure requirements meet the customer needs. This position also develops user acceptance testing scripts, coordinates testing activities with customers, and validates testing results. This position will be assigned to various large and small projects based on availability and project schedules.


Serving under one of the Application Development supervisors, this position will work in concert with appropriate stakeholders on IT solutions and business decisions to support the organization’s short- and long-term business goals/strategy to ensure they align with IT strategies and project requirements. Good communication and presentation skills are required for developing documentation, reports, and presentations.


The mission of DFPS is to protect children, the elderly, and people with disabilities from abuse, neglect, and exploitation by involving clients, families, and communities. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm to get behind our mission of protecting those among us who are most in need.


This position is classified as a full-time position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular hours may be required. Travel to other Austin offices(s) may be required. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.


This position is a full-time position that includes other State of Texas benefits as described in this SAO site: http://www.sao.texas.gov/SAOReports/ReportNumber?id=18-704


Essential Job Functions:
Works with business stakeholders to understand their technology needs and issues in performing their day-to-day work.

Conducts work sessions with users and project team members to document requirements, develop use cases, and/or technology solutions.

Analyzes program policies and business practices to provide recommendations and ideas for addressing technology requests, needs, and solutions.

Assists project team members with analysis and interpretation of user requirements.

Develops and executes test scripts for application testing activities with test analysts and users.

Creates, edits, and maintains technical documentation for current and future applications e.g., technical reference manuals and production control manuals.

Assists, and may train, users within programs with user acceptance testing activities.

Develops Use Case documentation.

Participates in systems analysis as needed.

Works with developers to interpret and provide clarification on Use Cases as needed.

Assists with change request documentation as appropriate.

Participates in release activities and application development implementation activities.

Assists with scheduling go-live activities.

Maintains current knowledge of policy, procedure, and legislative updates that can affect needs for new requirements and application functionality.

Act as subject-matter-expert for assigned DFPS applications.

May participate in and provide feedback on quality reviews on project related documents.

Performs other special projects as assigned.


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK).

Knowledge of information gathering techniques with demonstrated experience for developing findings and recommendations from data collection.

Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Life Cycle (PMLC) methodologies; high-level system design methodologies and techniques (entity/relationship models, data/process flow diagrams); object-oriented programming and of programming client/server applications.

Knowledge of 508 compliance and accessibility standards established by the Americans with Disabilities ACT (ADA).

Knowledge of Case Management applications a plus but not required.

Knowledge of office productivity software including Microsoft Office Suite to include MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, SharePoint, Visio and/or SQL.

Knowledge of Texas Project Delivery Framework preferred.

Skill in analyzing business processes and developing business cases for new or modified customer-related products and services.

Skills in meeting facilitation and presentations for meetings involving cross functional teams and including external stakeholders.

Skills in problem solving with project issues and risks, and with software and network systems.

Skills in using office productivity software including Microsoft Office Suite to include MS Project, SharePoint, and Visio.

Skills with demonstrated experience in documenting technical and business concepts and conclusions orally and in writing.

Ability to understand programming concepts, operating systems and/or networking.

Ability to collaborate with other members of formal and informal groups to reach common missions, vision, values, and mutual goals.

Ability to communicate with all team members and stakeholders; technical teams and customers; work in a team setting.

Ability to manage multiple tasks, projects and priorities.

Ability to analyze and interpret program and technical information including regulations, policies, and business rules to aid in DFPS IT program goal and priority setting.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.


Registration or Licensure Requirements:
CBAP or similar Business Analyst certification is a plus but not required.


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, MIS, CIS, Computer Science or similar. Work experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis.

CBAP or similar Business Analyst certification is a plus but not required.


Note: You must meet the minimum initial screening criteria to be considered. You should not apply if your submittal documents do not clearly reflect experience meeting the initial screening criteria.


Additional Information:
Requisition# 491851.


Not applicable

Note: Military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position may include 25B, 255A, IT, 182X, 682X, 26, C4|10, C4|11, ISM, 8848, 8846, 8858, 3D0X1 . All active duty military, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if qualified to fill this position. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx.

How You’ll Support Our MissionESO Billing is used by our customers to support revenue cycle management (RCM) for Emergency Medical Services agencies. RCM is highly technical effort with heavy compliance standards. ESO Billing assists our customers in achieving efficient, compliant collections for their EMS activities. This in turn funds their operations and allows them to serve their community. As a member of ESO’s product team, you will be collaborating with our EMS and hospital product domains, business stakeholders, subject matter experts, and engineers to provide and support customers with product needs. The ideal candidate has a passion for data and learning new product technologies.Reporting to the Vice President of Product Management, you will be part of our Product team based in our Austin, Texas office.What You’ll Be Doing - the day to day**You will be responsible for requirements gathering and development execution. You know how to interpret a stakeholder need, translate it into data and technical reporting requirements. You consistently assess the value/why behind any action. You believe in our mission. You enjoy creative problem solving and learning new skills. You enjoy collaboration and getting first-hand feedback from cross-product domain owners.Interpret high level business and client requirements to create feature requirements, user stories, and relevant product backlog items which help solve some of the most exciting data centric problems for our clientsReiterate product vision and user research findings to our development team by highlighting proposed feature and their business and client valueSupport your team to ensure that they have everything they need to size, accept and execute on workHelp define releases as a collection of new/incremental features, architectural improvements, and allocations for technical debt.Produce required design specifications and data requirements. Provide technical leadership and architectural guidance and help customers go into production with quality technical solutions and implementations.Perform user acceptance testing to ensure releases achieve the stated goals.Provide product subject matter expertise to ESO support and implementation staff to create a world class customer experience.Who You Are - Some of the essential things required to be successful in the role:Strong experience in analytical, conceptual, and technical problem-solving abilities.Understand the client’s business requirements and project objectives.Proven ability to multi-task and coordinate with multiple teamsHistory of working closely with product and technology teams and ability to work collaboratively to get resultsStrong communication skills, both written and verbal.Passionate for transforming data into meaningful information and actionable outcomes**Who You Are - the desirables (It’s a plus if you have):Experience in healthcare revenue cycle management.Experience interpreting and working with 837\835 files.Experience working with payers, and clearinghouses – vetting\clarifying claim requirementsBenefits & Perks**ESO offers a comprehensive suite of benefits to promote health and financial security for our employees and their families. For full-time employment you this includes:*Competitive health plans (medical, dental, & vision insurance)PTO (starting at 20 days) & 12 company holidays401(k) with company matchTelemedicine service provided by ESOSavings accounts (FSA, HSA, DCA)Employee Assistance Program (EAP)Annual health and wellness reimbursementPeace of mind benefits such as life insurance, disability insurance, and worksite benefitsPaid parental leave, new child program, & flexible parental return-to-work optionsCasual office environments and unlimited office snacks and drinks**About ESO**ESO is a fast-paced, growing data, technology, and research company passionate about improving community health and safety through the power of data. We pioneer innovative, user-friendly software to meet the changing needs of today’s EMS agencies, fire departments, and hospitals. We’re small enough to be nimble and fun, but big enough to be a great place to work. We serve thousands of customers out of our offices across the US, Canada and Northern Ireland.Are you ready to Make a Difference? At ESO, we believe in bringing your true self to work every single day. If you don’t match all the qualifications on the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway! We are looking for passionate, innovative, and authentic people to help drive our mission.In the spirit of ESO’s mission to “Improve Community Health and Safety through the Power of Data,” and in accordance with ESO’s duty to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of known hazards, ESO requires all United States (US) employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, regardless of if you work remotely or in office unless a reasonable medical or religious accommodation is requested in a timely manner and approved. This policy will help safeguard the health of our employees and customers, as well as the community at large.All offers are contingent upon a successful background check and compliance with ESO’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy._ESO is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We invite you to consider opportunities at ESO regardless of your gender; gender identity; gender reassignment; age; religion; race; national origin; political affiliation; sexual orientation; disability; veteran status; or other non-merit factor._Job Type: Full-timeWork Location: Multiple Locations

Job Description:

Join our collaborative, in-house marketing team where you’ll play a key role in assisting the Credit Union in achieving its mission of being our member’s first choice as their partner to help them make informed financial decisions. Your role to achieve this mission will be to provide outstanding service to internal members and manage the analytics and reporting for digital and traditional marketing campaigns, as well as our growing suite of digital solutions. This role will help ensure we have the relevant ongoing insights to support and achieve A+FCU strategic initiatives and growth goals.

Reporting & Analytics
Develop reports, dashboards, and ad-hoc analyses with recommendations for marketing and digital strategy areas. Use Tableau, Excel and/or other software solutions to share reporting insights.
Deliver weekly campaign reporting to marketing team including email, digital advertising, website, OTT/CTV, QR codes, Q2 Smart, and other promotional tactics.
Analyze data from marketing solutions including Marketo, Google Analytics, WordPress, Q2 Smart, operational solutions such as Symitar, and agency partner data.
Assess areas of opportunity in current and new markets by reviewing results and trends, testing campaign elements, and collaborating with marketing team to refine campaigns and maximize results.
Leverage external data resources including S & P Global to gain insight into members and potential members, as well as growth into new markets.
Participate in credit union data governance and data analytics initiatives.
Collaborate with other analysts across A+FCU to ensure marketing campaigns and digital banking solutions tie to product/service results and ROI objectives.
Support Digital Banking reporting and analytics projects on an as-needed basis.

Website, Online Banking, and Digital Marketing Testing and Tracking
Analyze digital marketing data and improve results through A/B testing, strategic targeting, call-to-action offers, etc.
Tag and report on website and landing pages using Google Tag Manager (GTM); create UTM links; conduct A/B testing; and monitor pixel reporting data.
Develop email, mailing, and other lists to target members and non-members with campaigns.
Report on Q2 Smart online banking/mobile app campaigns and use insights to improve targeting and results.
Assist as needed with A+FCU online banking, mobile app and other digital banking initiatives.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as required or assigned.


Job Requirements:
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in analytics, business management, marketing, digital strategy, or a related quantitative field required.
Four years of experience in marketing analytics, digital marketing or other related field required.
One year financial experience preferred.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Strong analytical and reporting abilities.
Working knowledge of digital marketing, including Google Ads, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, SEO, and SEM preferred.
Hands on experience with Marketo or other email automation solutions a plus.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely in writing and verbally, including articulating ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required. Experience with Tableau, Access, Visio and other reporting platforms a plus.
Proficient in handling multiple priorities and confidential information.
Familiarity with online banking trends and applications in the financial space a plus.

Desirable Traits
Analytical and technical abilities.
Organizer and planner with attention to detail.
Dependable and responsible.
Possess decision-making abilities.

Physical Functions
Must have the ability/stamina to work at least 40 hours a week.
Will frequently reach, feel, bend, stoop, carry, finely manipulate and key in data.
Must be able to engage in problem-solving skills to help identify and solve potential issues.
Ability to lift up to 50lbs.

Types of Decisions Requiring Supervisory Approval: Situations outside A+FCU policies and procedures.

positionName: Real Estate and Construction Data Analyst
description:
The Real Estate and Construction Data Analyst will be responsible for the following:
Work with Finance, Ops, M&A, Real Estate and Construction teams to understand departmental needs and rationalize efforts for national support.
Dive deep into data to uncover trends as it relates to Real Estate, Construction and procurement of medical equipment.
Aid teams to optimize costs of construction while sustaining quality of product.
Have knowledge of engineering and architectural development, make value engineering recommendations, and execute accordingly.
Work with internal and external teams to audit design and construction project costs at completion while keeping and updating construction costs and trends at a micro and macro level.
Layout quarterly cashflow needs while working with construction managers to accurately report to Leadership team.
Establish monthly cost projection meetings with leadership and construction managers.
Understand real estate analytics programs for site selection and optimization. Data Analyst will dive deep into reporting modules and have deep understanding for company needs and optimal site selection.
