Company Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands (American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard) and an expanding portfolio of home services. Frontdoor serves more than two million customers across the U.S. through a network of 16,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ over 45,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unplanned breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With more than 45 years of experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually (or one request every eight seconds). For more details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Position Overview

The Analyst, A/B Testing owns the digital A/B testing process from ideation to planning, requirements gathering, execution, and analysis for Frontdoor’s DTC e-commerce products. This role works cross-departmentally so that business insights and ideas are transformed into high-impact experiments that affect operational changes and optimize site KPIs. The ideal candidate is passionate about UX and customer experience, enjoys distilling complex information into meaningful insights, and has demonstrated experience driving a culture of experimentation in an e-commerce environment.

Job Responsibilities

Own end-to-end test execution, from experiment design through analysis.

Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and objectives and translate requirements into A/B test designs.

Collaborate and ideate with product, business, and engineering stakeholders to gather and refine test ideas, generate test hypotheses, identify success metrics, and determine feasibility and prioritization of A/B tests.

Execute experiments directly in A/B testing platform or direct and coordinate larger scale cross-departmental test execution efforts with Engineering.

Manage testing calendar prioritization for experiment impact, available traffic, potential conflicts between tests and overall capacity.

Communicate timely, clear analysis of test results to key stakeholders and larger organization with insights and recommended next steps to ensure testing drives continuous improvement.

Develop and document experiment results, testing best practices and processes to continuously improve testing program.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Information Systems, Marketing, or equivalent experience/training.

1+ years of experience in designing, implementing and analyzing A/B or MVT tests, preferably in an e-commerce environment.

Proficiency with A/B test setup and validation in leading testing and optimization platforms (Optimizely, Adobe Target, Oracle Maxymiser, Monetate, SiteSpect, Google Optimize). Optimizely Web experience preferred.

Working knowledge of HTML/CSS.

Fundamental understanding of statistics required, including hypothesis testing and experimental design.

Proficient in web analytics tools (Google Analytics), Microsoft Excel and data visualization techniques required; proficiency in SQL/R/Python preferred.

Strong demonstrated verbal and written communication abilities including presentation skills. Must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with both business and technical teams.

Experience with project management tools such as Jira and Confluence preferred.

Proven ability to handle multiple responsibilities/projects concurrently while meeting deliverables.

Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision.

Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced remote team environment.

Physical Demands and Working Conditions

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential function to this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Move up to 10 pounds occasionally, by lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise repositioning objects.

Sitting for long periods of time while using office equipment such as computers, phones and etc.

Fingering and Repetitive motions; such as movement of wrists, hands and fingers while picking, pinching and typing during your normal working environment.

Express or exchange ideas with others through the use of spoken word, quickly, accurately, and at an easily audible volume, and receive detailed information through oral communication at usual speaking levels without correction, and/or make fine discriminations in the nature of sounds in the environment.

Close visual acuity to perform detail oriented activities at distances close to the eyes, as well as visual acuity to perform activities at or within arm’s reach with skill, control, and accuracy, such as preparing and analyzing data, viewing computer screen and expansive reading.

The Data & Analytics team is responsible for delivering accurate data on business performance & actionable insights to partners across the Auctane e-commerce products, our parent company (Stamps.com) and external partners. These responsibilities are delivered through the analysis of internal & external datasets and recommending (and when applicable, implementing) actions to drive desired business outcomes. In addition, the Data & Analytics teams partners with stakeholders from across the business to deliver both standardized & ad-hoc reporting, analysis & insights to drive business decisions.

Strategic Imperative:

The Principal Business Analyst is responsible for delivering analysis and recommendations across internal, partner, & external datasets to ensure Auctane & partner goals around revenue, volume and acquisition will be achieved. The deliverables from these analyses will be primarily in the form of proposed partner contract terms, opportunities to further optimize partner relationships, follow ups to partner questions, and proposed merchant pricing of partner products (when applicable). Further, this role will recommend to the organization decisions between two or more partners that is in the best interest of Auctane across financial and strategic reasons. Finally, the Principal Business Analyst will partner with the rest of the Data & Analytics team in assisting the organization in effectively using data to drive decisions, enhancing the data assets within the company as well as helping raise the analytical capabilities of their partners and peers.

Primary Objectives:

Deliver analysis and recommendations across internal, partner, & external datasets to ensure Auctane & partner goals around revenue, volume and acquisition will be achieved.
Deliver ad-hoc analysis and investigations based on Auctane Business Development Team and External Partner request to clarify questions and identify opportunities.
Recommend strategic decisions across multiple partners to achieve financial and strategic goals.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders across Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Sales, Product, and Accounting to understand the business and develop strategic and operational data driven insights.
Formulate insights on specific prospect populations and business tactics across Sales, Marketing, and Product.
Participate in and sometimes lead all phases of analytic work to drive the business: from problem definition to representation of results.

Qualifications - To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Position Duties: (typical monthly, weekly, daily tasks which support the primary objectives)

Support the delivery of partner performance reporting for delivery to Auctane Finance, Business Development, Strategy and External partner teams.
Analyze internal & external data sets to assess the impact on the business of potential new relationships as well changes to existing relationships and recommend steps forward.
Be the point person for ad-hoc requests and clarifications from internal teams (primarily Business Development and Finance) as well as External Partners.
Leverage internal & external historical data and predictive models to identify key historical factors that impact key KPIs and recommend actions to drive future performance.
Help define, implement, and support key data feeds from internal systems as well as from external partners that are necessary for the measurement of business performance and key KPIs.
Demonstrates ability to think big and produce innovative and simple solutions to solve complex problems.

Required Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years’ experience.
Eight or more (8+) years relevant work experience.
Eight or more (8+) years’ experience in relational database concepts with an expert knowledge of SQL.
Five or more (5+) years of experience managing and developing business intelligence solutions, such as Tableau, Looker, or Sisense for Cloud Data Teams
Experience designing and creating dashboards for use by Executives and Analysts.
Experience in a fast paced, startup environment.
Strong track record of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworks.

Preferred Education and/or Experience:

Proficiency with data analysis programming languages such as Python or R
Able to clean and analyze external data using tools like Python and Pandas.
Experience with Git
Proficiency with data modeling layers (dbt, Dataform) and data orchestration tools (dbt Cloud, Airflow, Prefect)

Skills and Knowledge:

Strong eye for detail and a passion for quickly delivering results for rapid action.
Comfortable working in a highly collaborative, consensus-oriented environment.
Excellent written, verbal, scientific communication and time management skills.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience, as well as the ability to design and deploy clear reporting assets
Ability to work cross functionally to collaboratively understand and deliver on business needs
Passion for customers and experience in eCommerce
Able to balance fun & positive working relationships with the need to have direct conversations around business performance

Computer/Software/Application Proficiency:
High proficiency with SQL
Python and Pandas
Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, Looker, Mode Analytics or Sisense for Cloud Data teams
Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets

Travel Requirements:

None

Utilize wrist and hands for a prolonged period of time

Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS you can requisition compute power, storage, and many other services – gaining access to a suite of flexible IT infrastructure services as your business demands them. AWS is the leading platform for designing and developing applications for the cloud and is growing rapidly in terms of revenue, customers, people, and complexity.

The AWS Worldwide Sales Planning and Operations team is seeking a Business Analyst with broad technical skills, strong business acumen, and a deep analytical background to help in assessing business performance, developing insights, creating efficiencies, and delivering results to the AWS Worldwide Commercial Sales Organization as it continues to scale.

As a member of this team, you will leverage strong data extraction skills to drive worldwide reporting deliverables, create ad hoc financial and sales performance analysis, support business planning, and implement ideas for process improvement. You must have the ability to communicate effectively across multiple technical and non-technical business units, as well as across multiple geographies. Successful members of this team collaborate effectively to solve data problems, implement new solutions, and deliver results rapidly against high operational standards. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated individual that seeks to “tell the story” of the data with little direction or supervision.

LOCATION
This position can be based in one of the following locations: Seattle, WA USA- Austin, TX USA - Arlington, VA USA - Atlanta, GA USA - Boston, MA USA - Palo Alto, USA - New York, NY USA - San Francisco, CA USA.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES AND CAPABILITIES:

Help define and prioritize projects for execution
Work backwards from your end-customer to define, design, and execute each work item with an emphasis on improved metrics, productivity, and efficiency
Translate data into actionable insights for stakeholders while proactively identifying new areas of opportunity to drive further improvements
Collaborate with Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Sales Operations and Finance business partners to build scalable solutions on behalf of your customers

Location: Open to Seattle, San Francisco, New York, Austin, San Jose
About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Advanced Excel user including Pivot tables and vlookup

Increase our analytics capabilities and deliver important insights to the business derived from the models and insights you generate

Share stories with data and care greatly for the truths that high-fidelity data reveal about our customers and products.

Structured analytical approach to problem solving.

When work is challenging and rewarding it shouldn't feel like work.

WHAT IS THE ROLE?
Right now we're seeking a talented Data Specialist to join our growing team! The Data Specialist is responsible for working with MemberClicks customers and the MemberClicks services team to convert data from customers' prior data sources into the MemberClicks database. This is a critical component to the successful delivery of MemeberClicks services and is vital to the successful adoption of MemberClicks software by our customers.
WHAT YOU'LL BE WORKING ON:
Convert data from one or more customer data sources into the MemberClicks database in a way that meets customer business needs and timelines.
Create custom reports and update existing reports for customers using Crystal Reports Provide data mapping to customers on custom databases to ensure accurate and usable conversions.
Work as part of a team comprised of both MemberClicks and customer personnel in order to keep implementation projects on time and within cost.
Work closely with other Data Specialists and Product Development to continually improve the conversion process with regard to efficiency and quality.
Write, document, and standardize new custom conversions. Provide quotations for additional billable conversion or reporting work.
Own and maintain the shared codebase for the conversion application including the data validation tools.
Provide regular and consistent knowledge transfer and documentation to other team members on best practice for data conversion.
DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?
Bachelor's degree
2 or more years of experience in a related field
Excellent Microsoft SQL knowledge.
Significant data mapping experience.
Proficient with Transact-SQL.
Proficient with Crystal Reports and other data reporting and business intelligence tools.
Experience with XML and manipulating XML from .NET Framework.
Experience with ODBC and OLEDB.
Understanding of advanced financial accounting principles, including credits and debits, accrual versus cash basis, revenue recognition, accounts receivable, etc.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to think critically and creatively to solve problems.
Excellent organizational and planning skills, including the ability to manage time efficiently.
Detail oriented and dedicated to quality work

positionName: Budget Analyst- General Government & Information Technology
description:
General Information
** Minimum salary is listed. Actual salary will be determined based on qualifications and experience.**

The General Government & Information Technology Budget Analyst performs evaluations, assesses performance measures reports, develops budget and policy recommendations, communicates in writing and orally, and works on special projects for the Legislative Budget Board relating to the general government area of state government.

The position reports to the General Government & Information Technology Manager and works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
Essential Responsibilities
Examine budgets/requests to assess whether funds are appropriately allocated, budgeted, and expended.
Develop budget and policy recommendations and accurately reflect them in information systems.
Collect, organize, and analyze data and prepare written materials, including publications.
Provide assistance on development of budgets/requests, strategic plans, and other materials.
Represent the agency at external meetings/events and then provide written or oral summaries of key issues.
Orally present and explain significant policy/budget issues to LBB management, legislative committees and others, providing concise explanations and recommendations/options for resolution.
Prepare and/or coordinate written fiscal and policy analysis of legislation.
Coordinate and collaborate with other LBB analysts on budget, performance, and revenue issues, as appropriate.
Conduct quality assurance procedures to produce accurate and complete work products.
Prepare riders and amendments for General Appropriations Bills and other legislation.
May plan and conduct research projects and field studies, write and edit reports that are suitable for publication.
May develop procedures and tools to implement plans/programs and measure/report progress.
Contribute to agency projects and perform related work as assigned.
Essential Attributes and Skills
Work effectively with LBB and assigned agency management and staff, and legislators/legislative staff.
Think critically, take initiative and use good judgment.
Communicate professionally in writing and orally (including presentations in formal and information settings).
Create timely, relevant, accurate, and polished work products.
Complete tasks with appropriate levels of independence and attention to detail.
Use business tools successfully (i.e. Word, Excel, Access, Internet Explorer, email, customized applications, desktop pc, laptop/tablet, and smart phone).
Analyze, synthesize, and summarize quantitative and qualitative information.
Identify alternatives and make recommendations supported with evidence.
Maintain confidential and sensitive information and follow agency protocols.
Understand legislative/budget processes and budget, performance, and operations of assigned agency.
Work at a computer and desk for extended periods of time.
Attributes Required of Every LBB Employee
Embrace agency mission/core values and follow policies, procedures, and processes.
Work effectively with LBB management and staff, as well as all external customers.
Coordinate, collaborate, and employ good interpersonal skills; demonstrate positive outlook.
Balance concurrent projects, work under pressure, and adapt to changing priorities/deadlines.
Act with motivation, organization, and attention to details; complete tasks with an appropriate level of independence.
Be punctual and have regular attendance.
Work overtime on nights, weekends, and holidays, as necessary to meet agency deadlines.
Education and Experience
Graduation with a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required.
Earned graduate degree is preferred.
Course-work or degree in public policy or administration, program evaluation, quantitative/qualitative research, educational measurement/research, financial affairs, accounting, academic affairs, legal research or a related field is preferred.
Two years of progressively responsible full-time work experience in a relevant policy area is preferred.
Supplemental Information

To apply for this position, you must initially set up an account and select a Username and Password through Governmentjobs.com. You may apply directly through the posting list on our website or on the Governmentjobs.com website. To set up an account go to https://www.governmentjobs.com/js_login.cfm. Please be sure to write down your Username and Password. Human Resources will not be able to retrieve this information. Only on-line applications will be accepted.

 Examples of an applicant's work product and/or copies of transcripts may be required as condition of interview. Finalist may be given a work-related exercise. The person hired may be required to submit official transcripts. Credentials earned at foreign colleges and/or universities must have been evaluated by an acceptable entity and must be equivalent to credentials awarded by U.S. regionally accredited institutions of higher education.

 The person hired may not simultaneously be employed by the Legislative Budget Board and another state agency or Texas public institution of public/higher education. Any job offer from the Legislative Budget Board is contingent upon: proof of eligibility/authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis; and proof of compliance with the Selective Service Law for males between the ages of 18 and 25.

 The Legislative Budget Board is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in employment or in the provision of services on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. Applicants should communicate requests for disability-related accommodations during the application process to LBB Human Resources at email address HR@LBB.state.tx.us.

Role: Salesforce Business Analyst

***Hands on Salesforce platform experience and/or certification required for this role***

What you'll do

Create, manage and fully own detailed user story requirements and acceptance criteria, working with the Product team.
Build an understanding of our main customer segments (from SMB to Enterprise and across industries) and the primary use cases for Blackthorn.
Define the most important quarterly initiatives for the product and engineering teams to tackle.
Lead, support and collaborate with a passionate, cross-functional team of engineers, user researchers, designers, and marketing managers to execute against the planned roadmap and continuously up-level the Event Management experience.
Build analytics to visualize and track the health and growth of specific products within Event Management
Perform a needs and revenue analysis to make data-driven approaches to new features to develop or features to sunset.

What we look for

Knows either our Payments or Events app and has implemented them
Salesforce Consulting experience
Quick and efficient though process for making and addressing tickets
5+ years of experience as a BA with majority in Salesforce
Taking epics and turning them into user story requirements and detailed acceptance criteria
Have the ability to organize and communicate vast amounts of complexity in writing.
Have built products by collaborating cross-functionally across engineering, product, data and analytics, marketing, design and other key stakeholders
Not only have you shipped new products, but you're obsessed with continuous product improvement and can optimize for shipping a portfolio of small, medium and large releases.

What We Offer

An incredible team of smart and supportive people
A deep feeling of satisfaction and completion
Fully remote global team working from home
Health insurance (if in the US)
Annual company trip
Stock options to every employee (we are all owners)
Every other Friday off
401k with 3% match
$400 office stipend
Maternity/Paternity leave
Student loan debt assistance
Children's 529 college fund assistance
Pledge 1% - time off during the year for helping nonprofits

About Blackthorn

We have two native apps on the Salesforce AppExchange for managing Events and Payments. We're a growing, distributed team in four countries. We move fast and have significant structure in our product build process. Everyone on our team has deep experience within their respective roles. Our customers span from 1 person companies to Fortune 500s.

Why is our work important

Our apps continue to be easy to use and setup, due to continuous refinements with our UX. Most apps in our space take weeks to implement, ours take hours, and they work more flexibly, achieving significantly more functionality than our competitors. We believe enterprise apps should be as easy to use as consumer mobile apps.

What the job will bring you

A deep level of satisfaction through ownership of your role. You'll get more autonomy than at other companies (we've been told by our team). Connection. Our team is tightly knit, assisted through our annual company trip (as we're remote). Challenge. We're trying to move as quick as possible. This is not for you if you want to sit back and chill. As Ray Dalio says about life: "Meaningful work and meaningful relationships" provide meaning to life. We aim to bring this.

The Sourcing Business Analyst is part of the Applications team that supports a portfolio of enterprise-wide applications and integrations.
This role preliminarily owns the support and continuous improvement of sourcing related business processes, the application support of the PLM platform (Centric) and other sourcing systems and their integrated solutions.


They have a solid understanding of process and best practices across design, product development, sourcing and merchandising, the PLM systems’ functions and related business processes. They work across multiple departments, with the technology team, business stakeholders, implementation partners and application vendors to design, re-design and implement software solutions and improve business processes to ensure they meet existing and future business requirements.

Primary duties of this position include:
 
Daily operational system support and issue management
 Business process analysis and continuous improvement
 Application management activities (system administration, upgrades, patching, etc.)
 System enhancements and/or reporting request
 Participate in projects throughout all phases of the SDLC
 Project, technical and operational support documentation and training
 End user documentation and training
 Project management of small-medium enhancement projects
 Mentoring

Key Job Responsibilities:
 Provide daily operational support as issues occur in the owned application(s) and integrations working with service desk, peers, business users and application vendor(s) as needed
 Work with application vendors to manage and coordinate scheduled system maintenances, updates and patches
 Communicate the impact of system changes and/or downtimes and coordinates the required actions across the technology and business teams
 Regularly meet with decision makers and end users from the various business departments using the PLM (Design, Sourcing, Product Development, Merchandising) to understand changing business needs and priorities
 Review and analyze the efficiency of the existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging it
 Work with the business stakeholders to evaluate and continuously improve business processes
 Work with management and PMO on projects and programs as it relates to PLM and integrations
 Evaluate level of effort and articulate technical requirements; identify impact, risk and benefit of alternative solutions
 Support SDLC during the design process, gathering and documenting business requirements, technical requirements, data mapping, system setups and configurations, plan and execute regression, integration testing, cutover, golive and post-golive activities.
 Independently manage small-medium application enhancement projects through SDLC
 Create technical and end user documentations and training of system modifications and business process changes
 Provide ongoing training, mentoring and technical guidance to peer business analysts and the rest of the technology team as applicable
Qualifications and Skills
 Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Information Systems or equivalent with a minimum of 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
 Prior PLM experience and supporting the sourcing team is a must
 
Knowledge of Centric PLM is strongly preferred
 Retail environment experience is a plus, but not required
 Demonstrated project management abilities and experienced in implementation of software solutions
 
Worked with multiple, cross-functional business area managers and stakeholders and influenced resolution of conflicting objectives
 Has been in key leadership role in successfully delivering business process and system solutions
 Proven ability to mentor people
 Proven track record in meeting deadlines
 Background working on cloud-based solution and has vendor management experience
 Must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills to devise solutions to complex problems
 Excellent communication skills; Able to effectively present complex solutions to technical and non-technical staff at all levels of the organization, across multiple cultures/geographies
 Collaborative and effective at building consensus across the organization
 Highly organized, responsible and dependable
 Innovative and solution oriented
 Can easily adapt to fast paced, constantly changing environment
 Works independently, with little or no guidance with the ability to efficiently manage multiple tasks

SCOPE/GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB:
Revenue Cycle Coding Strategies is a growing healthcare company recruiting a Business Intelligence Analyst with SQL proficiency and experience in data analytics and data visualization to assist with the automation of data collection, analysis practices and data visualization. This position combines programming, data modeling and statistics skills with communication, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Responsibilities will include the maintenance of a data warehouse as well as supporting file uploads to client websites. The programming will include data ETL (Extract, Transform and Load), database development, reporting and dashboard skills. The ideal candidate will combine programming ability with business and process knowledge. A focus will be integrating data across disparate systems in SQL databases to create a single source of truth. The position requires processes mapping knowledge. This position will work with internal and external clients to develop automated database reports, dashboards and support digital platform projects. This position will require project management skills and experience working with project teams. Web development experience and healthcare experience are beneficial.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
SQL agent job and stored procedure creation
Building SSIS packages
Data warehouse development and maintenance
File uploads to client websites
After business hour file uploads
Build client databases
Data visualization and dashboard development (Power BI) which meet the outlined scope of work for clients or as an internal need for RCCS in a timely fashion by meeting all deadlines.
Automate data collection and analysis processes
Research benchmarking data sources
Process and system mapping
Collaborate with teams
Project management
Strong attention to detail
Strong written and oral communication
Works closely with company executives and division leaders to provide appropriate data visualization tools for project deliverables.
Other duties as assigned

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
High school diploma or equivalent
Bachelor’s degree required
3-5 years of experience in SQL

QUALIFICATIONS:
Proficient in SQL
Proficient in Power BI
Proficient in data visualization
Proficient in Excel, Access, and WordPress

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
None

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This position requires full range of body motion including manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination. The position additionally requires standing/sitting for extensive periods of time. Occasional lifting and carrying items weighing up to forty (40) pounds may be required. Requires corrected vision and hearing to normal range.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work is performed in an office environment involving frequent interaction with staff, clients and the general public.

Want to hear something crazy? Cars only spend 5% of their time driving. Where do they spend the other 95%? PARKED!
LAZ Parking is one of the largest and fastest growing parking companies in the country. LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces across the country. When it comes to parking, we’re the experts!
We are also a PEOPLE FIRST company. We often say “parking is our industry but people are our passion.” Our mission is to “create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients”. If you’re looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best – contact us today!
The Spirit of the Position:

The Business Analyst is an integral part of the evolving Technology team at LAZ Parking & reports to the GM of Business Intelligence. This role will be responsible for maximizing value for LAZ Operated Assets within their geographical area. Success in this role will be shown by the ability to be analytical, think outside of the box, and use data to drive decision making. The Regional Business Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the local parking economy and implement yield management strategies to increase revenue and drive value to LAZ and client assets.
Principal Job Duties:
Develop and create dashboards within LAZ Parking’s Business Intelligence platform powered by Microsoft’s PowerBI in concert with the national BI team directed by the General Manager of Business Intelligence.
Develop and implement strategies through quantitative analysis of historical parking supply and demand as well as consumer and competition behavior
Develop a working relationship with subject matter experts in the industry and within our field operations to understand the differences and challenges for each market
Determine ideal pricing for various revenue streams through analysis of consumers’ online purchasing habits.
Partner with distribution channels to ensure opportunities are maximized.
Identify and communicate demand periods (high and low) for which a strategic plan is required and formulate and execute that plan with assistance from the Regional Operations Teams.,
Evaluate the effectiveness of implemented strategies related to revenue management and technology.
Be the key point of contact for Business Intelligence users within their regions and assist with training or technical questions on LAZ’s BI Tool.
Provide reports on a regular schedule through data collection such as:
Average Number of Transient Parkers & Revenue Drivers.
Contract Parker Occupancy and Absenteeism.
Parking Patron Patterns and Trends, etc.
Occupancy Reports and Trends – LAZ locations versus competing locations.
Create and disseminate additional reports as assigned.
Education:
BA / BS degree in a quantitative discipline such as Economics or Mathematics or Computers/Information Systems w/ a focus in data analytics.
Experience:
Experience developing & deploying enterprise-scale reports and dashboards using a BI Application such as Microsoft PowerBI or Tableau.
2+ years of related experience at within the Real Estate, Airline, or Hospitality Industry.
Knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts.
Experience in developing & using DAX Functions.
Skills:
Knowledge of Analytics / BI Applications such as Microsoft PowerBI or Tableau.
Ability to utilize Data Warehouse Technology such as SQL, Non-SQL, and Azure solutions.
Proven analytical skills, including the ability to gather data, analyze and present recommendations.
Leverage understanding of internal and external business processes to identify problems and implement solutions to drive value.
Interest in optimization problem-solving, economic game theory, and consumer buying behavior
Ability to work independently and multi-task.
Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with all levels of the organization.
Demonstrate a sense of urgency and timeliness.
Physical Demands:
Ability to lift, push and pull at least 10 pounds.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with qualified disabilities to perform the essential duties/functions.
FLSA Status: Exempt
To be hired, all candidates must submit to a background check and pre-employment drug screen.
LAZ Parking is an equal opportunity employer. In all our employment practices, including hiring, we are firmly committed to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, genetics, Vietnam era, special disabled, recently separated and other protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. No question in our application process is used for the process of limiting or excluding any applicant's consideration for employment on such grounds.
This Employer participates in E-Verify.

Under the general supervision of the Child Care regulations Enhancement and Release Manager, this position performs complex business analysis work. Work involves coordinating the gathering, development, and documentation of business requirements and analyzing requirements management methodology. Identifies issues and risks on projects and initiatives. Develops test cases. Provides training on projects and business processes. Provides technical input on project documents. Communicates business processes and workflow diagrams. Identifies business and project inefficiencies. Documents business processes and requirements. This position is classified as a fulltime position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular hours may be required. Travel to other work location may be required. Performs other duties as assigned.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


Analyzes and documents requirements management methodology, utilizing industry best practices on IT projects and customer-initiated requests that support established business processes and improvements to existing systems and capabilities. Develops and documents business and user requirements to support projects or system enhancements. Analyze policies and procedures to determine impact on process and existing systems. Develop functional and/or system requirements documentation to take advantage of efficiency improvements, such as automating manual processes, streamlining applications, seeking out and documenting inefficient processes and developing application concepts. Document clear, detailed, and thorough technical specifications for simple to complex requests. Act as liaison between technical and non-technical customers, effectively providing automated solutions to business problems. Meet with staff, customers and stakeholders to establish current and future priorities with IT components to support the program’s business needs and those of the agency. Identify and document steps to achieve established priorities. Provide IT input on new technologies, architectural or security requirements. (30%)


Facilitates the requirements management process across the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Lead high-level requirements meetings to understand and collect product, business and technical needs. Identify business analysis tasks and meaningful project estimates for the tasks. Resolve conflicting business and technical requirements. Identify issues concerning technical limitations and key products requirements. Provide review on projects and tasks and develop corrective action plans as needed. Research and communicate application, data and infrastructure needs and ensure solution alignment to business objectives/requirements. Develops and validate user acceptance testing (UAT). Assess and develop test cases, as required. (30%)


Communicates technical business processes verbally and via workflow diagrams. Leverages standard methodologies, processes, and tools. Assist customers with identifying and prioritizing business needs, ensuring alignment with agency goals. Identifies opportunities for customers to utilize existing or future technology to meet business needs. Identifies opportunities for customers to collaborate with other business partners to deliver solutions that have an agency-wide impact. Supports preparation of agency governance materials (i.e., business justification, cost/benefit analysis, etc.). Reviews and provides feedback of project deliverables such as project charters and design documentation. Identifies challenges and proposes meaningful solutions. Provide feedback to IT and agency leadership, reporting the status of current priorities, new and future projects, and to highlight opportunities for cross-divisional collaboration. (15%)


Monitors assignments to ensure timely delivery, and reports status/risks to stakeholders. Consults with customers on software/hardware purchases, review software/hardware justifications and recommends approval/disapproval. Reviews and provide technical input on architecture, security, systems design, risks and application modifications. Provides guidance and assistance to IT staff, customers, and stakeholders on the resolution of computer related issues. (10%)


Participates on project teams in the delivery of IT solutions through the analysis and documentation of business processes, requirements and specifications. Promotes productivity and efficiency by studying current practices, help customers analyze complex technical and managerial processes, identify inefficiencies, and assist customers to realize business value. Educates customers, colleagues and stakeholders on business analysis techniques and standards. (10%)


Other duties as assigned. (Note: Including but is not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.) (5%)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of facilitation techniques in discussing requirements

Knowledge of effective management principles

Knowledge of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Methods

Knowledge of process improvement methods

Knowledge of principles and practices of project management

Skilled in eliciting business and technical requirements

Skilled in communicating complex design and technical issues, as well as writing business cases and product requirements

Skilled in effective verbal and written communication and presentation skills

Skilled in gathering input, formulating a plan, and carrying it to fruition

Skilled in providing exceptional follow-through and customer-service

Ability to analyze systems, processes and procedures

Ability to write and revise standards and procedures

Ability to explain abstract concepts in concrete terms to a variety of audiences, including technical, non-technical and executive personnel

Ability to bring about consensus on contradicting views

Ability to manage ambiguous and continuously evolving business needs

Knowledge of Business and Requirements Analysis.

Skill in effective verbal and written communication.

Ability to analyze coordinate and solve complex problems; work in a team environment; and handle multiple projects

Working knowledge of the Agile SDLC and how business requirements are translated into user stories.

Registration or Licensure Requirements:
N/A


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in computer Science, Business Administration, Management or related field. May substitute direct work experience on a year-for-year basis. Minimum of 6 years’ experience as a Business Analyst or similar job function with at least two of the six years in a Agile SDLC environment.

Position Description: Project Manager & Business Analyst (Hybrid position) – Marketing
Company: The National Alliance for Insurance Education & Research
Location: Austin, Texas
Compensation: Based on Qualifications
Company Description:
The National Alliance is a non-profit risk and insurance education provider which offers needs-based training. The top one hundred insurance agencies turn to The National Alliance for their education needs, which includes practical insurance and risk management knowledge for all skill levels.
Mission:
The National Alliance provides best-in-class risk and insurance education that is practical, comprehensive, and enduring.
Core Values:
The educational programs and research conducted by The National Alliance were built on a foundation of Integrity, Innovation, and Imagination. These qualities commit us to act responsibly, to be accountable for our actions, to fulfill our obligations, and to inspire others with our relentless determination to achieve a standard of excellence in every endeavor.
Job Description:
Are you passionate about education, marketing, technologies and how they can be used to engage our audience? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a hybrid Project Manager & Business Analyst with focus on Marketing & Content Delivery, you will work alongside a group of talented process owners, project managers, and analysts defining and implementing end-to-end, leading-edge solutions for our participants, clients, and key stakeholders. You can work in a collaborative environment where you can influence leadership and see the impacts of your contributions. We love to innovate and are looking for people with a passion for learning and growing their technical skills and aligned to our core values hungry, humble, and smart. You will always seek first to understand, then to be understood, and look to create synergies wherever possible.
Responsibilities:
Work with the marketing team to create a marketing strategy and mapping out the initiatives and tasks needed to implement it.
Collaborating with writers, content producers and graphic designers to create and publish all types of content.
Creating and managing a content calendar and scheduling deadlines and communications plans (internal and external).
Determining marketing campaign budgets and ensuring that all staff adhere to them.
Plan, manage, monitor project workstreams and interdependencies following our Production Process & Project Methodology, aligned with Design and Thinking methodologies and Governance (Our DNA)
Lead Scrums and governance and act as a servant leader for the project teams
Ensure all project tasks are clearly understood, assigned, and tracked using project and case management.
Develop relationships and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders and cross functional teams to ensure solutions meet timeline and business objectives, following OKR methodology
Identify critical project milestones, risks, and options to mitigate risks
Effectively manage and report on status, risks and mitigation, scope, budget, and timelines
Create plan of action based on data from multiple sources inside and outside immediate area
Complete all project documentation required based on Our DNA processes
Create and manage excellent communication plans. Consider project needs when planning vacation time and proactively communicates availability
Investigate and understand where problems are likely to occur as a business analyst
Identify valid and relevant data supporting key decisions
Assess issues by identifying root causes and consequences
Clarify problems by driving to understand the true issue and present solutions
Use judgment to involve other senior team members and leaders when navigating difficult stakeholder issues
Know when and how to escalate. May not always be able to solve a problem, but understands when to escalate issues and areas of risk and obtain guidance
Design advanced level business reporting, forecasting, analysis, and modeling to support management decision making.
Synthesize enormous amounts of data into meaningful summarized reports to enhance leadership’s ability to understand the information and make decisions.
Develop graphs, charts, and presentations to clearly show data trends and projections.
Analyze data proactively to discover opportunities for prospective metric improvement. Provides interpretation and makes recommendations.
Clearly and articulately communicate interpretation and results with the appropriate audience.
Required Skills: (Certifications are a nice addition, but not required):
Technical Project Management background (+7 years) ideally in the areas of marketing and delivery content management for educational or/and insurance and risk management companies.
Strong Business Analyst skills to be able to distill complex data/analysis into understandable information, knowledge, and clearly define solutions and actions.
Strong Agile and SCRUMs methodology fundamentals and ability to teach / train best practices
Strong Process Management and Process Improvement Methodologies (Lean Six Sigma) fundamentals and ability to teach / train best practices
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
 BS Degree & MBA preferred
Microsoft Dynamics 365, Office 365 & Power Platforms experience and certifications
LMS, LCMS, LXP
 Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Good communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills.
Strong cross-functional collaboration skills both internally and across partner teams.
Excellent organizational, prioritization, and decision-making skills.
Strong analytical skills.
Work remotely as an option and manage remote teams

Job Description

Constellant currently has an opening for a Business Analyst with strong knowledge of and passion for solving problems and building solutions. We are a small, agile company where each individual wears multiple hats. This role combines customer facing skills with technical proficiency to deliver creative solutions. This role also supports internal projects and sales initiatives.

Company Overview

Founded in 2002, Constellant is a market leader in Ecosystem Management-as-a-Service (EMaaS). We provide our customers with software and data required to create, maintain and scale an organization?s external and internal ecosystems. dpEngine is our full-featured, integrated software platform that provides full-lifecycle management of the participants within digital business ecosystems include developer programs, specialized partner programs and customer facing marketplaces. dpEngine includes secure registration, content management, trouble ticketing, application catalogs, e-commerce and marketing functionality. We complement this software platform with domain experts in program management, content management, technical support, marketing and developer/partner recruiting.

Constellant is a fast-paced environment that fosters a sense of teamwork and appreciation for individual contributions. The combination of active and driven, professional owners/managers along with our core base of passionate employees represents a powerful combination, and a challenging, fun place to work. Our market leadership, financial stability, and small company environment provide the right blend of an entrepreneurial culture in an established business.

Constellant is well-funded and has a strong cash position. Recognized by leading industry analysts such as Gartner, the company enjoys strong demand for its product and service offerings, and plans to significantly expand our operations in the fast-growing market of digital business ecosystem management.

Key Responsibilities

Work with Customer Success Managers to:

Gather and document customer requirements
Analyze requirements and guide customers to efficient solutions leveraging best practices
Create user stories and conduct internal kickoff meetings to communicate requirements, project goals and timelines
Use Constellant configuration tools to configure client portals based on requirements
Coordinate with the development team to implement product enhancements

Identify and recommend product and internal process improvements

Troubleshoot and document product defects and test fixes

Drive internal projects by coordinating back/ front end development and product configuration

Support sales initiatives including custom demos and proof of concept projects by:

Capturing requirements and creating tickets for all tasks
Coordinating with front end team on look & feel
Configuring environment to map to business processes

Must have:

Ability to wear multiple hats and work independently with minimal direction in a fast pace/high-pressure environment

Ability to prioritize tasks across multiple projects and comfortable with shifting priorities when necessary

Ability to troubleshoot, identify root cause of problems and develop solutions

Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization, both internally and externally

Experience creating requirements, user stories and workflow diagrams

Experience at a SaaS company

Nice to have:

Experience with hands on software product configuration

mySQL database literacy

Basic HTML5 skills and familiarity with CSS and responsive design

Experience working with APIs

Business Intelligence Advisor
Dell Technologies is driven by data. Our business is built on the understanding that data creates value and drives progress. So, we take the stewardship of our data very seriously. That’s the vital role played by Business Intelligence teams within Business Support. Internal clients across Dell rely on us to analyze, test, validate, and maintain the integrity of data. We make use of leading-edge software and tools to collect, mine, and interpret data and the statistical analyses and reports we produce to inform decisions with a global impact.
Join us as a Advisor on our Business Intelligence team in Round Rock, Texas or remotelyto do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As a Business Intelligence Advisor, you will evaluate business data to produce meaningful insights and metrics, identifying trends that improve business performance. You will encourage best practices and knowledge sharing within the organization, and as a trusted advisor to the business you will also end users to determine information requirements.
You will:
Develop new tools to automate processes.
Develop and deliver reporting and analytics solutions designed to translate data into actionable business intelligence.
Consult with stakeholders to determine reporting needs and define reporting solutions to meet requirements.
Identify, retrieve, query, and append data from internal databases and external data sources in support of reporting and analytics operations.
Design and build dashboards to track KPI's.
Conduct quantitative and qualitative analyses on a broad array of issues to inform strategic decision making.
Serve as a primary point of contact for support questions from the development user community. Provide training and support to enable stakeholders to use reporting and analytics tools in effective and efficient ways.
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
Ability to collaborate in a team environment with proven expertise in reportingExcellent technical aptitude and presentation skillsGood understanding of specific data intelligence and experience with business processes
Desirable Requirements
Proven experience in similar roles5 to 8 years of experienceBachelor's Degree in: computer or information science, mathematics, social and political sciences, or a related field.Knowledge and experience in extracting data from relational databases.
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.

SunPower is a global solar energy solutions company with a rich heritage of pioneering the best energy technologies in the world. Our solutions are unrivaled in terms of long-term reliability, efficiency and guaranteed performance, and our company is unmatched in terms of global reach and scale. Through design, manufacturing, installation and ongoing maintenance and monitoring, SunPower provides its proprietary, world-record efficient solar technology to residential, commercial and utility customers worldwide.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a brilliant, passionate and driven team of more than 2,000 in North America and the Philippines. In an industry that is reshaping the world’s energy future, there’s no better place to be than SunPower.

We believe that our employees create our brand – with each project, each communication, each task completed and each interaction. Experience is critical to SunPower in regards to not only our customers but also our employees and dealer partners. As such, we strive to hire candidates that are service focused. The experience we would expect the ideal person to deliver is:
Summary of Role:
As a Business Data Analyst, you will join a rapidly growing residential solar installation Operations team that will rely on the tools you create to help drive daily decisions for the organization. You will help architect the reporting tools needed to focus the teams on revenue, cycle times, execution and quality. Through collaboration with the Operations team members to create data sets that translate business requirements into operational excellence will result in superior experiences for our customers. You will use your analytical capabilities to create Operations dashboards to review, measure and manage the business.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Utilize SalesForce data to create Qlik Sense reporting, Dashboard, and various data sets for the Operations team.
Perform ad hoc analyses and queries as necessary
Provide analytical support for initiatives
Develop and maintain effective communication tools to report business performance and drive business decisions
Work with stakeholders on key areas of need and provide analytic support needed to help maximize their efficiency
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Data Analytics, Business, Finance or Operations.
Three years of experience in consulting, business operations or data analytics.
Excellent analytical skills with experience managing and utilizing large data sets to drive performance and process improvement
Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex data into simple, actionable recommendations to the leadership level.
Drive decisions and change management through data analysis, collaboration, and leadership.
Experience using a CRM and/or project management software
Preferred Qualifications:
B.S. / B.A. degree and minimum 4+ years related experience and 6+ years of experience as an individual contributor, or equivalent combination of education and years of related experience
Technical knowledge of solar system installation
Physical Demands and Working Conditions:
Able to work upright and stationary and/or standing for working hours
Able to communicate, receive, and understand information and ideas with diverse groups of people in a comprehensible and reasonable method
Able to position and move objects up to 10 pounds
Able to use and learn standard office equipment and technology with proficiency
The position requires travel with the potential of overnight stays between assigned facilities and various locations within the community. Less than or equal to 10% travel.
Day to day work is completed in the office at personal computer M-F, first shift hours
Ambient noise level is usually quiet, consisting of normal conversations, business machines, telephones, but occasionally may be above average for portions of the business day

Punchh is the leader in AI-powered loyalty, offer management, and customer engagement solutions for brick-and-mortar and online restaurants, convenience stores, and other retailers. Punchh brings the power of digital engagement to physical stores by delivering omnichannel experiences and personalization across the entire customer journey to drive same-store sales and customer lifetime value. Using pre-built integrations to 200+ third-party systems such as POS, Wi-Fi, kiosk, and payment providers, the Punchh platform delivers actionable, SKU-level data in real-time. Serving 200+ brands that span 100K+ stores in 20 different countries, Punchh customers include 5 of the top 100 North American convenience stores like Casey's and Racetrac and 37 of the top 100 restaurant brands, including Papa John's, Denny's, Focus Brands, and Yum! Brands (KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell). Punchh is headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Texas, Canada, and India. Punchh was built over eleven years by a seasoned leadership team with extensive experience in digital, marketing, CRM, and AI technologies, as well as deep knowledge of the restaurant and retail industries. In April of 2021, Punchh agreed to be acquired by PAR Technology Corporation (NYSE: PAR), a leading global provider of restaurant software. While Punchh continues to operate as an independent business unit, the acquisition creates a unified commerce cloud platform for enterprise restaurants and positions PAR and its subsidiaries to lead the industry with integrated point-of-sale, back office, payment, and guest engagement solutions

PAR invented the FIRST point of sale terminal over 40 years ago, yet we operate much like a start-up at the forefront of restaurant technology. PAR's solutions are used to serve tens of millions of guests every day in over 120 countries. Our mission is to build the number one restaurant technology company in the world and we're off to great start. We believe our customers want technology that is open and fast that enables their ability to innovate. We're looking for people who are hungry to go beyond the idea of 'just a job'. PAR's not for everyone though: We work hard, and we really reward success. We push ourselves and each other to be better every day. We're ferocious in battle but gentle in spirit. We're hands-on people. We keep our room clean and make our bed because details matter. We believe it is better to be fast than big, and that being both is best. We believe diversity creates strong systems and communities. We experiment. Sometimes we break things, but we learn quickly. We're honest and our intentions are good. And we always offer the last slice of dessert to our guests. We've got each other's and our customers' backs no matter what
Title

Senior Data Analyst

Location

Austin,TX

Reporting to

Director, Data Engineering

About The Role

Senior Data Analyst is one of the most critical roles in leading Punchh's data innovations. You will leverage prior industrial experience in product and business analytics and help create cutting-edge data and analytics products.

This role requires close collaborations with data science, engineering and product management. You should be both a technical expert, and an inspirational mentor to the team, guiding junior members and establishing best practices from ideation to production.

What You'll Do

Explore data to find actionable insights and make recommendations to Punchh's product suite.
Work with product managers and engineering leaders to develop new product solutions, providing analytics guidance.
Identify and analyze patterns and trends in data sets
Partner with cross functional teams to realize data relationships and deliver insights
Assess accuracy of datasets
Represent company's expertise in advanced analytics in a variety of media outlets such as client meetings, blogs and conferences
Occasional business travels are required.

What You'll Need

5+ years of experience in a product analyst or data science role with an enthusiastic, can-do attitude.
Advanced degree in statistics, economics, computer science or other quantitative fields.
Strong problem solving skills and excellent statistical / analytical skills; knowledge in data visualization.
Expert level knowledge in SQL
Experience in developing data models, query large datasets
Exceptional communication skills and ability to articulate a complex concept with thoughtful, actionable recommendations.

Benefits

Unlimited PTO
Company sponsored health insurance
401(k) with Company Match
Healthcare coverage, FSA, HSA
Life and AD&D insurance
Competitive salaries and bonus
Professional development
EAP
Maternity and Paternity (Bonding) Leave
Free lunch every single day at work, social events, plus a well stocked refrigerator

The Zilliant Solutions group is focused on delivering all aspects of Zilliant’s breakthrough solution to its customers. Members of the Professional Services team work together in a project-based environment that has a significant consultative sales component to ensure that customers receive full benefits from our solution. All members of the team must acquire an in-depth understanding of Zilliant’s products and services and be effective in interacting with other parts of the organization including Product Management, Engineering, and Sales.


The ideal candidate for the position of Business Analyst will have a very strong quantitative and analytical background. Ability to use MS Access, BI tool (Tableau preferred), expertise with MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, and experience with relational databases; some experience with statistical analysis would be a plus. In addition, the candidate must have excellent written and oral communications skills to assist in turning sophisticated analyses into persuasive customer-ready documents.


The ideal candidate must be able to handle multiple priorities, be very flexible, and work well with others with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


A strong performer in the Business Analyst role can expect to grow into an Engagement Manager role or other roles within Zilliant where he/she will have full responsibility for project management and customer success. In addition, opportunities to take on project management and customer-facing activities will be given to the individual that demonstrates customer handling skills.

Primary Responsibilities Include:

Assist in all customer development activities including:

Develop product category structures to enable accurate demand modeling
Assist in creating customer presentations including project status, results meetings, and sales
Become fully knowledgeable of Zilliant solution and become fully independent in creating scenarios and delivering accurate analyses
Assist in resolution of any data issues relating to our modeling efforts
Develop sophisticated and persuasive analyses from customer data to support sales efforts and develop strong customer relationships
Assist in profiling and prioritizing new market opportunities

Assist in a variety of other project based work that supports Professional Services ability to sell customers on the value of Zilliant and ensures our ability to deliver value to world-class distributors and manufacturers. Project work may include:

Assist in development and delivery of training materials to customers on Zilliant’s solutions
Ensure the funneling of customer feedback into the new product development process
Help turn breakthrough analyses into industry leading white papers

Required Experience:

Demonstrated analytical skills and great comfort with handling vast quantities of data and summarizing meaningful insights

Facility with Microsoft products (Excel, PowerPoint, and Access). Experience with Tableau (or another BI tool) and statistical application a strong plus
Experience with relational databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills with evidence of managing customer interaction in a business environment a plus
Fanatical attention to detail

Desired Experience:

Prefer experience with Big 4 or top tier management consulting firms
Business to Business Pricing and/or Big Data and BI/Analytics work experience
Knowledge or experience in Pricing

Required:

Bachelor’s Degree in business, science, or technical
At least 3 years of work experience in quantitative and analytical data that will include expertise with MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
English: Fluent

When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference.

Job Description
SVB is growing its Data group, and we’re looking for you to join our growth marketing organization to enable world class customer journeys and marketing ROI insights. In this role, you will be an early and critical member of the Marketing data and analytics team.
As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will be primarily focused on:
Data Evaluation and Cataloging - Investigation, exploration, interrogation and triaging of data, coupled with the describing and cataloging of those findings.
Data Facilitation - Consultatively assisting our internal business and technical peers by contributing to evaluation and feasibility of initiatives with a focus on the data and governance perspectives.
Data Assets Management - Understanding and curating the data and information currently and potentially available to SVB, as well as sharing your expertise on the strengths, restrictions, and limitations of each.
Responsibilities:
Improve the availability and trustworthiness of data
Serve as a binding and bridging agent between business innovators, data producers, data engineers, data scientists, and other knowledge workers across various parts of the organization
Assist in conceptualizing and ongoing administration of an enterprise data governance framework
Monitoring data quality process, identifying data quality issue patterns, applying remediation plans, implementation of data controls, and manage data quality remediation strategies.
Support data sourcing by interviewing to prepare specifications, gathering information to facilitate negotiations, preparing technical documents, and ensuring universal understanding of the need
Engage with stakeholders across the organization to understand processes that generate, transform, and distribute data
Learning the process of our internal constituents, to facilitate anticipating value-add and innovation opportunities.
Create standards, policies, and processes regarding data quality assurance and management
Recommend and implement data process improvements for Marketing and Business partners
Enforce the data privacy and regulatory requirements as governed by SVB’s Privacy Team
Background & Experience:
3-5 years' experience in data storage, data extraction, data governance, rational database proficiency, data modeling, data warehousing concepts
Effective communicator, stakeholder management, great collaborator, technical writing skills
Systems experience: CRM, Marketing automation, Customer data platforms (CDP)
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, business, computer science or related area

As an industry-leading academic consulting firm, Optimum Research Consulting is always looking for innovative analysts and editors to join our team. Are you passionate about research, innovation, and assisting others to meet their academic goals? Do you desire a greater flexibility in your work schedule? Do you already have a plethora of research and/or publication experience in academia? If so, then Optimum may be for you.


What qualifications do we desire from our applicants?

A post-graduate degree from a distinguished institution in one of our core research areas, including Statistics, Public Health, Nursing, Economics, Psychology, Public Administration, and other Social Sciences involving a heavy research background in either qualitative or quantitative methodology.
A track record of successful publications in academic journals, as well as a minimum of 1 year work experience in a collaborative research environment.
Extensive knowledge and command of qualitative (e.g. NVivo, ATLAS.ti, MAXQDA) and quantitative (e.g. SPSS, Stata, R, SAS, C, Python) data analysis software is a big plus.
Self-starter with strong analytical and organizational skills; must be able to manage multiple projects with complete accuracy, and be prompt with any reasonable deadlines.
Demonstrated commitment and responsibility in a team environment, as well as regular availability to answer any client questions.
Effective communicator who is very adept at dealing with a wide variety of situations and a highly diverse array of clients.


What will you gain from your experience in working as an analyst or editor for Optimum?

Research experience under the tutelage of MS and PhD level statisticians and qualitative analysts who have teaching and publication experience from top institutions in the United States.
Opportunities to advance your knowledge of data analysis software in virtually any applied research setting.
The ability to identify limitations and issues with doctoral research, as well as problem-solving abilities typically asked for by committees at institutions across the world.
The ability to write and present oneself in a way that will be favorably received by any academic or corporate audience.
The ability to effectively review, revise, and update any research projects quickly and efficiently.


How to apply

Send a resume and a cover letter to info@optimumresearchconsulting.com
Please be sure to include any writing samples which demonstrate your abilities as a writer or a data analyst, or preferably a publication history detailing your accomplishments as an academic researcher. We will review and follow up on any application within about a week.

Location: Austin, TX or Remote, US
