Company Description
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description
Visa’s HR and Learning enablement Technology (HRLET) team strives to create best-in-class solutions for Visa to grow, retain and attract talent around the globe. We are trusted advisors to Visa’s HR and Learning leaders to design and implement forward thinking technology solutions to meet Visa’s unique needs now and in the future. We have embarked on a major transformation journey. We will not follow the ‘traditional’ IT playbook of simply configuring packaged software and requiring our employees to accept the limitations of packaged software. We will leverage cloud-based vendor applications and custom software, to build a connected systems architecture, that is reliable, trusted, responsive, and always available. We are creating next generation of employee experiences and journeys via self-service portals, integrated HR services within commonly used applications, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Management and Automation. We are technology experts in the HR & Learning space. We use our knowledge of vendor capabilities & industry trends to predict, innovate, influence, and deliver best-in-class experiences.
Reporting to the Director of Solution Delivery for Compensation, Talent & Mobility Systems, the Senior Systems Analyst is senior solution leader who can own a project end-to-end with limited supervision. You love to be hands-on, leveraging your HR systems expertise to deliver for our business partners. You look forward to developing the next generation of system experts by mentoring upcoming members of the team. You won’t only be responsible for project delivery – we’ll ask you to identify and champion proactive system improvements, improve upon our Technology best practices and champion them within the team, and perpetuate our culture of succeeding together.

Coordinate with third party vendors to implement new software

Detail functional specifications and coordinate with engineering resources
Conduct quality assurance testing
Ensure quality as configuration promotes from non-prod to production environments
Stabilize new applications
Sustain existing applications
Troubleshoot and conduct root cause analysis on application/integration failures
Ensure applications comply with information security standards
Plug into various projects with minimal prior app specific experience
Participate in solution teams. Identify WBS tasks for project managers
Work with partners to implement technical solutions like SSO and Cloud Logging
Ability to configure specific related Tool modules
Analyze data for discovering patterns or usage or history and trends
Develop Reports/Dashboard to help business analyze trends and take informed decisions
Identify potential areas of improvements in existing process and systems
Understanding of Business KPIs (historic and future)
Understanding Business Requirements and Business modeling
Data access patterns knowledge
Ensure data validation rules exist within systems

The Data & Analytics team is responsible for delivering accurate data on business performance & actionable insights to partners across the Auctane e-commerce products, our parent company (Stamps.com), and external partners. This is achieved through partnership with stakeholders from across the business to deliver both standardized & ad-hoc reporting, analysis & insights to drive business decisions and achieve desired business results.

Strategic Imperative:

The Director - Data Analytics Platforms is responsible for ensuring the organization is effectively using data to drive decisions, enhancing the data assets within the company as well as raising the analytical capabilities within their direct reports and across their partners. Beyond decision making, the team supports key functions of the organization from billing, accounting, finance, marketing, trust & safety, and product management; all of which leverage data and insights provided by the team to execute operational responsibilities.

Primary Objectives:

Manages and mentors a team of 5 to 8 data engineers, analytics engineers, and business intelligence analysts.
Supporting the business’s operational needs for data across finance, accounting, marketing, sales, and planning processes through owned data systems as well as downstream systems (Salesforce, ZenDesk, HubSpot, etc.).
Enabling the business through ownership of Reporting & Business Intelligence tools.
Raising the data literacy of the organization through effective documentation, training, and coaching.
Continue to scale and evolve the Auctane Analytics platform to meet evolving business needs and leverage the latest technologies to efficiently achieve breadth, depth, timeliness, and quality.

Qualifications - To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Position Duties (typical monthly, weekly, daily tasks which support the primary objectives):

Hiring and performance management of team members including coaching, guidance, discipline, reward, and annual reviews.
Own the administration of the Reporting Platform – including user permissions, report scheduling, data definition, and management.
Define, implement, and support key data feeds from internal systems as well as from external partners that are necessary for the measurement of business performance and key KPIs.
Increase the usage of Auctane’s reporting platform by key users across the business through evangelism, creation of key reports, and training.
Lead external vendors to augment internal capacity and capabilities for report creation and reporting tool administration.
Deliver periodic (weekly, monthly, quarterly) readouts on Business Performance, opportunities, and issues for use by the Auctane Executive Team as well as other key business partners.
Develop financial models to forecast the impact of key internal actions and external factors on Auctane’s KPIs, most importantly Revenue and Customer Growth.
Leverage historical data and predictive models to identify key historical factors that impact key KPIs, and recommend actions to drive future performance.
Develop KPI Reporting for use by Auctane Executive Team and all key business functions (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Account Management, Business Development, and Product & Technology).

Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other Quantitative Field (Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.) or equivalent years’ experience.
Ten or more (10+) years’ experience in data engineering, data architecture, or business intelligence.
Five or more (5+) years’ experience writing SQL.
Five or more (5+) years’ supervisory or management experience.
Prior experience presenting insights from data to Senior Management and Business Partners.
Prior experience creating financial models for the purposes of Return on Investment (ROI) and Business Forecasting.
Data Science/Statistical analysis experience is preferred.

Skills and Knowledge:

Knowledge of BI/Reporting Systems: Looker, Sisense, Tableau, etc.
Understanding of Data and ETL Architectures and tools: Stitch Data, Airflow, DBT, Astronomer, Amazon Glue, etc.
Excellent communicator, both written (email, PPT) and in-person.
Passion for customers and experience in eCommerce.
Ability to work cross-functionally to collaboratively understand and deliver on business needs.
Able to balance fun & positive working relationships with the need to have direct conversations around business performance.

Computer/Software/Application Proficiency:
Strong use of Excel
High proficiency in SQL and Database navigation
Proficiency with Git and Jira
Skilled in use of data manipulation technologies: Python, Pandas, etc.
Understanding of Data and ETL Architectures
Working knowledge of Amazon Redshift – Cloud-Based Data Warehouse

Travel Requirements:

Less than 10% - Domestic travel to parent company HQ, customer visits, or tradeshows may occur, but will be infrequent.

Additional Position Duties: (The following is a list of what all employees, except those with medical accommodation, may be regularly required to do.)

Sit for prolonged periods of time
Utilize wrist and hands for a prolonged period of time
Walk short distances
Stand for short periods
Speaking and conversing with others
Lift up to 25lbs without assistance up to chest height

The Dell Security & Resiliency organization manages the security risk across all aspects of Dell’s business. With team members located in over 15 countries, you will have an excellent opportunity to influence the security culture at Dell and further develop your career.
Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Compliance Advisor on our Governance, Risk & Compliance team in the United States.
What you’ll achieve
The Compliance Advisor will be a highly motivated individual with experience of working extensively with Dell members to abide by enterprise information security governance requirements and procedures. We are looking for someone who has basic security governance and technical understanding, project management experience along with exceptional communication and analytical skills.
You will:
Assist in conducting reviews and doing post-review work for Enterprise Information Security Governance (identification, classification, protection, retention and disposition) for structured and unstructured environments.
Review, update and maintain documentation processes/procedures working closely with domain SME’s to ensure coverage and quality of deliverables
Assist with the development of program metrics and reporting tools that can be used to measure effectiveness and efficiency of processes or systems
Collect and analyze data on an ad hoc basis as determined by the needs of the business to drive process enhancements and improve user education/training.
Assist with analyzing, modeling and requirements to reconcile current process issues and enhance systems for future business needs
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
Knowledge of common regulatory controls, such as: NIST SP 800-53, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001 etc.
Highly motivated, self-starting individual, and able to multi-task and manage to timelines with very little supervision
Basic understanding of general business processes
Strong analytical and project management skills
Proven oral, written, and communication/presentation skills to a broad range of employees
Strong interpersonal skills that establish and sustain close working relationships with functional teams and subject matter experts as well as IT technical, development, and support personnel
Proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and SharePoint Site Collection Administration
Desirable Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Assurance or a related field and/or a minimum of 1 year of prior experience in an IT or audit related environment OR equivalent experience

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

Angi® is the home for everything home. From repairs and renovations to products and financing, Angi is transforming every touch point in home services. With over 25 years of experience and a network of nearly 250,000 pros, we have helped more than 150 million people with their home needs. Our products and technology help our customers love where they live while helping small businesses grow and thrive. We believe the home is the most important place on earth and we are at the beginning of our ambitious journey to redefine how people care for their homes - join us!

About the role:

Angi is seeking a strong Senior Business Analyst to join the Category Management team. This team seeks to develop targeted strategies, tailored solutions, and optimized operations to address the unique needs of the Homeowners and Service Professionals that we serve – all in the belief that this is necessary to unlock and further accelerate the company's growth. This is a unique opportunity to work on Angi's highest growth revenue initiatives, from early testing through scaling.

Our business is a two-sided marketplace of homeowners and service professionals. This makes our analytic opportunities complex and rich. We work daily with product, operations, BI, and other departments across the organization to develop, refine, and monitor results of initiatives designed to drive outsized value. Due to the multifaceted nature of our business, our team provides an excellent environment to combine and apply your business acumen, technical knowhow and quantitative skills to drive insights.

You will be responsible for driving impact through exploratory analyses, AB test deconstruction, KPI development and report/dashboard construction for the Home Exterior team.

What you'll do:

Provide data-driven insights and analyses for the Category Management team and category-related initiatives across the organization
Develop your technical skills – particularly in SQL, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, Looker, and R
Partner with our product team to model strategies for new products, provide insights to help shape roadmaps and develop test ideas
Collaborate across operations and various analytics teams developing exploratory models that uncover marketplace dynamics, user behavior insights and levers to affect each
Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and be the subject matter expert on Home Exterior data
Synthesize large data sets into digestible information
Establish statistical models and reporting to seed strategic ideation and monitor execution
Pursue new approaches to solving problems with creativity and innovation

What we're looking for:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technical field such as Business Analytics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, etc.
3-5+ years of professional experience in a financial/business analysis role
Advanced SQL experience and knowledge of relational databases, Tableau, Looker, or Adobe Analytics experience a plus
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information and presenting concise analyses
Prior, small company or start-up experience a plus
Exceptional quantitative skills and aptitude
Strong grasp of statistics and statistical software (R, Python, etc.)
Humble and effective cross-functional team player
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Intellectual curiosity balanced with an orientation for getting stuff done
Ability to validate results of analyses by reconciling with data from other sources
Attention to detail, a sense of urgency, and relentless follow through
Compensation & Benefits:

Commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living
This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package
Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)

Overview:

The Senior Strategy Data Analyst will work on strategic planning, demographic, operational, performance measurement, research, and
other reporting to improve the health of our community by caring for those who need it most. This position works with CommUnityCare
leaders to coordinate responses to data requests. These requests may include, but are not limited to regulatory reporting requirements,
research, and data analysis to support partner alignment, business development, program development, and program evaluation and
performance measurement. Work will include, but will not be limited to, preparing data for analysis, automating data staging as
appropriate; creating data visualizations and maps; analyzing data outputs to compose written reports that respond to data requests;
analyzing data collection procedures, investigate business development strategies, and identify patient access and healthcare
opportunities; and presenting data analysis and findings to leadership and other stakeholders.
Responsibilities:

Prepares data from multiple and various large datasets for analysis, automating data prep when possible
 Creates data visualizations using available applications (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, MS Excel, ArcGIS)
 Analyzes trends, determines accuracy and relevancy of data information and present solutions and alternatives to issues
when needed
 Applies inductive reasoning to combine separate pieces of information, or specific answers to problems
 Leverages literature (e.g. journal articles, white papers, etc.) and other publicly available data resources related to data
requests to inform analysis when appropriate
 Prepares accurate and meaningful reports that describe and interpret findings of analyses for upper
management decision making
 Presents data analysis and findings to leadership and external stakeholders
 Creates population density and other data driven maps using geocoding/mapping software that may stand alone or be
included in analyses
 Protects the confidentiality of patient records, information, and activities that involve patient health information
 Performs quantitative data analysis employing multiple statistical models and machine learning strategies
 Supports other quantitative and qualitative data‐related activities as needed
 Performs other duties as assigned
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
 Strong attention to detail and accuracy
 Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills with effective follow through, analyzing information and evaluating results
to choose the best solution to answer questions and solve problems
 Interest in learning mapping software or working with data within the health care sector if not already proficient in thisarea
 Ability to program in SQL preferably in an SMSS and/or PostgreSQL environment
 Ability to perform advanced functions in MS Excel version 2016 and later; functions include but are not limited to vLookup,
statistical functions, macro creation, pivot tables and chart creation, etc.
 Aptitude to work with visual applications such as Tableau and ArcGIS
 Experience and Aptitude to working with at least one statistical software or programming languages such as STATA, R, and/ or
Python
 Ability to:
o Handle detail and constantly change between competing priorities
o Conduct research into software solutions and products as required
o Follow data confidentiality and security procedures
o Produce quality work under tight deadlines with strong attention to detail and accuracy
o Manage and prioritize multiple projects with varying deadlines
o Efficiently shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information
o Accurately connect data from various sources
o Function and make progress in an ambiguous atmosphere
Qualifications:

MINIMUM EDUCATION:
 Master’s Degree in statistics, Public Health, epidemiology or relevant field
PREFERRED EDUCATION:
 PhD in statistics, Public Health, epidemiology or relevant field
MINIMUM EXPERIENCE:
 Three (3) years’ data experience
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
 Two (2) years health care industry experience
REQUIRED CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURE:

Epic certification required within 6 months of hire.Must meet CommUnityCare’s Epic pre-assessment criteria.

$70,000-90,000 per year base plus performance-based incentive comp
Who we are:
Our Mission is to be the right choice in service contracts.
Our headquarters are located in Lakewood, Colorado, and we specialize in third-party administration of vehicle and home service contracts and related automotive and home claims administration. Our expertise complemented by our strategic partnerships allows us to develop and deliver products that provide superior coverage and service.
We continue to experience tremendous growth, which creates great opportunities for our employees. In 2020 our company doubled in size. Today we have grown to almost 600 full time employees across multiple locations that include our Denver metropolitan HQ and satellite offices in Missouri, Florida and Arizona.

The Role
The Business Process Analyst within Methodology Consulting Services (MCS) is responsible for supporting the operational tools utilized by the MCS team as well as enforcing and refining the existing MCS processes to drive efficiency and scalability in the MCS offerings. In this role, you will be required to collaborate cross-functionally and influence a global team to drive alignment and standardization. As the team and organization matures, you will help coordinate the creation of Sales Enablement, as well as ensure strict security requirements are maintained for our customers’ and MCS’ intellectual property. Additionally, you will work directly with MCS leadership and leaders across various departments to provide data-driven insights for business and organizational decisions. Finally, in this role, you will champion an efficient and effortless experience for our new team members as they learn and master our internal tools. You will be influential in standardizing and maintaining the processes and channels of communication as MCS leads the rest of Professional Services, NI, and our customers.
Core Responsibilities
Refine and improve MCS processes to facilitate scalability of MCS offerings.
Refine processes, tools and flowcharts that document how MCS handshakes with other departments.
Develop and iterate templates that support the MCS offerings, including case studies, success stories and IP.
Drive alignment in Kimble best practices by providing oversight and maintenance to the MCS projects.
Expert in Kimble to resolve emergent Kimble problems for our MCS project managers.
Support MCS management to gather and integrate data for QBRs.
Work with MCS Director to analyze data, trends and define potential actions.
Serve as the main point of contact with the Sales Operations and Global Services PMO/RMO teams.
Support and audit the MCS Customer SharePoint hub and sites, ensuring security requirements and proper governance are maintained.
Manage and refine the MCS SharePoint sites, performing routine audits and organizational maintenance of the sites and IP library.
Analyze, automate, and display data in dashboards and reports to provide meaningful business insights to MCS and Professional Services leadership.
Coordinate with marketing and product managers to develop MCS Sales Enablement material.
Assist with new employee onboarding by providing and refining the training for our operational tools, dashboards, and sites.
Key Performance Objectives
Develop and iterate on existing processes and workflows that enable MCS growth and scale value-delivery.
Identify areas of inefficiencies and propose and execute projects to streamline the process.
Support MCS Director on all operational aspects.
Provide reports and dashboards to MCS leadership, enabling data-driven business and managerial decisions.
Support, troubleshoot and champion the team’s adoption and excellence across our various operational tools.
Qualifications and Skills
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM discipline or equivalent work experience.
2 years of experience in business operations or administration.
Knowledge of project management techniques and tools.
Skilled expertise in Microsoft Office 365 applications, including SharePoint, Excel, and Word.
Strong ability to work independently, make recommendations and take initiative to drive tasks and lead projects to successful completion.
Experience working with various geographies and functions.
Work effectively in an ambiguous environment.
Customer-focused, Services-oriented attitude and associated communication skills.
Analytical mindset, effective problem-solving skills, and self-starter.
Experience working with different data formats such as XML, CSV, DB dumps, etc.
Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires U.S. citizenship status.
Preferred Qualifications
Deep understanding of Professional Services operational tools and software (SalesForce, Kimble, Oracle) .
A bility to promptly spot areas of inefficiency.
Ability to rapidly craft structure and organization around content, processes, etc.
Ability to quickly learn and utilize technology for process automation.
Ability to foster alignment on workflows and process.
Ability to analyze data and communicate meaningful business insights.
Preferred location
USA – Austin, USA – Remote

IT Business Analyst
New Meridian Corporation, located in Austin, TX seeks outstanding candidates to fill an IT Business Analyst position. This position, reporting to the Senior Manager of IT Solutions with accountability to assessment technology engineering senior manager. This role is focused on contributing to the development and delivery of innovative IT and customized assessment technology solutions.

WHO WE ARE

New Meridian is a non-profit, assessment design and development organization. We provide states with technical expertise and the highest quality, research-validated test content that is uniquely focused on critical thinking, reasoning, and communication skills — the capabilities all students will need to thrive in the future.

Our mission is to advance the quality of public education for all students
by designing assessments that focus on the skills that matter.

Founded with the goal of enabling all states to be able to afford high quality assessments, New Meridian has created new assessment models and products to achieve that goal and continues to innovate to enable states to develop 21st century assessment systems that provide timely and actionable data that can drive improvements in the instructional core.
Our team is marked by our willingness to go the extra mile for our customers, our operational excellence, our deep expertise in assessments, and our enjoyment of and ability to solve complex problems.
WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

SUMMARY: Candidates interested in this position will have strong analytical skills and can work cross-functionally with multiple teams and business groups in a highly collaborative and efficient manner. In this role, our IT Business Analyst will play a central role in driving the requirements elicitation and elaboration process to capture customer and user journeys for various IT initiatives such as
CRM platform, Data Strategy, Enterprise Productivity Tools, RFP automation, full-service capabilities for all stages of development from conception to the delivery of the solutions and platforms. This role will also serve as the “voice of the customer” and a bridge between the business and technology team.

Successful New Meridian employees possess the following traits:
An ability to get things done: You are results-driven, resourceful, action oriented, and persistent. You consistently look ahead and anticipate needs before they arise.
Analytical: You have strong analytical skills and are comfortable reviewing quantitative data to inform your understanding of the market and customer needs and issues.
Creative mindset: You can quickly adapt and develop creative solutions to challenges. You deeply understand product management principles and can apply them to synthesize information and recommend a plan of action.
Emotional intelligence: You are highly self-aware and perceptive to the dynamics of key relationships. You are positive, empathetic, flexible, and curious. You naturally gain the respect of your colleagues through your authenticity, warmth, and competence.
Trustworthy: You are highly ethical, principled, and mission-driven. You operate with integrity and garner the trust of others. You exemplify the values of the organization.

EXPECTED DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Elicit, gather, analyze, and elaborate business requirements for various applications, platforms and solutions and enterprise solutions.
Ability to multi-task across multiple competing projects and priorities with a special emphasis on customer relationship management, enterprise data strategy, governance frameworks, data warehouses and assessment item banking technologies.
Translate business requirements into well-defined user stories with clear goal/problem statement, user stories, requirements, and acceptance criteria in JIRA.
Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA (Quality Assurance) process.
Participate in Scrum ceremonies and team demos to assist the Product Owner in user stories acceptance at each iteration while helping refine and groom the backlog on a regular basis.
Assist scrum teams in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure alignment with users and or customers' expectations
Be an advocate of and support enterprise IT strategy and New Meridian’s digital transformation initiative
Anticipate users/clients’ needs in collaboration with users and stakeholders and provide an excellent user experience for all users by accurately documenting UI/UX user stories proactively.
Participates in rapid root cause diagnosis of problems occurring within multiple applications and associated infrastructure.
Identify, create and facilitate process and application design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategies.
Maintain a list of requirements – both current and future. (Perform requirements gathering with internal teams, ensure understanding of internal teams and user needs).
Serve as a liaison between operations, program management, product, IT and other cross functional teams to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations.

REQUIREMENTS AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related engineering field or equivalent practical experience. 8 years of business analyst experience.
Minimum of 8 years of progressively increasing technical product/platform requirements analysis experience with scalable web applications and modern backend technologies.
Experience with agile development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and iterative & incremental design.

Job ID: 13059226

Job Title: Training and Rules Compliance Analyst
FLSA Status: Exempt
Department: Human Resources
Reports to: Director, EHS -Learning and Development
GENERAL DESCRIPTION / PURPOSE:
The Training and Rules Compliance Analyst is primarily responsible for identifying, developing, delivering, and providing oversight to training programs and operating rules enabling Loram employees to meet, maintain, excel in competency and compliance standards across all rail maintenance practices. Through collaboration with management this role will contribute significantly to developing and embedding the Loram way of working across all teams.
This role also prepares programs of instructions, training materials, delivers training, evaluates, and assesses employee performance/competence in the field. Provides oversight for this ‘on-the-job’ to leaders and front-line employees. The location of this role will be 50/50 field/office location and a significant amount of travel is expected.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Functional and Technical Skills

Collaborate with the L and D and EHS teams on formulating and implementing regulatory/compliance policies, procedures, operating rules, regulations, and EHS standards.
Supports the onboarding of new employees and contractors, as well as ensuring compliance with competency standards of a change in role (transfers, promotions) or worker location.
Analyze data and give advice on matters such as the introduction of, or changes to, workplace improvements to enhance overall/high performance.
Develop and maintain a compliance training matrix for Loram North America, including liaising with the L and D functions to ensure enterprise training is allocated in full.
Maintain industry knowledge through participation in relevant workshops, professional development programs, and effective industry networking.

Safety Focus

Develop robust feedback channels for a continuous improvement approach to training and competency at Loram, and actively liaise with all levels of the business to ensure training is meeting the required unit needs and to ensure training and assessments meet formal competency requirements.
Develop, educate, and monitor the application of Loram railroad operating rules, FRA regulations including Part 243, GCOR, and customer specific operating rules.
Oversee, review, update and implement railroad operating rule programs, reports, training, and procedures. Provide leadership to drive continuous improvement in the culture and performance of safe operating practices.

Operational Excellence

Leverages processes and systems relating to effective administration of employee competency and certification, providing reports to management in relation to employee competency and training status.
Ensure training is aligned with employee competency and compliance, providing coaching and support to front line leaders and operations employees as required to achieve the ‘Loram Way’.
Compile data, records, and retention management as required by Company requirements, Federal, State, and Local laws.
Work autonomously and manage multiple stakeholders/projects/tasks simultaneously to meet deadlines and deliver results.

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES:

Action Oriented
Facilitating Change
High-Impact Communications
Problem Solving
Work Standards
Values Based
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Associate degree in business or equivalent.
Experience: 3+ years of related training and compliance experience.

Working knowledge of OSHA and railroad regulations.
Experience as a trainer with a functional understanding in the operation and maintenance of rail machines and equipment.
Experience with competency frameworks and training assessment tools and practices.
Excellent communication skills both written and oral and strong influencing skills.
Strong and engaging presentation and interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships.

Licenses/Certifications: Obtain and Maintain railroad safety training and certifications
Or 5+ years’ experience combining knowledge of adult learning methodologies, competency frameworks, and application of OSHA or FRA safety regulations in lieu of education.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in business or equivalent.
Experience: 3+ years of related training and compliance experience.

Tertiary qualifications in Adult Education, Education, HR, highly desirable.
Experience in rail maintenance or rolling stock/track machine operations highly desirable.
Expert knowledge in FRA railroad rules and regulations.
Expert knowledge of Roadway Worker Protection.
Expert knowledge in GCOR and experience working with these rules.

Licenses/Certifications: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt and safety/training compliance certifications.

50% or more travel including international
Can stand, sit, walk, reach, balance, stoop, kneel, and hear.

Our Mission: To connect all people in need and the programs that serve them (with dignity and ease).
Aunt Bertha picks up where Uncle Sam leaves off by making it easy to find and apply for government and charitable social service programs. By organizing the world's human service program information, we make it easy for people in need and the people who help them to find help in seconds on https://findhelp.org.
We are looking for people who are driven to make the world a drastically better place and want to join our small group of thoughtful, committed citizens because they believe, as Margaret Mead said, "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has."
Our employees are aligned around this mission. That's why it is a requirement of our application process that you include a cover letter detailing how Aunt Bertha’s mission speaks to you.
Please note: If our mission doesn't strike a chord with you that is OK. But please consider not applying. We are seeking people who come on fire after learning about what we do.
The Heart of The Job:
The Senior Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in our rapid expansion to communities serving people in need across the US. We're working on exciting and innovative projects, and we need someone to provide business analyst support as well as technical project management support to ensure we're on the right path. Our customers are innovative organizations across many sectors, including healthcare, government, education, local and national nonprofits, and private consultancies.
The ideal person for this job can think strategically and understand our larger business goals to help us scale existing and define new integrations and have a genuine drive to build something big. They need to be highly skilled in partner communication and passionate about the world of social care.

Integration Scoping and Delivery (60%)

Maintain all Project Deliverables (30%)
Ensure project plans are up to date with implementation timeline and deliverables, stakeholders are informed, and that the project is delivered on time.
Responsibilities include:

Stakeholder Collaboration/Communication (10%)
Engage internal and external stakeholders to build consensus, manage expectations, and communicate progress throughout the delivery process.
Responsibilities include:Gather input from stakeholders to inform requirements definition and prioritization.Assist in Product Roadmap creation.Work with Product to make necessary decisions and manage changes during implementation.Regularly communicate expectations and progress to stakeholders.
We Want Someone Who (Qualifications)
We are looking for someone with a BA/BS degree, 7+ years of experience with project management, relationship building, and experience managing large enterprise accounts.
You are someone who:Has experience with technology. You can learn new technologies quickly, using their time efficiently.Previously worked in sales, account management, customer support, or customer success. You're comfortable working with customer teams.Has superior communication skills (presentation, written, and verbal). You're comfortable tailoring your communication to your audience (you'll be working across internal, partner, and technical teams).Works with minimal direction to achieve goals. You're a proactive self-starter.Can manage a broad scope of work expertly. You'll have a number of plates in the air, and you can ensure that none of those plates will drop.Is detail oriented. Deliver PoCs tailored to customers' needs and proof points

Meet The Team

Hitachi Vantara, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd., guides our customers from what's now to what's next by solving their digital challenges. Working alongside each customer, we apply our unmatched industrial and digital capabilities to their data and applications to benefit both business and society. More than 80% of the Fortune 100 trust Hitachi Vantara to help them develop new revenue streams, unlock competitive advantages, lower costs, enhance customer experiences, and deliver social and environmental value.

What You Will Be Doing

The Business Analyst/Architect is a techno-functional champion who leads the implementation of business technology solutions. This individual is capable of developing complex data

integration solutions and providing sophisticated data quality analytics. The right candidate for this position has a proven track record as a principal consultant with superior technical and analytical skills and demonstrates the ability to deliver complex technical solutions to broad audiences.

Job Responsibilities:

Serves as the lead technical and functional resource in the strategic oversight and planning of data models and ETL structural design and development for Global Services data creation and management processes and reporting.
Support business development activities by leading solution visioning, including development of architecture, design, integration and development plans.
Assists in defining vision, strategy and principles for data management.
Define standards for naming, describing, governing, managing, modeling, cleansing, enriching, transforming, moving, storing, searching and delivering all data within the enterprise.
Assists with architecture, design, development, integration, performance tuning, support and optimization of data management/governance solutions.
Develops applications demonstrating the use of Pentaho products advanced functionality and APIs.
Develops data and metadata policies and procedures for structural design and development to build, maintain and leverage the data model, ensuring integration with corporate data standards.
Provides extensive technical, strategic advice and guidance of the highest level to senior managers and technical resources in the creation and implementation of new data standards and databases.
Reviews and assesses technical proposals requesting changes or upgrades to the existing databases.

What You Will Bring To The Team

Self-starter, with a keen interest in technology and highly motivated towards success
Able to work independently and provide updates to management
Strong interpersonal skills to resolve problems in a professional manner, lead working groups, negotiate and create consensus
Excellent critical thinking and analytical skills
Self-directed with the ability to manage simultaneous engagements with minimal supervision
Customer-focused work habits and attention to detail
Professional confidence to deliver the right answer based on expertise
Ability to explain data integration tools, technical benefits and integration points to management and technical audiences
Must understand how data is, or will be, used and implication on people, processes, products and technology
3+ years in database design, especially data warehouse design, using enterprise relationship database systems (Oracle, MS SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and/or Teradata)
Experience working with CRM (Salesforce desirable)
Understanding of ETL or data quality tools such as Informatica, Pentaho, SAS Data Quality/Data Integration
Previous experience supporting BI reporting environments (SAS Visual Analytics, Tableau, Pentaho, etc.)
Power BI experience is desirable
1-3 years' experience in customer data analysis
Experience with data security, data governance, or master data management practices is a plus
Knowledge of cloud computing infrastructure (e.g., Amazon Web Services EC2, Elastic MapReduce) and considerations for scalable, distributed systems
3-5 years' experience working with business intelligence and data integration tools and development processes such as dimensional modeling.
Bachelors in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar; masters preferred

Our Company

Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what's now to what's next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.

Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage, and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive. Diversity of thought is welcomed, and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities. We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension, and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture. If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we'd love to hear from you.

Our Values

We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and flexible arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.

We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. With Japanese roots going back over 100 years, our culture is founded on the values of our parent company expressed as the Hitachi Spirit:

Wa - Harmony, Trust, Respect

Makoto - Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity

Kaitakusha-Seishin - Pioneering Spirit, Challenge

positionName: Lead Business Analyst - Opportunity for Working Remotely Austin, TX
description:

VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era by simplifying, automating and transforming the way they build, deliver and consume Information Technologies. Our team of 35,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today. Learn more at www.vmware.com/careers
Position Overview:
Type: Permanent Position
Title: Lead Business Analyst, Finance Systems and Solutions
Department: Finance Systems and Solutions
Reporting To: Senior Manager, Finance Systems and Solutions
Location: Palo alto, California
Position Overview:
As a member of the Finance Solutions team, Lead Business Analyst position is a role for individuals who want to utilize business analysis skills to actively contribute to project implementations, enhancements, in addition to supporting AR and SaaS stakeholders to scale the business. The Lead Business Analyst will work closely with Finance and key cross functional business groups; such as GPO Organization, Finance Business teams, CDTO (Chief Digital Transformation Organization) and IT Engineering teams worldwide on a variety of Process Improvements across all Finance systems with a key focus in AR functional area. The Lead Business Analyst will support the Business by contributing to User Story Preparation, process flows, detailed scenario mock ups to document requirements and use cases as part of Business Analysis, Testing, Training , Deploy phases of ERP enhancements with key emphasis on ItoC functional area.

Positivity in solving business problems is strongly preferred.

Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is a subscription-led and digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to empowering communities to thrive. The Online Specialist is responsible for reporting on our web based channels. This person will need to be able to dive into and extract data from sources like Google Analytics and similar and develop meaningful reporting. Additionally, this position will act as front line for data integrity and attention to detail is essential.

A successful candidate must show initiative and have a self-starter mentality while using a structured, analytical approach to problem solving, always on the lookout for process improvement opportunities. This candidate must show the ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment. This position will work as part of a nationwide team to provide analytic insights and build/run reporting on key data across all Gannett sites. This position is fully remote.

Work closely with partners across the Organization to compile, consolidate, and analyze data to support decision-making and executive presentations.
Develop effective means to gather and consolidate data to ensure weekly reporting is on time.

Bachelor’s degree in related field (i.e. Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Accounting)
2+ years of experience in analytics, data analysis and reporting
Ability to convert findings in actionable recommendations and effectively communicate to others.
Strong in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, v-lookups, VBA and advanced IF statements) and experience running queries against multiple databases.
Must have experience with Google Analytics.
Experience with Tableau a plus
Ability to work with remotely, independently and via tele-conference with team members to achieve group goals is key.
Strong desire for continuous improvement in how work and processes are done.
Must be able to manipulate large amounts of data from disparate sources and ensure accuracy and integrity of numbers.
Experience working with a sales team is a plus.

positionName: Investment Operations Middle Office Account Services Senior Analyst
description:
WHO WE ARE:


The Teacher Retirement System of Texas is the largest public retirement system in Texas, serving more than 1.5 million people. Innovation, technology, and collaboration make the difference as we strive to continue earning your trust every day. TRS improves the retirement security of Texas public education employees through our 'best in class' investment management and delivery of pension and health care benefits.


Our Mission: Improving the retirement security of TRS members by prudently investing and managing the Trust assets and delivering benefits that make a positive difference in their lives.


With the Investment Management Division (IMD) you will be joining a diverse group of achievers who celebrate the unique value individuals bring to support our shared cause: earning trust and contributing to the financial future of 1.7 million public education employees and retirees throughout Texas.
Navigating the current market environment takes innovation and we’re passionate about stewarding the right investments to make an impact both in the lives of our members and all Texans. We invite you to partner with the best financial minds in the business to manage a global portfolio of over $195 billion in public and private investments. Our success starts with you.
Compensation: The TRS Investment Management Division offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, annual performance incentive bonus, a defined-benefit pension plan as well as 401(k) and 457 retirement plans, and comprehensive benefits. Starting salary is commensurate with experience.

State classification information:
1084/Financial Analyst III/B24
WHAT YOU WILL DO:

The Investment Operations Middle Office Account Services Senior Analyst performs advanced (senior-level) investment-related financial analysis work. Work focuses on account services for public and private markets. Work involves analyzing and assessing account, legal, tax, and market documentation related to financial investments, including derivatives and physically settled securities, as well as analyzing and reconciling investment data and preparing related reports. Works under minimal supervision with considerable latitude for initiative and independent judgment. This position reports to a Manager of Investment Operations.
Duties and Responsibilities
Data Analysis and ReconciliationAnalyzes and assesses account, legal, tax, and market documentation related to financial investment, including derivatives and physically settled securities.Manages the account on/off boarding operational process with the Custodian Bank, external counterparties, and internal systems. Assists with the external manager on/off-boarding for new or terminating managers.
 Coordinates with TRS legal staff on regulatory issues and on multiple types of requests, including account agreements, Power of Attorneys, local market documentation, proxy related documentation, and apostilles.
 Liaises between TRS’s tax advisor, Custodian Bank and external counterparties to ensure appropriate exchange of information and data.
 Monitors, verifies and reports investment information.
 Analyzes market data, pricing, trading information, corporate actions, and other issues that affect portfolio valuation, performance, compliance and regulations.
 Researches the causes of discrepancies on investment book of record data on a daily, monthly, quarterly, or annual basis, including conferring with internal and external investment managers, accounting, custodian, and investment systems and ability to explain these discrepancies.
 Synthesizes and integrates data for investment decision making.
 Understands compliance rules and collaborates with internal and external investment managers, custodian and investment systems to ensure proper methodology, reconciles differences, and flags alerts to the front office for action.
 Actively researches and identifies areas for improvement around operations, reporting and investment systems.
 Updates and maintains operational documentation, policies and procedures.
 Facilitates resolutions cross-organization.
 Improves business processes by streamlining and standardizing data across the organization.
 Focuses on automating manual heavy tasks to minimize repetitive pain points.
 Organizes and prioritizes task in an innovative and effective way.

ReportingCompiles data and prepares detailed periodic and ad hoc reports on data reconciliation, portfolio valuation, holdings, fees, expenses and other investment information using report writing, database, spreadsheet and other software, for use by agency management, Investment's staff, the legislature and vendors, and to provide information requested under the Open Records Act. Leads transaction communications and takes appropriate corrective action to ensure accurate data flow between parties, including TRS, custodian and other internal and external investment systems.
 Participates on or leads various investment operations related projects to implement strategic initiatives or improve system integration between applications, custodian, internal and external partners, portfolio analytics and other third-party software.
 Prepares, generates and analyzes data for investment decision-making including exposures, compliance, portfolio views, performance, risk, liquidity, fees, Management Committee and Board Reporting.

Performs related work as assigned
WHAT YOU WILL BRING:
Minimum Required Qualifications
Education:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in business administration, finance, accounting, operations research, math, information technology, liberal arts or a related area.A Master’s degree in a related area may substitute for a year of the required experience.
Experience:Three (3) years of full-time accounting, financial analysis, trade settlement or related investment documentation experience requiring compilation, reconciliation, and/or analysis of detailed information.
Registration, Certification, or Licensure:None.
Preferred Qualifications
Three (3) years of full-time professional investments experience or other experience involving a high degree of skill in data analysis and evaluation.Certification as a Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and/or Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA) or working towards CPA/CFA/CAIA.Experience with software languages, database and report writing technology (SQL, SSRS, and PowerBI).Basic understanding of capital markets, investment securities (equities, bonds, and derivatives), and/or private markets (real estate or private equity).Basic understanding of investment performance measurement.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of:Knowledge of investment concepts, terminology, styles, models, strategies and fundamental and quantitative investment factors.
Skill in:Performing complex financial analysis.Verifying and auditing financial data.Using a computer in a Windows environment with MS Office word processing, spreadsheet (including advanced Excel functions and macros), and database systems; report writing; and other business software.Conducting data searches and evaluations of large amounts of information, performing complex statistical analysis of the data, and preparing concise and accurate reports.Communicating complex technical information, verbally and in writing, including presenting analysis.Organizing and coordinating work assignments to effectively meet frequent and/or multiple deadlines, in handling multiple tasks simultaneously, and in managing conflicting priorities and demands.
Ability to:Establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, agency staff, and external contacts.Thrive in an environment driven by change and improvement, and adapt effectively to changing requirements.Work effectively in a professional team environment.


Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) Codes:

Veterans, Reservists or Guardsmen with experience in the Military Occupational Specialty ( http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_AdministrativeSupport.pdf ) along with the minimum qualifications listed above may meet the minimum requirements and are highly encouraged to apply. Please contact Talent Acquisition at careers@trs.texas.gov with questions or for additional information.


To view all job vacancies, visit www.trs.texas.gov/careers or www.trs.csod.com/careersite.


For more information, visit www.trs.texas.gov.

3rd-Party System Integrator/Data Analyst
(can be based in Dallas or Austin, Texas)
Summary
We are looking for a a 3rd-party system integration expert who will be responsible for creating and managing advanced field tools such as GIS-based maps and other utility-related 3rd-party tools. This individual will manage the data and the configuration of any 3rd-party enterprise system. The position will also support field and utility work through maintenance of these tools, data processing and QA/QC, spatial analysis, and general map/utility based problem solving.
We flourish when fostering strong collaboration, and therefore in this role you will be an expert contributing to different phases of the development lifecycle, involved in defining the problem, proposing, and creating the solution, and also play an important role in the development, configuration and deployment of the overall solution. If you are detail oriented, a problem solver, and have a strong eye for cartographic and visual design, let's talk!
Key Qualifications
5+ years of implementing GIS Solutions and 3rd-Party Systems for Utilities.
Experience of at least 1 or 2 full-cycle implementations for a utility (ie. Power/Water/Sewer/Fence Lines) with hands on design, development and deployment experience in 3rd-party system integration.
In-depth knowledge with GIS and Utility Product Architecture, Data Model, web services, python scripting, geo-processing services.
In-depth knowledge of data modeling, conversion, and tableau reporting.
Ability to understand, analyze, and define user requirements for a given 3rd-party tool task and recommend and provide a solution
Able to work well alone and with remote team members.
Multi-tasking and problem-solving skills are essential.

Description
As a member of our team, your activities will include:
Assist in the design, development, testing, and implementation of GIS/3rd-party applications to meet customer needs and enterprise requirements
Manages/configures 3rd-party systems and develops data organization/protocols
Develops scripts and tools for managing data, including designing data standards, structures, forms, and report
Formats and generates a variety of GIS products including standard and custom maps and map series, standard map templates, shapefiles, graphics, tables, and reports
Researches source documents and/or coordinates with others to resolve missing or conflicting data and other anomalies
Maintains clean, organized, and well-designed file structures for both spatial and non-spatial data
Spin up instances for 3rd-party tools remotely via VMs.

Education & Experience
BS or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, or related field or equivalent experience will be considered.

Additional Requirements
While the following skills are not necessary, they would be helpful in understanding our space:
Experience working with spatial datasets (Geojson) and curating them for use in a visual display would constitute an added bonus
Background in GIS is a huge plus

Come join The Veseris TEAM!
Veseris is the leading chemical distributor of the pest control industry in North America. We have approximately 500 employees, with an average annual sales of $412M. As a Business Analyst with Veseris you will be a part a growth driven organization, that values its employees and customers.
Primary Purpose:
This position is for a Business Analyst/Product Owner to support the D365 F&O implementation and adoption for all enterprise business functions.
As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for day to day end user operations of D365 F&O applications, achieved by assisting users in resolving issues, tracking issue trends, recommending and testing fixes, participating in roadmap discussions of existing and proposed technologies and applications. Build a strong understanding of the needs of the business from key stakeholders. You should be comfortable when asked to perform in depth analysis and research in a competent and efficient manner.
Essential duties and functions may include the following.
1. Meets with decision makers, system owners and end users to define business, operations requirements and systems goals
2. Provides day to day end user support and walks users through fixes; provides root cause analysis as required
3. Alerts IT/OT partners to application and/or system issues via escalation channels
4. Assists or consults during requirements gathering sessions to elicit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to potential system integration solutions
5. Creates models, use cases, process flows, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to developers, designers, and vendors
6. Writes and delivers reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address portfolio needs
7. Coordinates and performs testing, including end-user reviews for modified and new systems, training and other post-implementation and portfolio support
8. Manage the solution delivery via an agile development process within IT (development, application services, quality assurance, PMO, infrastructure, offshore test/development teams).
9. Conducts weekly and ad hoc meetings on program and program initiatives; track issues through resolution lifecycle; works with team to develop and deliver presentations for use in program related meetings
Promote Configuration of D365 versus Custom
Education/Experience/Training:
At least 3 years experience with MS Dynamics 365 F&O
Broad knowledge of computer systems and web based services
Hands-on experience gathering and writing requirements for business applications is required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy, ability to adhere to multiple deadlines and multi-task
Cross functional team collaboration
Must possess excellent organization, time management and prioritization skills
Flexible and adaptable to changing policies and procedures
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required
Industry Standard Technical Certifications desired: MS Dynamics and others showing depth of technical skill…
1-3 years of experience with Agile SDLC, and Application Lifecycle Management.
Understands industry standard project management methodologies.
Ability to work (at times) in fast-paced, deadline driven environments.
Specialized Knowledge/Skills:Knowledge and experience working in D365 or other major cloud-based ERP system a big plusExcellent customer service (internal & external)
Behavioral Competencies:
Execution and Driving for Results
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment; using measurement methods to monitor progress toward goals; tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals while deriving satisfaction from that achievement and continuous improvement.
Building Customer Loyalty
Meeting and exceeding (internal or external) customer expectations while cultivating relationships that secure commitment and trust.
Continuous Improvement
Originating action to improve existing conditions and processes; identifying improvement opportunities, generating ideas, and implementing solutions.
Safety Focus
Identifying and improving conditions that affect own and others’ safety; upholding safety standards.
Collaborating
Working cooperatively with others to help a team or work group achieve its goals.
Earning Trust
Gaining others’ confidence by acting with integrity and following through on commitments while disclosing own positions; treating others and their ideas with respect and supporting them in the face of challenge.
Active Learning
Seeking and leveraging opportunities to gain new skills, knowledge, and experiences; quickly assimilating and applying new information and skills to enhance sales results.
Physical Demands/Environmental Conditions/Other Requirements:General office work environment
The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Company Summary: Aeglea, we believe that every patient deserves a chance at a better life. We are committed to helping people with rare and devastating metabolic diseases who have limited treatment options because having a rare disease doesn’t mean that you are in this fight alone. We are building a pipeline of novel therapies designed to modulate the chemical imbalances that drive disease. By leveraging our unique protein engineering expertise to develop human enzyme medicines, we aim to improve lives today and create hope for new tomorrows.
Position Summary: The Sr. Finance Analyst will be a detail-oriented professional that will integrate into a small but impactful Finance team. This position will be report to the Finance Manager and work with the broader Finance and Accounting teams to execute all operational and project FP&A activities. This position will be expected to support critical analysis and partner with other functional areas of the company. A successful candidate will be proactive, curious, and always looking for areas of improvement.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following:
Prepare, maintain, and review budget and forecast templates for various departments within the organization
Responsible for the timely preparation of monthly management reports
Prepare and provide accurate and timely analyses that collect and communicate business results, variances, and performance trends and make recommendations to drive profitability
Work closely with key business partners to identify and mitigate issues impeding the achievement of business goals, to include but not limited to, reviewing vendor contracts
Utilize financial and operational data for advanced planning, forecasting, modeling, what-if analysis, and ad hoc analysis
Ensures key drivers behind budgets and estimates are understood and clearly communicated to management
Act as an intermediary between Procurement/Accounts Payable and Finance, assisting with SOWs, purchase orders, change orders, and invoicing as required
Challenge processes and the status quo to drive improvements.
Support data analysis of various projects
Support plan analysis, test for accuracy and consistency
Support FP&A process design and continuous improvement efforts
Support effective cost control and cost management behavior
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Education/Experience: The ideal candidate will offer:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or equivalent is preferred
Minimum of 2 to 4 years of experience in FP&A roles or equivalent experience
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to sort/mine large sets of data from multiple data sources
Capable of building strong cross-functional relationships with department heads to help correlate operational goals with their financial impacts
Excellent communicator who is clear and concise in explaining complex data sets and analysis
Demonstrated ability to structure problems, analyze data, and convert to actionable insights
Ability to multi-task and execute special projects as they arise
Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients
Ability to be analytical and handle data effectively
Confident with handling sensitive information and making sound recommendations based on supporting information
Ability to juggle multiple tasks while still delivering high quality results
Good analytical and quantitative skills and ability to handle data effectively
Strong written and oral communication skills
High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint for analysis and presentation of data
Experience in working with BI tools (QlikView, Looker, Tableau, Power BI) is a plus
Experience with Oracle/NetSuite is a plus
Work Environment:
This is a high growth, fast paced, and small organization. The ability to be productive and successful in a scientifically led and data driven work environment is critical. Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally on occasion is required, it is anticipated that this will be less than 10% of work time.
Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Light physical activity performing non-strenuous daily activities of an administrative nature. Including but not limited to: Sitting for greater than 75% of your time, standing and walking for up to 25% of your time. Manual dexterity sufficient to reach/handle items and work with the fingers. Use of hands to fingers for typing and other computer activity for up to 75% of your time. Reaching with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl less than 25% of your time. Ability to lift, up to 25lbs, less than 25% of the time.
The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.

positionName: Data and Analytics Consultant - Remote/WFH Option
description:
Data and Analytics Consultant
Location: Austin, TX
Type: Full Time
**Remote applicants will be considered if they are accessible to our customers.
About KiZAN
KiZAN Technologies, a Microsoft Gold Partner for twenty-seven years, is always on the lookout for the best and brightest talent. As a gold-certified and managed Microsoft partner, KiZAN allows business leaders to focus on the vision, not the technology. We provide strategic planning, application, and infrastructure services for Healthcare, Manufacturing, Financial Services, Retail, Professional Services, helping companies identify and solve business problems and take advantage of opportunities using innovative technologies, demonstrated consulting expertise and proven project management. Our clients range from mid-sized organizations to enterprise corporations, and they represent a variety of industries. Combining world-class products with our commitment to excellence has enabled us to be the local and regional technology solution provider of choice.

As a company, we exist to enable everyone to follow their passion. We succeed by attracting, developing, empowering, and promoting quality people; we embrace, kaizen, and evangelize processes; and place high value on continuous learning, creativity and an entrepreneurial spirit. As a team, we strive to create Raving Fans with our clients, as well as our employees. KiZAN provides a family culture, has received the Alfred P. Sloan Award for Workplace Flexibility multiple years, and encourages a fun environment by providing "just because" events for our family to get together outside of the workplace.

KiZAN Technologies has an immediate need for an exceptional individual to join our family as a Data and Analytics Consultant. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, is a true team player with a commitment to success, has leadership skills, and will be able to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly-changing environment.

Responsibilities
As a Consultant on our Business Intelligence and Analytics team, you will work closely with clients to define and deliver business intelligence and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL Server and Power BI technologies. The Consultant provides guidance and hands-on technical expertise in designing and building solutions that unlock the value of data for our clients. The Consultant works both independently and as part of a project team on a variety of solutions, such as database design, data integration, data warehousing, business intelligence, data visualization, and others.
Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Implement data warehousing, reporting, business intelligence and analytics solutions

positionName: Senior Data and Analytics Consultant - Remote/WFH Option
description:
Senior Data and Analytics Consultant
Location: Austin, TX
Employment Type: Full Time
About KiZAN
KiZAN Technologies, a Microsoft Gold Partner for twenty-seven years, is always on the lookout for the best and brightest talent. As a gold-certified and managed Microsoft partner, KiZAN allows business leaders to focus on the vision, not the technology. We provide strategic planning, application, and infrastructure services for Healthcare, Manufacturing, Financial Services, Retail, Professional Services, helping companies identify and solve business problems and take advantage of opportunities using innovative technologies, demonstrated consulting expertise and proven project management. Our clients range from mid-sized organizations to enterprise corporations, and they represent a variety of industries. Combining world-class products with our commitment to excellence has enabled us to be the local and regional technology solution provider of choice.

As a company, we exist to enable everyone to follow their passion. We succeed by attracting, developing, empowering, and promoting quality people; we embrace, kaizen, and evangelize processes; and place high value on continuous learning, creativity and an entrepreneurial spirit. As a team, we strive to create Raving Fans with our clients, as well as our employees. KiZAN provides a family culture, has received the Alfred P. Sloan Award for Workplace Flexibility multiple years, and encourages a fun environment by providing "just because" events for our family to get together outside of the workplace.

KiZAN has an immediate need for an exceptional individual to join our family as a Senior Data and Analytics Consultant. The ideal candidate has a passion for data analytics, strong communication skills, is a true team player with a commitment to excellence and will be able to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment.

The Senior Consultant provides vision, direction, as well as hands-on technical expertise in designing and building solutions that unlock the value of data for our clients. The Senior Consultant works both independently and as part of a project team on a variety of solutions, such as data warehousing, business intelligence, data visualization, big data analytics, predictive analytics, and others.

Communicate with clients about project status, handle both routine and complex customer concerns, involving Practice Lead or Project Manager as needed
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business, mathematics, engineering, or equivalent work experience
5+ years building data warehousing, business intelligence, and analytics solutions using Microsoft technologies
5+ years with SQL Server with strong T-SQL development skills
2+ years using SSAS, with proficiency in MDX and DAX
3+ years using SSIS, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, or similar ETL tools
3+ years using SSRS, Power BI, or similar reporting tools
Strong working knowledge and track record of Business Intelligence development
Ability to travel, overnight up to 25%
Ability to travel independently to client sites; if by car, a valid driver's license or reliable method of transportation is required

Strong analytical, design, data modeling and problem solving skills

Strong team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced team atmosphere
