Ability to listen effectively and seek clarification

positionName: Data Analytics Specialist Remote - USA Citizen/Greencard ONLY
description:
Data Analytics Specialist - 100% Remote
Bigtincan is an AI-powered Sales Enablement Automation Platform that adapts to your sales process, delivering the right content for selling, training, and coaching at scale for all your teams and across all devices.
Since our inception in 2011, Bigtincan has grown into a global company headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts with offices in London and Sydney, Australia. We’ve partnered with Apple, AT&T, and other technology leaders and are used by the largest, most successful companies in the world such as, Exxon, Titleist, Guess Jeans, and Amazon, to accelerate their sales and marketing initiatives. Our award winning platform is recognized by Gartner as the only solution in their Sales Engagement Platform category to meet all of their feature requirements.
We're growing our team and looking for passionate individuals interested in working in a collaborative, energetic environment. Our Customer Success Data Specialist is key to delivering a world class customer experience.
This individual will provide support with data, automation, reporting and analysis. They will collaborate and consult with customers to produce data-driven deliverables aligning to the customer needs. They will also play a role in training customers on how to use and customize reporting features from BTC products. This role will also be a voice of the customer back into the analytics product team.
Requirements
Responsibilities
Lead the CSM team on all customer analytics matters
Export and enrich customer data in all formats with BTC data structure to improve usability and engagement.
Develop and implement database queries, Python/SQL scripts to generate reports and spreadsheets of customer data.
Collaborate with the global data engineering team in responding to customer queries
Assisting with data quality, data cleansing, and metric reporting needs
Author and execute testing scripts against developed web and mobile applications
Manual testing of new code and applications
Troubleshoot issues with our web and mobile applications
Suggest software and customer process improvements where needed.
Represent the ‘technical voice of the customer’ within Bigtincan to inform engineering and product management
Onboard new clients, so they are set up for success, continually provide proactive strategic advice and guidance, respond to client questions in a timely manner, provide Bigtincan best practices to ensure clients are achieving their business goals.
Act as a consultant, drawing upon past and peripheral experiences, while delivering, developing, and sharing industry best practices.
Support business review meetings and provide ideas that will lead to optimization, increased value, growth, renewal and advocacy.
Contribute feedback to Product/Engineering on product improvements to enhance customer engagement.
Work to set priorities and establish a technical health plan for open problems and resolve issues in a timely manner
Communicate thoughtfully to provide answers to questions for both technical and non-technical end users while also supporting a wide range of technologies to reach their goals.
Assist in the development of best practices and help maintain clear documentation for all internal processes and customer training.
Travel as needed for customer meetings and conferences.
Preferred Experience & Skills
Data is your passion
Attention to detail and quality: You have to be exceptional.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written skills
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and customer schedules with minimal oversight
Customer service mentality: be an effective listener, responsive and proactive
Hard-working with tolerance for demanding and dynamic working environment
Ability to manage multiple projects and set appropriate priorities
Data expert working with CSV, Excel (Macros level)
Programming language – Python or similar data processing/scripting
Create detailed SQL queries to report or cleanse data
Advanced experience in developing ETLs, services, and migration applications for handling, transforming, and moving data for internal and external facing data is required.
Ability to analyze process and procedures to find efficient solutions
Ability to work equally effectively as one part of a team-based project or as the primary resource
Good working knowledge of web-development languages HTML, CSS, and javascript
Has the ability to explain complicated problems to non-technical people so that they will understand and support the solution
Thrives in startup environment
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Ability to thrive working remote
Curious and eager to learn. Able to adapt in a quickly changing environment
Experience using sales enablement and LMS software a plus.
Experience using DataBricks is desirable
Benefits
Bigtincan is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

positionName: Lead, Talent Business Analyst - HR for Talent
description:
Lead Talent Business Analyst (CL4) - HR for Talent

Business Analysts provide support to the Talent Business Analyst Manager and Talent Business Advisors ("TBA") in the delivery of strategic services to the Business. They will also support the Talent organization during peak times to deliver key services.


Work you'll do

Business Analysts help to provide Talent consultative solutions tailored to support the execution of strategic priorities for the Talent Channel.

Supports the Talent Business Analyst Manager and Talent Business Advisors (TBAs) translate business strategies into actionable Talent strategies.
Supports the Talent Business Analyst Manager and TBAs while partnering with COEs and Talent Services to deliver all talent lifecycle events including, but not limited to, performance management, compensation planning, workforce planning, and other talent programs.
Analyzes data and fundamental information about the business and provides high level expertise and analytics.
Supports reporting efforts, data reconciliation, and analysis for the Business Advisor team.
Supports fostering change throughout the organization and ensure that Talent strategies are aligned with the firm's culture.

The team

The Business Advisor organization champions a "One Talent Team" through collaboration with the Centers of Excellence (COEs) and Core Talent Services (CTS) to deliver integrated Talent services to support Business strategies and priorities.

Qualifications

Required:

Minimum of 5 years of Human Resources leadership experience and/ or directly related experience
Undergraduate degree required (4 year)
Proficient Microsoft Office skills (MS Excel, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)
Team player who will flourish in a fast paced environment
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.


Deloitte's culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Why Us?:

With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:

Hanger is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to support our electronic medical records ecosystem. This position will primarily support NextGen PM/EHR, as well as other systems such as automated appointment reminders, net promoter score (NPS), and legacy clinical applications. Reporting to the Sr. Supervisor of our business systems analyst team, this role will be an integral part of the team and a partner for the business and IT teams. This role will be responsible for managing and troubleshooting requests in support of the entire clinical applications ecosystem.
Your Impact:

The Business Systems Analyst will:
Troubleshoot and resolve tier three support issues to end users for the NextGen PM, EHR, ICS system modules
Document and implement standard operating procedures and customer service guidelines relating to support
Work with business, IT, and vendor partners to manage customer requests
Serve as an internal subject matter expert on the NextGen practice management (PM) and electronic health record (EHR) systems
Troubleshoot issues and delegate resolution tickets to vendors as appropriate
Coordinate with development team, QA, and UAT leads to ensure changes are properly tested. Function as UAT lead as needed
Analyze product performance and respond quickly to diagnose and correct problems
Install software in support of the clinical applications ecosystem
Assist in refreshing non-production environments
Perform data conversions from legacy systems in support of merger and acquisition activity
Analyze data integrity on a regular basis and remediate, to maintain the health of the NextGen system
Provide support for new business processes, operations, and workflow
Document business requirements
Minimum Qualifications:

To be formally considered for this opportunity, the following requirements must be met:
Bachelor's degree from a four-year college
Two (2) years of related professional experience to include one (1) year electronic practice management experience (NextGen, EPIC, Cerner, eClinicalWorks, etc), with willingness to gain NextGen Certified Professional (NCP) certification within six months of hire
-OR-
High School diploma
Six (6) years of related professional experience to include one (1) year electronic practice management experience (NextGen, EPIC, Cerner, eClinicalWorks, etc), with willingness to gain NextGen Certified Professional (NCP) certification within six months of hire
Additional Success Factors:

The ideal candidate will also demonstrate:
An understanding of electronic practice management fundamentals
The ability to write and run basic SQL server queries
Familiar with ITIL (incident, request, problem, and change management)
The ability to deploy software given a user manual or set of requirements
Experience writing business requirements
Understanding of software testing methodologies and software development life cycle process
Experience with ServiceNow is a plus
Good communication, interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work individually and as a team
Ability to prioritize and plan own tasks and estimate level of effort for assigned tasks
Act with integrity in all ways and at all times, remaining honest, transparent, and respectful in all relationships.
Keep the patient at the center of everything that you do, building lifelong trust.
Foster open collaboration and constructive dialogue with everyone around you.
Continuously innovate new solutions, influencing and responding to change.
Focus on superior outcomes, and calibrate work processes for outstanding results.
Our Investment in You:

Competitive Pay

8 Paid Holidays per Year
Paid Vacation Time Off

Full-time employees are also eligible for short-term and long-term disability insurance

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...
Job Details
Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Our Insights colleagues are experts in human understanding. With expertise covering brand, innovation, creative, media, commerce and customer experience, they help clients define what brands should stand for, how to disrupt and renew their offer, how to connect with audiences and how to win with consumers and customers.
The Kantar Marketplace is the online platform through which we can sell and deliver a wide range of Kantar data and content assets, and research solutions – both self-serve and serviced. Our existing client-base is impressive and diverse; our reach is global, and we are excited to invest heavily in the platform.
We are looking for talented Business Analysts to join our engineering community and help us define and drive the future of our platform. You will partner with our software engineering teams and Product Owners to build the detailed technical backlogs underpinning the value-oriented delivery of our ambitious product roadmaps.
Your work will be as varied and diverse as the culture we’re proud to be a part of. You could find yourself closely aligned to 2-3 teams or you could be called upon to help resolve challenges from across the whole community. We believe in autonomous teams with responsibility and we’re passionate about continual improvement. Great ideas can come from anywhere and we want you to speak up from day one.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with Product Owners and Engineering teams to translate a higher-level backlog into actionable technical requirements
Create, refine, and maintain backlogs to ensure that value is delivered frequently and incrementally whilst avoiding the unnecessary accumulation of technical or operational debt.
Collect and address questions, doubts and risks highlighted both by stakeholders and developers
Facilitate meetings with stakeholders in other teams as needed to ensure the effective delivery of end-to-end solutions, for example, to organize cross-platform integration testing and align deployments
Pay rigorous attention to our Definition-of-Ready, Definition of Done and other vital aspects of Lean-Agile product development
Participate in test design and user acceptance testing
Create and maintain product documentation for users and other developers
Continually build your own expertise and share your learnings with others through brown-bag sessions and presentations etc.
Provide accurate, clear, and concise reports as needed by senior stakeholders
KEY CAPABILITIES
To excel in this role, you’ll need excellent communication skills. Whether it’s your participation on a video call, your active listening, your ability to capture information, or the clarity of the documents you produce; these skills will make all the difference. Your teammates, key stakeholders and colleagues across Kantar span multiple countries and great cross-team collaboration is a muscle we exercise every day.
Your experience as a Business Analyst or Technical Product Owner is also vital. You’ll need to immerse yourself in our products, understand how they fit together and how we operate and support them. Your analysis will ensure that are our end-to-end solutions are first class, that we’ve prioritized work accurately, and that we’re always delivering value for our customers.
You’ll rely on your excellence at organizing complex, multi-dimensional work streams. You’ll be good solving problems and understanding the trade-offs of multiple possible solutions. Whilst guidance is always on-hand, you’ll be expected to work autonomously in today’s environment of constant change. You’ll be part of a leadership team in which everyone is expected to contribute.
Essential experience
Experience as business analyst, project manager, product owner or other equivalent role in software development (web-application especially)
Experience of working collaboratively with agile development teams
Desirable experience
Experience working with teams across multiple countries
Microsoft Azure DevOps
Some experience with creating flow diagrams for visualizing requirements (i.e. Visio, PlantUML or other similar)
Essential skills
Ability to communicate fluently in English – especially when conveying technical detail and business value
Strong Business Analysis skills and the ability to extract non-functional requirements from overall business objectives
Ability to plan, schedule and monitor own work in a systematic and analytical manner within a limited time horizon
Desirable skills
Knowledge of SQL queries and database reading
Experience with Application Insights or other data analysing tool for web applications
Experience or interest in market research field
Using PowerBI to analyse and visualize data
Basic knowledge of HTML and debugging web applications
Familiarity with GitFlow

Our Mission is to Make Healthcare Right. Together. Built upon the belief that by connecting and aligning the best local resources in healthcare delivery with the financing of care, we can deliver a superior consumer experience, lower costs, and optimized clinical outcomes.

What drives our mission? The company values we live and breathe every day. We keep it simple: Be Brave. Be Brilliant. Be Accountable. Be Inclusive. Be Collaborative.

If you share our passion for changing healthcare so all people can live healthy, brighter lives – apply to join our team.
SCOPE OF ROLE

The Senior Risk Adjustment Business Analyst will focus on gap closure, you will be responsible for leading care gap focused discussions with internal and external teams, measuring performance against goals to acknowledge and remove barriers to success, facilitating innovative solutions to accuracy capture, and the day-to-day facilitation of our team's relationships with Care Partners, Markets, and Clinical Teams through the risk adjustment lens. This role works across departments, teams, project development offices, and lines of business to deliver a best-in-class business results under strict regulatory adherence and compliance mindset.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

The Senior Risk Adjustment Business Analyst job description is intended to point out major responsibilities within the role, but it is not limited to these items.
Owns monthly gap reporting cadence, preparation, and data summarization
Authors Executive level presentations and hosts monthly meetings
Shares Care Partner related metrics with leadership teams on a cyclical basis
Finds, communicates, and escalates root causes and ad hoc nuances
Leads data refinements, ETL conversations, and reporting requirements discussions
Assists with, tracks, and helps implement risk adjustment related initiatives and strategies
Leads annual readiness by ensuring proper setup of risk activities for new products and markets
Authors and updates policies, procedures, and program guides
Follows, reports, and adheres to all regulatory guidance
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.
The majority of work responsibilities are performed in an open office setting, carrying out detailed work sitting at a desk/table and working on the computer. Travel may be required.

EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's Degree required, ideally in a healthcare or technical related field
Three (3) years' experience in Medicare Advantage, Commercial, and related encounters submission management, health care, and risk adjustment required
Five (5) years' experience managing and reporting on progress of department initiatives required
In-depth knowledge of Medicare Advantage, Commercial, and related encounters or claims lifecycle required
Proven ability to communicate Medicare Advantage, Commercial, and related encounters or claims accuracy and reconciliation required
Extensive knowledge of risk adjustment models and strategies, preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office Products; Word, Excel, PowerPoint, advanced proficiency preferred

PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES

Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to meet business needs
Experience working with Risk Adjustment vendors
Demonstrated knowledge of risk adjustment regulations
Ability to work independently
Ability to build relationships with office staff, physicians, and market team

We're Making Healthcare Right. Together.
We are realizing a completely different healthcare experience where payors, providers, doctors, and patients can all feel connected, aligned and unified on the same team. By eradicating the frictions of competing needs, we are making it possible to give everyone more of what they want and deserve. We do this by:

We integrate and align individual incentives at all levels, from financing to optimization to delivery of care.

positionName: Lead, Talent Business Analyst - Consulting Human Capital
description:
Lead Talent Business Analyst


Business Analysts provide support to the Lead Business Analyst and the Talent Business Advisor ("TBA") in the delivery of strategic services to the Business. They will also support the Talent organization during peak times to deliver key services.


Work you'll do

Business Analysts help to provide Talent consultative solutions tailored to support the execution of strategic priorities for Consulting - Human Capital.
Supports the Lead Business Analyst & TBA translate business strategies into actionable Talent strategies.
Supports the Lead Business Analyst & TBA while partnering with COE's and CTS to deliver all talent lifecycle events including, but not limited to, performance management, compensation planning, workforce planning, and other talent programs.
Analyzes data and fundamental information about the business and provides high level expertise and analytics.
Leads reporting efforts, data reconciliation, and analysis for the Business Advisor team.
Supports fostering change throughout the organization and ensure that Talent strategies are aligned with the firm's culture.

The team

The Business Advisor organization champions a "One Talent Team" through collaboration with the Centers of Excellence (COEs) and Core Talent Services (CTS) to deliver integrated Talent services to support Business strategies and priorities.

Qualifications

Required:

Minimum of 5 years of Human Resources leadership experience and/ or directly related experience
Undergraduate degree required (4 year)
Proficient Microsoft Office skills (MS Excel, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)
Team player who will flourish in a fast paced environment
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.


Deloitte's culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte's impact on the world.

Recruiter tips

We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you're applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

What you'll do

The Lead Application Security (AppSec) role provides support to Government and Public Services (GPS) Business Information Security Officer (BISO) function for maintaining the appropriate cyber security posture for systems and applications supporting business operations and client delivery. This position works closely with internal security teams, development teams, project teams, and other partners to identify and assist in the mitigation of software vulnerabilities discovered in Deloitte written code and open-source code used by Deloitte. Additionally, responsible for maintaining secure development standards as documented in Deloitte's software development lifecycle.
Triage and analyze vulnerabilities discovered within internally developed code and open-source dependencies
Research known vulnerabilities to determine characteristics such as severity and exploitability related to internally developed software and its supporting infrastructure.
Research to verify or disqualify potential vulnerabilities
Build threat models and mapping software/tool dependencies
Perform research on new security trends, tools, and techniques to improve existing processes
Use data analyst techniques to answer research questions about vulnerabilities, and general threat intelligence trends
Utilize SAST/DAST/SCA and other products to identify and communicate security vulnerabilities to development teams
Provide input and guidance to remediate known vulnerabilities during build process.
Contribute to application security development projects and discussions as needed.

The team


Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The ~3,000 professionals in ITS deliver services including:
Cyber Security
Technology Support
Technology & Infrastructure
Applications
Relationship Management
Strategy & Communications
Project Management
Financials

Cyber Security


Cyber Security vigilantly protects Deloitte and client data. The team leads a strategic cyber risk program that adapts to a rapidly changing threat landscape, changes in business strategies, risks, and vulnerabilities. Using situational awareness, threat intelligence, and building a security culture across the organization, the team helps to protect the Deloitte brand.

Qualifications
Must be US citizen
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience (four years) in information systems security field.
5 years' combined experience in Information Security and Software Development preferred
2-4 years of information security technology experience threat and vulnerability management (TVM), cyber threat intelligence (CTI), and (incident response (IR), experience a plus)
1+ years of secure development experience (3+ preferred)
Experience using applications security tools.
Experience analyzing software code and documenting/providing technical expertise.
Experience with vulnerability and patch assessment.
Experience with vulnerabilities and dealing with vulnerability disclosures.
Strong knowledge of web application vulnerabilities, exploits, and remediation techniques.
Familiar with dynamic and static testing tools and techniques.
Familiar with secure coding principles and architecture.

Desired
GIAC Web Application Penetration Tester (GWAPT), GIAC Penetration Tester (GPEN), Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP)
Cloud security certifications.

Travel

Must be able travel as needed to support business requirements.

Security Clearance

Applicants should be eligible to possess a government security clearance.

Job Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Requisition ID: 166361BR
When you’re a part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
What will you do?

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, LSG Global Operations- at Thermo Fisher Scientific is a multidimensional and dynamic position covering data, process, and technology within the Business Intelligence team that support all LSG Operational divisions and functions. This role will actively participate in division/group data integration projects covering Enterprise Data Platform, Data Lake, Data Warehouse and Data Science programs. In addition, this candidate will lend their expertise by engaging in various initiatives that drive to improve the customer experience. The candidate ensures data related standardization and harmonization of Operational Key Performance Indicators, communicates functional data requirements and reporting processes are in place to address complex and dynamic business needs. The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate leadership abilities in communication and presentation to executive leadership and colleagues, ability to influence without direct report responsibilities.
Roles & Responsibilities
Leads and administers the preparation of executive-level reports based on cross team collaboration of data analysis (recurring and adhoc)
Deliver on reporting and analytical requests for various ‘metrics that matter’ for a given function, division or team
Utilize strong analytical skills to proactively interrogate data, highlight trends and actionable insights, and partner with stakeholders in identifying Root Cause and Corrective Measure
Gather reporting business requirements, translate into functional data requirements and creatively deliver dashboard visualizations to effectively and simply represent performance and root cause for a given metric (‘data story teller’)
Proactively leverage the Operations network to understand, analyze and/or identify leading and lagging indicators for a given metric.
Build partnerships with key stakeholders and provide front line support for business intelligence reporting and analytics requests from various Operations divisions/groups
Lead and facilitate large cross functional operational mechanisms with Senior leadership.
Business intelligence partner to functional leadership, leading metrics review
Be a liaison to business or business IT group, for BI enhancement requests, providing additional functional requirements and testing support of new or updated Operations reports.
Leverage Ops BI Intake Process to prioritize projects, effectively and proactively communicating progress with business requesters.
Develops and documents standard work processes, always looking for productivity improvements.
Partner and collaborate with BI team members to deliver innovative Business Intelligence tools and solutions
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field.
5-8 years of related business experience. Excellent working knowledge of key cross functional Operations business process, with 3 to 4 years practical Operations, Finance and or data management experience.
Strong data analysis skills required. Hands on experience managing data, it’s analysis, standardization, data clean up and consolidation.
Expertise in Microsoft O365 tools
Expertise in visualization tools i.e. PowerBI, Tableau, DOMO
Fluent in Data Warehouse management structures and external data skills.
Project management experience
Strong leadership, mentorship, communication and presentation skills
Competencies
Management, manipulation and analysis of large data sets from various source systems
Ability to assess, balance and articulate business data needs vs. any system constraints and identify innovative solutions as workarounds
Strong analytical skills to understand and determine key drivers of performance.
Able to articulate information, findings and complex data solutions concisely and with clarity at senior management level
Excellent oral and written communication skills, and ability to provide strategic direction to both technical and business organizations
Strong project management skills to balance multiple projects and prioritize effectively.
Ability to constructively negotiate discussions to ensure Global Ops KPI definitions and calculations are maintained.
Understanding of transactional data & flows across systems, data mapping and hierarchy concepts, and management reporting
Exposure/experience with IT infrastructure, IT application technologies, frameworks and data management background, preferred
Independent worker and as a member of a cross-functional team
Can mentor team members, working collaboratively on initiatives, elevating the final deliverable above intended expectations
Willingness to learn, be mentored and improve
Experience in data warehousing and analytics, leveraging tools such as data lake, AWS, PowerBI, Tableau or related tools; effective in gathering business requirements; Ops Planning/Manufacturing/Distribution/Procurement Reporting
Experience with ERP Supply Chain business process/systems and cloud-based applications
Experience on the execution of Agile/SCRUM processes and repeatable, predictable, and high-quality delivery of software solutions

positionName: Senior Associate, State and Local UI/UX Business Analyst
description:
Historically, the travel requirement for this position has ranged from 80-100%. The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities, and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. For now, all KPMG business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. At some point in the future and with the safety of people as the critical factor, the travel requirement will likely increase, possibly to previous levels, but KPMG is committed to balancing client requirements with new delivery capabilities.
The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. positionName: Audit Analytics Senior - Data Analytics Support Specialist
description:
Are you an individual with strong programming and analytical skills? Do you enjoy everything around data-coding, database structures, data transformations, business intelligence and big data? At Deloitte, we provide teams with a way to innovate their audit delivery to achieve greater effectiveness and consistency in executing the audit. In this role, the specialist will provide support experience, assessing and resolving challenging questions and issues while working closely with business stakeholders and internal clients.

Work you'll do

As an Audit Analytics Senior - Data Analytics Support Specialist, you will be responsible for resolving the issues and challenges pertaining to data with a strategic project to support the Audit practice and the development of tools and processes core to the business. You will be working with a team of experienced leads, developers and business resources to support and test key deliverables to promote audit quality and objectives. You will be part of a team working closely with senior leadership. You'll use your analytical, research and investigative
skills to:

Support the development and delivery of data models, data prep routines, analytics and other initiatives of our audit analytics platform.
Provide support on data transformations and to standardize content for engagements.
Manage ServiceNow ticket queue to promptly answer questions and resolve issues related to extraction, data model transformations and analytics.
Perform business validation and QA testing of audit analytics platform content.
Liaise and communicate effectively with cross-border teams.
Ensure the work performed is in accordance with quality standards of the organization.
Present technical solutions to team members and leadership.

The team

Our audits are fueled by more than just technology - what sets us apart are our insightful professionals, collaborative culture, and commitment to innovation and continuous improvement. Our audit professionals apply a streamlined, intelligent approach to the audit, enabled by innovative tools and technologies. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar of quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.


Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, data science, analytics, statistics, applied mathematics or related discipline
6-7 years of overall experience, with a blend of data analytics and support experience
5+ years of experience in technology development and building/deploying technology solutions
5+ years of experience in designing and developing data visualizations using Tableau or PowerBi
5+ years of hands-on coding experience using at least one of the following programming languages: Java, R, SparkR, SQL and/or Python
5+ years of experience in relational databases, data frames, performing data transformations and data modelling
Experience with product support practices (ITIL) and testing methodologies.
Experience with performing functional and non-functional testing of technology solutions with associated documentation
Ability to write and produce technical documents (e.g. Knowledgebase Guides, Operational Metrics, Test Execution Reports, Status Reports, Dashboards, etc.)
Experience in demonstrating technical solutions to end-users
Excellent business communication skills (verbal and written in English) to articulate problems, make decisions and to independently engage with business stakeholders throughout various phases of the project
Preferred

Good understanding of audit and/or general accounting principles
Experience in using an enterprise ticketing solution (e.g. ServiceNow, Service Desk).
Preferred knowledge of web development concepts (e.g. HTML, CSS, etc.)
Experience in Agile methodologies using Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly VSTS)
Background in ETL and data wrangling tools (e.g., Informatica, Trifacta)
Experience working with scaled agile methodologies
Experience working independently on multiple assignments or engagements, even in a virtual environment

Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!
Dun & Bradstreet is seeking an exceptional Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to play an integral role in the design, development and launch of a world-class business intelligence solution. This individual will serve as a key partner to business users looking to delve deep into data to create actionable intelligence that influences strategic decision making and company performance. In this role, you will be responsible for building and administering business intelligence platforms in Power BI and Tableau, defining KPIs, creating dashboards and producing in depth analyses that drive strategy. This role interfaces with a variety of stakeholders ranging from Finance, Marketing, Sales, Product and Engineering, so the ability to present data through a business-oriented lens is critical.

Responsibilities:
Design, develop, maintain and administer Microsoft Power BI or Tableau dashboards.
Work with business partners to identify, prioritize, clearly define and document analytical needs, while maintaining perspective on the core KPIs used to measure the business.
Deliver robust analyses and forecast models to business leaders in Finance, Marketing, Sales, Product and Engineering in an intuitive and digestible format to inform vital business decisions.
Mine and manipulate significant data sets for the purpose of gleaning actionable strategic and operational insights.
Identify and assess impact of proposed product/process/methodology changes to systems from a reporting & analysis perspective.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, Economics, Mathematics.
5+ years of full time working experience in analytics, business intelligence, or operations management. High Tech industry preferred.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Power BI and Tableau, with significant experience in excel.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills with ability to create visualizations, develop forecast models, calculate complex KPIs, conduct statistical analysis and present complicated subject matter in a clear and concise manner.
Experience with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or other web analytics tools.
Takes initiative, knows what needs to be done and executes with a sense of urgency, discipline and focus in an autonomous manner.
Strong collaborator – able to work with cross functional teams to deliver outcomes.
Proven ability to present data and insights in business context at leadership level.

Punchh is the leader in AI-powered loyalty, offer management, and customer engagement solutions for brick-and-mortar and online restaurants, convenience stores, and other retailers. Punchh brings the power of digital engagement to physical stores by delivering omnichannel experiences and personalization across the entire customer journey to drive same-store sales and customer lifetime value. Using pre-built integrations to 200+ third-party systems such as POS, Wi-Fi, kiosk, and payment providers, the Punchh platform delivers actionable, SKU-level data in real-time. Serving 200+ brands that span 100K+ stores in 20 different countries, Punchh customers include 5 of the top 100 North American convenience stores like Casey's and Racetrac and 37 of the top 100 restaurant brands, including Papa John's, Denny's, Focus Brands, and Yum! Brands (KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell). Punchh is headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Texas, Canada, and India. Punchh was built over eleven years by a seasoned leadership team with extensive experience in digital, marketing, CRM, and AI technologies, as well as deep knowledge of the restaurant and retail industries. In April of 2021, Punchh agreed to be acquired by PAR Technology Corporation (NYSE: PAR), a leading global provider of restaurant software. While Punchh continues to operate as an independent business unit, the acquisition creates a unified commerce cloud platform for enterprise restaurants and positions PAR and its subsidiaries to lead the industry with integrated point-of-sale, back office, payment, and guest engagement solutions

PAR invented the FIRST point of sale terminal over 40 years ago, yet we operate much like a start-up at the forefront of restaurant technology. PAR's solutions are used to serve tens of millions of guests every day in over 120 countries. Our mission is to build the number one restaurant technology company in the world and we're off to great start. We believe our customers want technology that is open and fast that enables their ability to innovate. We're looking for people who are hungry to go beyond the idea of 'just a job'. PAR's not for everyone though: We work hard, and we really reward success. We push ourselves and each other to be better every day. We're ferocious in battle but gentle in spirit. We're hands-on people. We keep our room clean and make our bed because details matter. We believe it is better to be fast than big, and that being both is best. We believe diversity creates strong systems and communities. We experiment. Sometimes we break things, but we learn quickly. We're honest and our intentions are good. And we always offer the last slice of dessert to our guests. We've got each other's and our customers' backs no matter what
Title

Business Intelligence Manager

Location

Austin,TX

Reporting to

VP of CS

About the role

Punchh is looking for a Business Intelligence Manager to help develop and lead the data strategy for our customer- and market-facing teams. As the Business Intelligence Manager, you will report to the VP of Customer Success and work collaboratively with the Customer Success leadership team to develop and execute on the overall strategy of our client performance reporting. You will partner with members of our Data and Analytics development teams to establish a working model that delivers valuable insights for customers, prospects, investors, and others in an effective, repeatable, and scalable manner. Collectively, your work will enable the business and our customers to drive better business decisions, and empower stakeholders to understand their business and customers in new ways.

The Business Intelligence Manager will have the tools for success. You will have access to (and help develop) a rich and growing dataset. You will create visualizations using Tableau, Tableau Server, and other tools you may determine necessary.


A successful candidate will understand and anticipate stakeholder needs across the business and think big when recommending solutions. A successful candidate will be comfortable navigating an ambiguous environment; know how to confirm and reconfirm assumptions; be able to harmonize disparate points of view, and apply knowledge of customer and business use cases to propose the right solution. A successful candidate will be technical; this role will act as an individual contributor initially, with vision of building out a supporting team as value is delivered.

What You'll Do

Define and manage a long-term vision and portfolio of initiatives to improve the customer experience, customer results, and business results through creating world-class metrics, analysis, visualizations, and data-driven storytelling.
Drive a Business Intelligence roadmap; prioritize business insight requests to balance the tactical and strategic information needs of the business and customers
Establish tools and platforms that promote the self-service delivery of business insights to our clients while also allowing our customer success teams to scale more effectively
Develop and maintain an ROI model for the Punchh platform and its usage, for use by customers, marketing, sales, and prospects
Provide business insights and intelligence for investor relations and marketing program purposes, as needed by both Punchh and PAR
Collaborate and partner with Finance, Data, Analytics, Customer Success, Marketing and other teams to understand, anticipate, and respond to current and future information needs
Lead the definition and governance of key business metrics, drive the vision and building of self-service analytic capabilities, and engineer data-driven processes that drive business value
Stay current on technology trends, data tools and techniques to improve delivery and execution
Create and foster an environment that values and promotes an inclusive approach to problem solving and continuous learning to improve
Identify customer and market behaviors and insights that prove valuable for marketing literatur
What You'll Need

Bachelor's degree in finance, engineering, economics, statistics, applied mathematics, data science or equivalent experience
5+ years of relevant professional experience in business intelligence, analytics, statistics, data engineering, data science or related field in a B2B or B2B2C company
2+ years of experience managing teams
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Experience gathering and aligning business requirements across stakeholders that span job level and function
Excellent working knowledge of large data manipulation and data mining using complex SQL.
Inquisitive mindset, with proven problem-solving ability, and a passion for big data
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills. Must be able to explain technical concepts and analysis clearly to a diverse audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers

What It Would Be Extra Awesome If You Had

Experience in designing and implementing custom reporting systems
Experience using ETL and database management systems
Experience with one or more reporting tools such as Tableau or Quicksight
Experience conducting large scale data analysis to support business decision making
Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers

Benefits

Unlimited PTO
Company sponsored health insurance
401(k) with Company Match
Healthcare coverage, FSA, HSA
Life and AD&D insurance
Competitive salaries and bonus
Professional development
EAP
Maternity and Paternity (Bonding) Leave
Free lunch every single day at work, social events, plus a well stocked refrigerator

positionName: Group Director Data and Analytics Strategy
description:
THE ROLE:
The Group Director, Data and Analytics Strategy leads the Strategy & Analytics group on a given client account. They work alongside Mindshare’s Planning and Activation teams to accelerate our clients’ data-driven advantage to win the most valuable consumer moments more often. We work cross-functionally to ultimately construct and measure media and content architectures to drive data driven marketing efforts in market against business outcomes.
In addition to working with Mindshare’s internal Planning and Activation teams, the Group Director, Data and Analytics Strategy will work with clients to enable the data and tech that lay the foundation for executing precision marketing. They will also consult closely on the paid, owned, and earned media ecosystem to maximize customer engagements, connecting AdTech and MarTech to better understand journeys and outcomes.
The person in this role will the required to lead a US-based team with members in Chicago and New York.
QUICK NOTES:
Client commitment will be dedicated to Kimberly Clark serving in an advisory capacity across all aspects of our Strategy & Analytics offerings for that client
The role will be tasked with seeking out and vetting new data, technology, and media partners across the industry that will help support our communications and media strategies
The candidate will possess a unique set of analytical, technical, and communication skills, as they are responsible for clearly articulating the detail behind the data and technology that inform and power agile precision marketing strategies
WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT THIS POSITION:
Opportunity to guide the continuous evolution of Mindshare’s Data, Tech, & Analytics service offerings
Fuses digital& data strategy, with cross-channel planning
Bridges the gap between ‘math people’ and traditional media planning
HOW WE’LL GROW TOGETHER:
Mindshare advocates career growth. We will explore growth opportunities with you across the Mindshare network, and GroupM/ WPP network as your career extends
Exposure both within the Mindshare/GroupM network and the larger media industry. There is high-level engagement from some of the biggest players in the field like Google, Adobe, Facebook, Salesforce, Amazon, and so many more to help us excel on behalf of our clients
YOUR IMPACT:
Mindshare is looking for specialist leader to drive integrated, data driven precision media and measurement. The role of the team is to drive Data, Technology, & analytics strategy to address Kimberly Clark USA unique business, brand and advertising challenges.
The person in this role will be responsible for the following:
Alignment and orchestration of data (media), technology, and measurement/analytics services to deliver client value (“An Outcomes Framework” to guide our data and analytics purpose)
Enable smarter audience-led marketing by creating a more robust data strategy for media, and collaborating on a technology roadmap, to plan media experiences against people, purpose, and intent
Helping clients understand the long- and short-term impact of their media and marketing investments
Deep knowledge of, and fluency in, media systems and data (online and offline)
Experience developing and managing complex measurement, reporting, and optimization systems for large, fast paced clients
The desire and confidence to lead cross functional (data/tech/analytics/strategy) teams, and clients, into uncharted territory
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Primary responsibilities revolve around leading a team to develop and execute industry-leading precision marketing underpinned by great analytics, modeling and measurement strategies:
Responsible for developing cross capability solutions (data, technology, and measurement) and will be accountable for their delivery
Outline a Precision Marketing thought leadership plan to manage with C-level and senior brand marketers at KC, including perspective on future of data in a post cookie/ ad tracking world
Scope and oversee (with the cross-functional team) of a bespoke KC planning system, including audience planning, budget setting, mix optimization, and testing framework
Use Mindshare Strategy & Analytics client value advisory frameworks to map out solutions, sequences, and roadmaps to recommend solutions that provide value to clients (e.g., develop Outcomes Framework with the client)
Priority Area #1: Revise overall approach to measurement strategy for a more person-based real-time performance marketing approach.
Provide advice on how to use analytics and measurement to understand marketing fundamentals (MROI, Reach, Frequency, Flighting, Audience, etc.)
Drive education around the relationship between advertising investment/activity, and KCs long- and short-term business growth
Ensure that KC has a long-term Measurement Roadmap in place, leveraging best-in-class internal and external tools
Develop consumer journey framework and decision sciences processes to impact optimization and ways of working at various stages
Priority Area #2: Refine overall approach to audience strategy
Redefine audience approach foundations (source of growth methodologies, foundational data strategy)
Identify the role of consumer segmentation approaches, and scope/ design use cases
Integrate Identity strategy into addressable media planning and buying strategy and operational workflow, including clear connectivity to comms planning and greater accountability through testing and measurement
Identify enabling technology gaps and scope and roadmap solutions as needed
Develop and maintain relationships with internal client stakeholders
Ensure appropriate staffing levels and expertise against the scope of work
Drive thought leadership, and guide the direction and development of the dedicated team
Provide staff with all the necessary tools and training to improve upon existing expertise
Ensure client service teams have fully optimized their media plans and developed a rich and well thought out audience, data, and measurement strategies
Write POVs on industry topics and educate clients on innovations in various spaces
Use advanced analytical and technology solutions to drive growth and connect media actions to business value
Develop a learning agenda with category, business, and media Insights
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience leading a customer-facing team of audience strategists, analysts, and data ops managers to develop cross-media data and measurement strategy across multiple product categories. This individual should have a strong understanding of tools in the media analytics, data sciences, and research space, be familiar with various modeling approaches, hold expertise in data strategy for audience-led media activation, and enabling technology to drive automation, standardization, and speed into a modern precision marketing engine. This cross-section of skills will allow the Group Director, Customer Strategy to recognize opportunities to build and execute bespoke solutions for KC. Experience with working across teams in different geographies and integrated agency models is a plus.
Leading and developing large digital accounts, digital teams/ departments, etc, and prioritizing competing projects and deliverables
Growing business via external opportunities/ new business or internal client relationship development
Experience in digital strategy, media, AdTech/MarTech operation, and applied programmatic knowledge
Previous hands-on use of a DMP (SFDC, Adobe, etc.) and analytics platforms - building and syndicating audiences, maintaining taxonomy structures, reporting and insights, troubleshooting
Ability to leverage disparate data sets into strategic media approaches
Embody an intellectual curiosity around what data means by putting it into context of the client’s business and focusing on asking the next question.
Analytical thinker knowledgeable in the online/offline digital ecosystem.
Experience working with business outcomes to provide optimization recommendations that go beyond front-end media metrics: Incrementality Testing, Churn Analysis, Next Best Action, Propensity Modelling, Media Mix Models, Multi-Touch Attribution, Sales/ Brand Lift Studies
Digital Media Technologies: DCM, DSP’s, Social Ad Platforms, Moat, DoubleVerify, NielsenMarCloud, Nielsen DAR/TAR & IAS, SFMC, LiveRamp
Understanding of all media activation channels (social, search, programmatic, shopper, endemic, TV)
Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Syndicated Audience and Measurement tools: VideoAmp, ComScore, Nielsen, MRI/ Simmons
Bachelors or advanced degree in Statistics, Economics, Business, Math, or Sciences is preferred
ABOUT MINDSHARE:
At Mindshare, we believe in speed, teamwork and provocation. Mindshare USA empowers people to challenge the status quo, through what we call Provocation with Purpose. We’ll encourage you to break the rules, knock things down, rebuild them better, and push the boundaries of what’s possible. It takes a team of people who invest in other’s success, and together we make Mindshare the place where we do the best work of our career. We’re a team that is radically honest – we call this our Authenticity Quotient. We are curious and competitive – that’s our Passion Quotient. We embrace teamwork and adaptability – that’s our Emotional Quotient. We’re proud to be unmistakably #TeamMindshare.
GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the greater work we can create together.

positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team

Analytics & Cognitive

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms
Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions
Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

Relationship Management of executive clients and sponsors:

Participate in Business Development, develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients, organize and lead pursuit teams, participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process, contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.

Practice Development & Eminence:

Develop practical solutions and methodologies, develop "thoughtware" and "point- of-view" documents, participate in public speaking events, get published in industry periodicals.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Required:

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Preferred:
Strong project management and delivery experience, including budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). Working knowledge and experience of MS Office applications and training development tools.
Located within a commutable distance of a Deloitte office.

Job Details
Our Global Enablement Technology Team is looking for a BA Lead to join our team and be a key player in transforming the way we enable our internal employees at Salesforce.


If you have a strong aptitude to understand business needs, capture project requirements, and collaborating/communicating with stakeholders to support the development and implementation of enablement technology solution this role is for you.


As the ideal candidate, you will have deep hands-on experience with the Salesforce platform and understand how to leverage data for practical business insights.

You facilitate meetings to understand business pain points, synthesizing the discussion and circulate meeting decisions and action items with clear objectives and success measures.
You partner with business process experts to write business requirements and create process flows to translate into functional compensation design. Engage with project stakeholders for alignment and feedback.

You lead system-related projects focusing on key strategic initiatives related to Global Enablement technology systems and are responsible for end-to-end implementation planning

Excellent written and verbal communication skills - including presenting and deck work

Structured thinking and problem solving - ability to break down complex problems into composite parts and a naturally inquisitive mindset to properly investigate and resolve problems
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements, problem-solve, and produce results
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to articulate verbally and written, willingness to appropriately debate difficult issues; ability to think quickly

Structured, organized, and a keen sense of urgency, and self-motivated
Strategic forward-thinking business operations thinker, supported by deep analytical capabilities and a data driven approach
Ability to work independently and thrive in a team environment
Ability to lead and coach your team to deliver value for our business

description:

Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.

SunPower is a global solar energy solutions company with a rich heritage of pioneering the best energy technologies in the world. Our solutions are unrivaled in terms of long-term reliability, efficiency and guaranteed performance, and our company is unmatched in terms of global reach and scale. Through design, manufacturing, installation and ongoing maintenance and monitoring, SunPower provides its proprietary, world-record efficient solar technology to residential, commercial and utility customers worldwide.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a brilliant, passionate and driven team of more than 2,000 in North America and the Philippines. In an industry that is reshaping the world’s energy future, there’s no better place to be than SunPower.

We believe that our employees create our brand – with each project, each communication, each task completed and each interaction. Experience is critical to SunPower in regards to not only our customers but also our employees and dealer partners. As such, we strive to hire candidates that are service focused. The experience we would expect the ideal person to deliver is:
Engineering Manager, Business Intelligence
Summary of Role:
The market for solar is experiencing both explosive growth and intense competition. The Digital team is seeking an experienced multi-disciplinary Engineer who will be responsible for the end-to-end management of our Business Intelligence development team, in support of the SunPower measurement systems.
This role wears many hats and the right candidate will be able to move fluidly between a variety of tasks including building and managing our BI technology stack, optimizing our data flows, optimizing report applications, designing for user experience, and managing to outcome and efficiency targets.
This Manager will lead the Business Intelligence team, comprised of engineers who are passionate about feature delivery, user experience and design, data quality and completeness. This team operates throughout the standard workweek, in a roughly 20x5 schedule. The BI Manager will work directly with the BI Product Manager to prioritize application and feature development, data quality improvements, performance improvements, and technical debt burndown. The Manager will own the delivery and quality of code for all of SunPower’s internal and customer-facing reporting. This is a critical role that requires a high degree of technical mastery and attention to detail. This role requires collaboration with multiple internal development teams, external vendor/service providers, and IT/Digital leadership. The Manager will be a leader within the SunPower Digital team, reporting to the Sr Director of Digital Operations.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain a Management Analytic System consisting of standardized purpose-built dashboards and reports that provide the information needed for common management duties
Rationalize the numerous existing reports and dashboards to provide a consistent foundation for understanding of the business by all colleagues
Drive for self-service, automated reporting (eliminate spreadsheet-driven reporting)
Leverage graphs, exception highlighting, and other visualizations to enable rapid understanding of data
Create ad hoc analyses and reports (potentially integrating data from multiple sources) to address the one-off information needs of the business as they arise
Provide actionable insights on performance vs goal assessments and advise management on recommendations to improve business results
Assist management and other colleagues with interpreting dashboards and reports
Present updates (written and/or verbal) on BI vision, strategy, and progress to goals
Build various dashboards to communicate project statuses and various platforms or system health. Ability to make decisions based on stats and metrics
Develop high-level design interaction diagrams, system functionality changes, data model, data flow, high-level interface specifications
Handle development and capacity planning, tuning systems stability, provisioning, performance and scaling of the application infrastructure
Create and implement a strategy to ensure we meet system performance targets
Inspect team’s work, including but not limited to pull requests/code review
Manage vendor relationships and budgets for third-party services
Help ensure information security best practices for all our BI environments
Desired Skills and Experience
Business Sciences or equivalent Analytics degree
3+ years experience developing and supporting business/customer-facing measurement systems
Experience and understanding of user experience/user interface design
Demonstrated ability to solve time-sensitive and technically challenging problems
2+ years demonstrated success in driving a high-performing development team
Experience operating within an Agile development SDLC
Extensive experience working in QlikSense (preferred) or QlikView
Knowledge of standard measurements for common enterprise functions (finance, sales, marketing…)
Good understanding of data architecture design
Experience driving data quality improvement efforts with success
Ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner
Good understanding of Python object programming a plus
Equal Employment Opportunity
The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer and makes employment decisions, including but not limited to, hiring, firing, promotion, demotion, training, and/or compensation, on the basis of merit. Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration.
