positionName: IT Sr. Business Analyst/ IT Sr. Developer
description:
IT Senior Business Analyst/ IT Senior Developer:
When you join the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have a real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
What Will You Do?
Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Information Technology department is seeking an IT Senior Business Analyst/ IT Sr. Developer with a DevOps mindset to support our MES (Manufacturing Execution System) software and processes for our site in Pleasanton, CA.
The individual will analyze, plan, design, and/or implement efficient new functionality for our MES to drive projects for New Product Introductions and Continuous Improvements.
How Will You Make An Impact?
In this role you will work closely with the MES IT teams and stakeholders across various sites and with other IT teams as needed. You will help to make the manufacturing process more efficient and your input will be crucial for introducing new products for our customers.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze the business requirements and propose solutions to cater to Manufacturing business
Maintain and enhance software systems/development processes for our Manufacturing Execution System, utilizing Java, .Net and/or other development platforms
Identify opportunities and implement changes to existing MES systems to reduce support
Optimize workflows and improve the cadence and quality of releases
Contribute to the development of tools to improve the efficiency of MES development, deployment, and support
Assist with testing the functionality developed in different testing efforts
Contribute to build automation and Continuous Integration/Deployment for MES and tools applications
Lead the scrum team by effectively using Agile methodology and scrum practices to build data driven manufacturing applications
Run scrum meetings like daily standup, sprint planning, retrospective, etc. by collaborating with the Scrum team, Product owners and stakeholders
Remove impediments, coach the scrum team, and resolve conflicts to ensure the team functions efficiently and effectively
Act as a champion, change agent, and mentor to bring new technologies, techniques and principles for software engineering excellence
Education
BS in Computer Science or similar degree
How Will You Get Here?
7+ years extensive experience in Web and/or desktop application development using Java, .Net or similar framework
Experience in managing, developing, or supporting enterprise MES systems, ERP systems (e.g. Oracle, SAP) etc.
Experience in SQL, PL/SQL and scripting languages
Experience with Java and Angular is required
.Net & Groovy experience will be used in some applications
Knowledge of Scrum practices and tools like Jira, Microsoft TFS or similar
Strong experience developing custom applications and extending packaged MES application
Experience with CI/CD tools and services (Git, Jenkins, CodePipeline, or similar)
Strong understanding of scripting for CI/CD (C#, Java, Python, or PowerShell)
Knowledge of cloud architecture using AWS or Azure
Experience using software development and integration tools like Github, visual source safe, team foundation server, job schedulers, build servers like Jenkins, maven, AWS SAAS etc.
Experience in using office software like Outlook, Excel, word, and/or powerpoint
Skilled in Software configuration management, incident management and change management using tools like Remedy, ServiceNow or Jira
Project management tools like HP PPM
Ability to think creatively to solve tactical issues
Preferred Qualifications
Life Science industry background / knowledge of molecular biology, chemistry, and/or biology
Strong experience using SDLC (preferably Iterative/Agile methodology)
Solid experience with object-oriented concepts
Experience with Camstar MES Development, Modeling, and API is a plus
Integration and working knowledge of ERP systems a plus
Strong working experience of Oracle SQL, PL/SQL, MS SQL Server, or MySQL scripting
Experience with ColdFusion, Oracle Forms, and/or ASP is a plus
Contribute to development and support of multiple custom tools and systems
Understanding of cloud automation toolsets such as CloudFormation, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, and AWS Systems Manager a plus
Thorough understanding and ability to use source control / configuration management tools
Understanding of QA / QC process and test methodologies
Exposure to ITIL incident & change management
Ability to drive and manage multiple teams
Project and/or program management experience
Scrum master certification is a huge plus
Other Skills and Abilities
Must be self-confident, assertive, and self-motivated
Strong leadership skills in analyzing a problem and contribute to quick resolution
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills; attention to detail is crucial
Ability to work as a team member and contribute to the overall success of a team as well as work independently and handle multiple tasks
Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership
Ability to develop solutions that reduce total cost of ownership over the long run
Strong written and oral communication skills with internal customers and all levels of management in a non-technical manner
Customer focus and proven ability to build strong working relationships
Ability to organize, disseminate information efficiently gain consensus and set expectations
Strong time management skills, prioritization abilities and drive to take ownership of issues and tasks
Location: Austin, TX

positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality Data & Analytics Dev Ops Senior Manager
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality - Data & Analytics Dev Ops Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team - AI and Data Operations

We establish and operate the data fabric of our client's largest and most complex deployments enabling organizations to adapt to the rapidly changing business needs using their core data platforms, applications and solutions. And we deliver this using a combination of people, automation, AI and industry leading practices to enable intelligent operations across all levels of enterprise.

We provide flexible, long-term, staffing models that allow us to optimize the data life cycle, drive agility and scale and put data in the hands of decision makers faster and drive enhanced analytics insights.

Deloitte's AI and Data Operations offering provides our clients a proven approach to optimizing, modernizing and operating their data and analytics capabilities, as well as their platforms and infrastructure. Deloitte supports Clients as they transition their data and analytics investment and operational focus from routine capabilities to a shift to driving business value and innovation.

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The AI and Data Operations team leverages the power of data, analytics, Intelligent automation, science and cognitive technologies combined with the Data Dev Ops approach to help uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy and Analytics and Cognitive practices, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

Stand up and operate their data and analytics related capabilities, applications and infrastructure by providing multi-year managed services leveraging the constructs and principles of Data Dev Ops

Support as-a-service based subscription models at scale that include analytics and data assets supporting industry and function-specific needs

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Experience with Data Integration and Big Data technologies including some (not all) of the following - ETL/ELT tools like Informatica and Talend, Spark, Airflow, Cloud Based Data Integration tools like AWS Glue, GCP Data Flow and Azure Data Factory
Experience implementing or operating data and analytics solutions using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Incident Management
Change Management
Problem Management
Escalation Management
Release Management
Configuration Management

positionName: Principal Business Development Manager, Data Analytics – AWS Marketplace
description:
STEM, or otherwise technical undergraduate degree
10+ years of partner experience at a Director level or above
5+ years working across the Data Analytics software, ISV and channels ecosystems.

Principal Business Development Manager, Big Data– AWS Marketplace

AWS Marketplace (AWS MP) is looking for a principal Business Development Manager within AWS Marketplace Data Analytics Category. In this position, you will work closely with teams across AWS to build relationships with existing, high-profile Data Analytics ISV partners, as well as emerging start-ups. You will be responsible for critical aspects of the AWS Marketplace business, influencing vendors' product strategy and delivering software in a new cloud model. You will identify short-term partner and product opportunities, while laying the groundwork for longer-term, strategic Data Analytics ISVs and products to be added to the Marketplace. In addition, you will be responsible for defining the primary use cases for why AWS customers use the Marketplace to deploy joint ISV & AWS Data Analytics category solutions.

AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog customers can use to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software, data, and services that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses. To learn more about Marketplace, our categories and the services we support, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace

Responsibilities:

Define and execute the AWS Marketplace Data Analytics software and ISV selection strategy.
Identify and recruit ISVs into the AWS Marketplace Data Analytics category ecosystem which could include emerging startups and/or established technology vendors.
Work with existing Data Analytics ISV product, business development, channel and field organizations to define and execute joint go to market programs.
Execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Marketplace Product Management & Engineering, AWS field teams, AWS Services (e.g. S3, EC2), migration teams, services, legal, operations and support).
Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint Data Analytics IVS + AWS value proposition.
Engage with Data Analytics ISV field organizations, channels and end customers to generate demand and revenue.
Understand the technical requirements of Data Analytics ISVs and serve as a conduit to AWS MP’s internal product management and engineering teams to inform and influence the direction of AWS products and features.
Prepare and present Data Analytics category and ISV business reviews to the AWS Executive Leadership team.
Lead, negotiate and complete complex contract negotiations and serve as a partner liaison to the legal group.

Position can be based out of Seattle, Bay Area, or New York.

Life/work balance

Our team is focused on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy and by prioritizing solutions and processes that enable us to scale faster than the business. There will be opportunities to work from home some days, as you will be traveling around 30% of the time with this role. Work hours are flexible and typically self-defined.

Mentorship and Career Growth

One of the keys to AWS’s success is its top-tier product management culture. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple AWS business lines that can help you accelerate your career and bring ideas to market. You will be working closely with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Marketplace Product Management & Engineering, AWS field teams, AWS Services (e.g. S3, EC2, Redshift), migration teams, services, legal, operations and support).

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Working with a team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results is exciting. Partnering with others in the organization is key to our long term success and is what helps frame our inclusive culture.


MBA or Graduate degree
Knowledge of Cloud computing technology (ideally AWS) and software pricing models.
A combination of sales, business development, product management, channel management and product marketing experience.
Technical acumen and experience driving emerging/disruptive technologies like open source software, virtualization, and Software as a Service delivery models.
The ability to work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within a partner ecosystem.
Experience working within enterprise software development industry, and with the enterprise customer journey to the cloud.

positionName: Senior Director, Data and Analytics Enablement
description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Director, Data and Analytics Enablement to join our Global Data team which is part of the KPMG International organization.
Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data subject matter professionals, data analysts, data engineers and program managers that enable data to meet the business insights and analytics needs of Member Firms and Global Functions
The Business Owner of the Global Data Supply Chain and the supporting processes and technology solutions; evaluates buy vs build and ensures that day 2 operational processes and procedures are in place and effective to optimize speed to insight, agility, maximize firm investment and manage total cost of ownership
Responsible for the development of the KPMG Global strategy for business intelligence and analytics, including rationalization and optimization of related tools and capabilities and development of multi-year roadmaps to deliver business capability and value
Develop and enhance emerging platform features for machine learning, analytics, cloud data lakes and warehousing and metadata management; drives the evaluation of tools and vendor solutions with rationalization across data and analytics and drives consistency
Oversee the implementation of the appropriate governance structure to prescribe data handling, protection and user provisioning controls, working collaboratively with the Global CISO and others
Accountable for proactive engagement and management of vendor management strategies to ensure optimal value and data capabilities for the firm
Work collaboratively with other Global Data colleagues to deliver data use cases to meet business objectives
Build, develop and lead a high performing team that delivers business value and optimizes cost and time to insight
Qualifications:
Minimum fifteen years of recent experience in enabling big data platforms, database architectural strategies, models for applications, metadata tables, data transformation
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university; Master's degree preferred.
Ability to understand the complexity of a matrixed professional services firm / partnership; proven ability to lead in a matrixed manner; ability to maintain a flexible schedule due to travel, deadlines and/or duties outside of normal business hours due to global nature of the role
Proven track record influencing diverse sets of stakeholders and driving common outcomes
Experience in developing, transforming and delivering data strategies to enable big data, analytic, and reporting capabilities, including self-service capabilities; working experience with big data technologies such Azure Data Lake Storage, Data Bricks, Synapse, Azure Data Factory, HDInsight; experience with cloud data lakes, data warehouses, and associated transformation to drive speed to insight and lower total cost of ownership, including establishing and deploying operational processes and controls
Exceptional verbal/written communication, collaboration, negotiation, facilitation and influencing skills to lead an environment driven by customer service and team work with the ability to direct, motivate and empower others to work towards the organization's goals, ensuring efficient allocation of resources across multiple functions; lead and ensure execution of strategic initiatives for the organization; ability to address emerging opportunities and how the team should be organized/staffed to realize them
KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

Overview:
Onnit Labs, Inc., an innovative health and wellness company headquartered out of Austin, TX, is seeking an accomplished, talented, and dynamic insights-driven leader to be the founding member of the Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team and standup the function for our Company.
This position is critical to deploying an ecosystem that our Company will leverage to make optimal tactical, creative, and strategic decisions. You will build a team, tools, processes, and governance infrastructure that will allow us to drive smart-er decision-making capabilities across Onnit to fuel our growth.
The role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer, and together with him, you will champion a culture of obsession for insights that has no limitations – from our customers to product development to marketing to operations to sales.

Responsibilities:
Technical leader and visionary of the Business Intelligence & Analytics team
Create and implement the Business Intelligence & Analytics roadmap for Onnit, setting the vision for and defining what success looks like through insights and trends into both customer-centric and business-oriented initiatives
Institutionalize a data infused decision-making framework and hypothesis-driven experimentation mindset across the Company by standardizing data collection, data automation, data management, and data use
Collaborate with Chief Technology Officer and Chief Financial Officer to harmonize our systems architecture and overall tech stack to support a world class Business Intelligence and Data Analytics function
Build partnerships with key stakeholders in Technology, Marketing, Operations, Sales, Human Resources & Business Affairs, and Accounting / Finance to identify analytical needs and gaps, challenge the status quo, improve data literacy, execute ad hoc requests, and develop self-service dashboard and visualization tools
First 90 Days:
Roll-up your sleeves and dive neck deep into our systems, data flows, and data sets. In parallel, spend time with key functional stakeholders to develop a high level understanding of our business, our strategy, the opportunities and challenges in front of us, and what we’re focused on accomplishing.
Develop a comprehensive plan – short-term, medium-term, and long-term – for delivering a combination of quick wins and high ROI initiatives that are the foundation for your roadmap and vision
Identify the resources (e.g. headcount, contractors, services / solutions, etc.) that will be required to execute your plan
Requirements
Educational background (Masters or PhD preferred) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, or Finance
6-8 years relevant industry experience in omni-channel retail, CPG, branded consumer, or media
6-8 years building, developing, and managing enterprise Business Intelligence platforms, database technologies, and visualization tools
4-6 years experience leading technical teams of staff and contractors to deliver large-scale analytics and business intelligence projects which require extensive collaboration in a matrixed organization
4-6 years hands-on experience in business intelligence roles working specifically with the business, producing analytical reports and dashboards, performing predictive analytics, executing ad hoc analyses, etc.
Expertise in BI reporting and database management platforms including Tableau, MicroStrategy, Redshift, DynamoDB, Hadoop, PowerBI, or Oracle.
Expert level knowledge and execution capabilities of common data structures, languages, and tools (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Storm, Kafka, Neo4J)
Experience in scaling and enhancing data capabilities, workflows, and reporting in NetSuite or comparable ERP
Expert level execution capabilities for modern recommender systems, algorithms, A/B Testing, data modeling, experimentation
Executive-level presence
Strong recruiting and people management skills, as well as experience mentoring teams and managers to high performance
Relentless desire to solve problems and ability to prove hypothesis or belief while being aware of biases
Appreciation for high growth environments that thrive on creativity, collaboration, and teamwork
Proven track record of success in fast-paced organizations with matrixed reporting environments, using elbow grease to drive solutions to tie together technology, marketing, sales, operations, finance, and human resources
Benefits
Onnit is committed to helping the human optimization journey for our employees as much as our customers. Some employee benefits include:
Full health and dental benefits
Basic Life Insurance
401(k) eligibility with company matching
Flexible Vacation and time off policy
Paid holidays
Competitive compensation
Tuition reimbursement
Fringe benefits including free access to Onnit Academy gym and Black Swan Yoga studios; copay healthy meals; and many others
EOE race/color/religion/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/national origin/disability/veteran status

Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner.
We are looking for a Tableau Visualization Consultant with experience developing user interfaces or dashboards on Tableau and advanced SQL skills. This candidate should be able to:

positionName: Senior IT Compliance Analyst - Remote Opportunity
description:
Why Us?:

With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:

As part of Hanger's IT department, you will play a critical role in supporting, developing, and implementing solutions for our employees, patients, and customers.
The Senior IT Compliance Analyst will assist in the implementation and execution of an effective risk-based program designed to identify, measure, assess, report, and monitor risks related to IT & IT Security. This is a remote opportunity.
Your Impact:

The IT Compliance Analyst will:
Conduct risk assessments to support the design, implementation, and/or execution of the risk management framework.
Conduct PCI-DSS, SOX and HIPAA Compliance reviews; partner with control owners to track and report on remediation of identified deficiencies.
Analyze data used in the performance of controls including but not limited to, privileged infrastructure access, change management and activity logging.
Perform internal control assessments of existing controls against established standards or emerging technologies to identify inherent risk and evaluate key mitigating controls.
Assist IT teams with the development of policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines that are backed by the NIST 800-53 framework.
Apply expertise to manage all aspects of the electronic governance, risk, and compliance system.
Partner with internal and external auditors or consultants to conduct compliance audits, reviews and/or assessments.
Track and report on governance and compliance related remediation efforts within IT.
Provide governance and compliance educational services to all organizations.
Assist IT in the development of risk response action plans to address risk factors identified in the organizational risk profile.
Periodically perform technical risk assessments and impact analyses as assigned.
Apply technical knowledge of IT security, infrastructure, and development best practices to enhance the organization’s risk profile and overall compliance and governance health.
Minimum Qualifications:

To be formally considered for the role, the following requirements must be met:
Bachelor’s degree.
5 years of progressive experience handling compliance issues around Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX), PCI, and/or HIPAA privacy issues for IT.
Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CRISC and/or CISA highly preferred.
Big 4 experience highly preferred.
Additional Success Factors:

The ideal candidate will also possess:
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of the following standards and frameworks to manage risk and/or report on compliance: NIST, COSO, COBIT, PCI, and SOX.
Proficient in performing audits, responding to audits, and collaborating with an Internal Audit department.
Proven experience prioritizing work, juggling competing priorities and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong technical analytic skills and ability to succinctly communicate with individuals of various levels of technical expertise.
Strong planning, communication, negotiation, leadership, and relationship-building skills.
Experience auditing and/or working with Windows, SQL, Linux, PostgreSQL, Progress, CyberArk, Splunk, Imperva, Active Directory, Service Now, Tripwire.
Basic understanding of SQL programming language.
Experience in data analysis techniques and understanding of how to write basic scripts to query and join populations of data.
Experience in data analysis techniques and understanding of how to write basic scripts to query and join populations of data.Act with integrity in all ways and at all times, remaining honest, transparent, and respectful in all relationships.
Keep the patient at the center of everything that you do, building lifelong trust.
Foster open collaboration and constructive dialogue with everyone around you.
Continuously innovate new solutions, influencing and responding to change.
Focus on superior outcomes, and calibrate work processes for outstanding results.
Our Investment in You:

Employees working at least 20 hours per week are eligible for the following benefits:
Competitive Pay
Health Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
8 Paid Holidays per Year
Paid Vacation Time Off
Paid Sick Time Off
8 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Floating Holiday
Life Insurance
Medical Flex Spend Account
Dependent Care Flex Spend Account
Free employee assistance program
401(k)
Full-time employees are also eligible for short-term and long-term disability insurance

positionName: Sr. BI Analyst - SQL, Python & Data Visualization
description:
Role:
As our Sr. BI Analyst, you will be a key member of the CDK/Roadster Analytics team, reporting directly to our VP of Analytics (Roadster). CDK recently acquired Roadster, so you’ll have the opportunity to experience what it’s like to work in a fast-paced Silicon Valley culture, but also have all the growth opportunities the larger CDK organization offers.
In this role, you’ll be working with some of the top Silicon Valley talent and have access to one of the largest and most comprehensive datasets in the Automotive industry. You’ll be working closely with Roadster’s customer-facing teams (Success, Sales, Marketing) teams as well as directly with some of the largest and most progressive automotive retailers in the world.
Our data is unique in that we are analyzing customer journeys. We’ve built a complete, high-fidelity and performant data warehouse (BigQuery & Snowflake) and we need someone who wants to help pioneer new ways to analyze and visualize the complex, non-linear journey customers take when buying a car.
You will use your advanced SQL and Python skills to assemble complex customer journeys, then use your data wrangling skills to blend it with other data from SalesForce or other APIs. Finally, you’ll either build advanced visualizations in Mode Analytics, enabling end-users to visualize the journeys and/or build models and algorithms to process the data in Python. We are a production shop, so the final step will be to harden your code and put it into production.
You’ll be joining a world-class analytics team, consisting of some of the best Digital Analysts, Data Engineers, BI experts. Furthermore, you’ll join a team with experience building real, productionalized analytics, generating real results. To get a sense of how the Roadster software works, check out these demos:
 https://vimeo.com/503514117 (2:20 min)https://vimeo.com/376907386 (2:05 min)https://vimeo.com/382641748 (1:27 min)
Your responsibilities will include:
Working with our field teams to understand what’s important to them and their customers.Working closely with our Engineering team and Data Engineer to acquire data sets.Building new visualizations and training the field staff how to use and interpret your insights.Building predictive and prescriptive models.Supporting what you’ve built into the future.
You may be a fit for this role if you have:
At least 2 years of experience with software, eCommerce or other customer-focused technology company.Advanced SQL skills, blending data in complex ways.Advanced Python skillsHave real experience building models in a production environmentAre excellent at building dashboards using a modern toolset (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.)Are really good at building simple, compelling Data VisualizationsAre an excellent storyteller - able to communicate complex analytic concepts clearly and simply.Solid Business Acumen, fluent in business analysis (revenue, gross margin, market share)

Nice to have:
JavaScript skillsAutomotive experienceExperience working in a startup or software company
At CDK, we believe inclusion and diversity are essential in inspiring meaningful connections to our people, customers and communities. We are open, curious and encourage different views, so that everyone can be their best selves and make an impact.
CDK is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive workforce where everyone is valued. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, creed or religion, age, disability (including pregnancy), results of genetic testing, service in the military, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
Applicants for employment in the US must be authorized to work in the US. CDK may offer employer visa sponsorship to applicants.

The Senior Market Research Analyst will drive our Americas Power Markets Research with data-driven insights. The ideal candidate will complete predictive and prescriptive analysis of power & energy markets, emerging technology and trends, competitive intelligence and provide pro-active insights/recommendations on growth strategies and improvement of business operations.
Employee in this role will proactively analyze data, and present insights to improve business outcomes and support growth strategy initiatives presenting it to executives and top management. Demonstrated expertise in/or experience with, complex markets and regulations governing those markets, including, but not limited to: competitive power markets, vertically integrated regulated markets, generation technologies, new energy research. Ideal candidates possesses a broad background to be able to conduct market trend research while also understanding the technical aspects of our products, including gas turbines, solar projects development and battery storage-new emerging technologies in the power markets.

Qualifications:
Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s Degree (B.S/B.A.) in Engineering, Business, Finance, Economics. Master’s preferred. At least 5-7 years related experience and/or training. Experience beyond 5 years highly desired.
Proficiency with production cost modelling softwares/ power system platforms: PLEXOS, PROMOD, Aurora
Handson knowledge of programming languages : MATLAB, Python, PSS/E
Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret research documents/white papers and market intelligence databases. Ability to write routine reports and creative presentations. Ability to speak effectively before C-suite executives as well as external audiences. Desirable: Multilingual (English, Spanish)
Mathematical Skills: Proficient in basic concepts of algebra and geometry.
Presentation Skills: Proficiency with PowerPoint presentations; and presenting business insights in a clear, attractive and concise manner.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be proficient with Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Experience with Tableau a plus.

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.

Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.

A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.

A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Activision is a global interactive entertainment software leader and the world’s largest independent video game publisher.
About King
King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.
A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes
Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.
Making the World Playful
Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Craft:
Job Description:
Activision Blizzard, Inc., a member of the S&P 500, is the worldʹs most successful standalone interactive entertainment company.
We delight hundreds of millions of monthly active users around the world through franchises including Activisionʹs Call of Duty®, Destiny and Skylanders®, Blizzardʹs World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, and Heroes of the Storm®, and Kingʹs Candy Crush™, Pet Rescue™, Bubble Witch™ and Farm Heroes™.
The company is one of the Fortune ʺ100 Best Companies to Work For®ʺ. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, Activision Blizzard has operations throughout the world, and its games are played in 196 countries. More information about Activision Blizzard and its products and services can be found on the companyʹs website, www.activisionblizzard.com
Your Mission
The Sr. Functional Business Analyst is a versatile and highly motivated individual who works with the other IT team members and Business Users on the Technical and Functional requirements definition, design, implementation and maintenance of systems
The position will work with the Sr. Manager of IT and Business Users in defining, prioritizing, and executing application enhancements, projects and end- user support.
Responsibilities:
Ensure IT alignment with the business through delivery of quality technology solutions.
Requirements gathering and scope definition with non- technical Business User constituencies.
The ability to interview various non- technical managers to understand complex, dynamic business rules/process and then create detailed, specific and comprehensive documentation.
Engage Business Users spanning multiple departments and ensure cohesive articulation of business goals and processes to ensure effective solutions.
Engage Business Users to support all necessary clarification to design and implement an effective solution.
Manage components of a project plan or projects.
Manage and address support tickets of various priority.
Strong functional understanding of the systems supported and the development framework for customizations.
Verification of feasibility of Business User’s request functionality and business rules based on existing technical systems and data structures.
Manage multiple priorities, projects in fast paced and dynamic environment .
Work with third Party logistics providers.
Provide training and documentation when required .
Ability to create and present key requirements artifacts, Scope Documents, Use Cases, Detailed Specification of Key Business Rules, Test plans and Test scenarios, Activity Diagrams, Business Process Mapping Diagrams and Documentation, Application Gap analysis.
Other duties may be assigned.
Your Platform
A minimum of 8 year of experience implementing some combination of Oracle Financials R12 applications such as: General Ledger (GL), Sub- ledger Accounting (SLA), Financial Accounting Hub (FAH), Accounts Receivables (AR), Accounts Payables (AP), Cash Management, Fixed Assets, Treasury, EBTax, Advanced Global Intercompany Systems (AGIS), Procure- to- Pay (P2P)
Experience as a functional resource in the implementation of at least 1 Oracle ERP Cloud project (experience or exposure on Financial Consolidation and Close Cloud Service)
Oracle ERP Cloud experience in at least one or more of these modules: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Asset Management, Procurement, Expenses
Deep understanding of financial close cycle and best practices
Understand and Supports deployment of consolidation applications
Knowledge of any of these applications: Sabrix, AP Imaging (Kofax Markview/Kofax Transformation Module) and integration of the third- party systems with Oracle R12.2.10
Demonstrated experience assisting in the definition of systems strategy, gathering and documenting business requirements, participating in fit- gap analysis, as- is and to- be business process designs, conference room pilots (CRPs) functional configuration, testing (UAT), business user training.
Experience with development and delivery of system documentations, such as requirements documents, test plans, and design documents
Look for opportunities and make recommendations for improvements to existing Activision applications and architectures, including configurations.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical/functional production issues.
Must be a resourceful, self- motivated individual with strong verbal, written and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently, without appreciable direction and manage multiple task assignments.
Ability to identify system impact for small and large- scale initiatives.
Knowledge of Project and/or Principles and Practices of Software Development Life Cycle.
Experience with Microsoft Office, Visio, and Project.
Ability to gracefully manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects in fast- paced dynamic environment.
Assist business communities with acceptance testing of results, either for an enhancement to the existing applications or when introducing new functionality in a service request or project
Conduct feasibility studies for Oracle software under consideration for purchase and provide findings and considerations.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Strong project management skills.
Preferred Technical Skills
Should have working knowledge in EBS 12.2.10 and or Fusion applications development with emphasis on workflows, interfaces and other technical functions
Should have used Oracle SQL Loader/External File Utilities to load files
PL/SQL development – troubleshoot Oracle Packages, stored procedures, functions, triggers, views, Cursors and Materialized views for processing data.
Write simple to complex queries to support audit requests or business partners’ reporting requests
Experience utilizing tools such as Data loader, SQL Developer, and TOAD
Some working knowledge of supporting Oracle tools: XML or BI publisher, OA Framework, Oracle Forms, Oracle Reports, Oracle Workflow, Oracle Web ADI, supporting third- party tools (TOAD, SQL developer) and configuration and maintenance of existing Oracle applications
Kofax Products Suite:
Kofax MarkView for Oracle EBS (10.x Kofax Capture (v11.x),
Kofax Transformation Module (v6.x), Kofax Import Connector (v2.x) ,
Kofax Analytics for MarkView (1.x)

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

positionName: Lead, Central Audit Talent Business Analyst
description:
Lead Talent Business Analyst - Audit (Central Region)

Business Analysts provide support to the Lead Business Analyst and the Talent Business Advisor ("TBA") in the delivery of strategic services to the Business. They will also support the Talent organization during peak times to deliver key services.


Work you'll do

Business Analysts help to provide Talent consultative solutions tailored to support the execution of strategic priorities for Audit - Central Region.

Supports the Lead Business Analyst & TBA translate business strategies into actionable Talent strategies.
Supports the Lead Business Analyst & TBA while partnering with COE's and CTS to deliver all talent lifecycle events including, but not limited to, performance management, compensation planning, workforce planning, and other talent programs.
Analyzes data and fundamental information about the business and provides high level expertise and analytics.
Leads reporting efforts, data reconciliation, and analysis for the Business Advisor team.
Supports fostering change throughout the organization and ensure that Talent strategies are aligned with the firm's culture.

The team

The Business Advisor organization champions a "One Talent Team" through collaboration with the Centers of Excellence (COEs) and Core Talent Services (CTS) to deliver integrated Talent services to support Business strategies and priorities.

Qualifications

Required:

Minimum of 5 years of Human Resources leadership experience and/ or directly related experience
Undergraduate degree required (4 year)
Proficient Microsoft Office skills (MS Excel, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)
Team player who will flourish in a fast paced environment
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.


Deloitte's culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte's impact on the world.

Recruiter tips

We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you're applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

positionName: Training and Rules Compliance Analyst - Georgetown, TX
description:
Job Title: Training and Rules Compliance Analyst
FLSA Status: Exempt
Department: Human Resources
Reports to: Director, EHS -Learning and Development
GENERAL DESCRIPTION / PURPOSE:
The Training and Rules Compliance Analyst is primarily responsible for identifying, developing, delivering, and providing oversight to training programs and operating rules enabling Loram employees to meet, maintain, excel in competency and compliance standards across all rail maintenance practices. Through collaboration with management this role will contribute significantly to developing and embedding the Loram way of working across all teams.
This role also prepares programs of instructions, training materials, delivers training, evaluates, and assesses employee performance/competence in the field. Provides oversight for this ‘on-the-job’ to leaders and front-line employees. The location of this role will be 50/50 field/office location and a significant amount of travel is expected.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Functional and Technical Skills
Collaborate with the L and D and EHS teams on formulating and implementing regulatory/compliance policies, procedures, operating rules, regulations, and EHS standards.
Supports the onboarding of new employees and contractors, as well as ensuring compliance with competency standards of a change in role (transfers, promotions) or worker location.
Analyze data and give advice on matters such as the introduction of, or changes to, workplace improvements to enhance overall/high performance.
Develop and maintain a compliance training matrix for Loram North America, including liaising with the L and D functions to ensure enterprise training is allocated in full.
Maintain industry knowledge through participation in relevant workshops, professional development programs, and effective industry networking.
Safety Focus
Develop robust feedback channels for a continuous improvement approach to training and competency at Loram, and actively liaise with all levels of the business to ensure training is meeting the required unit needs and to ensure training and assessments meet formal competency requirements.
Develop, educate, and monitor the application of Loram railroad operating rules, FRA regulations including Part 243, GCOR, and customer specific operating rules.
Oversee, review, update and implement railroad operating rule programs, reports, training, and procedures. Provide leadership to drive continuous improvement in the culture and performance of safe operating practices.
Operational Excellence
Leverages processes and systems relating to effective administration of employee competency and certification, providing reports to management in relation to employee competency and training status.
Ensure training is aligned with employee competency and compliance, providing coaching and support to front line leaders and operations employees as required to achieve the ‘Loram Way’.
Compile data, records, and retention management as required by Company requirements, Federal, State, and Local laws.
Work autonomously and manage multiple stakeholders/projects/tasks simultaneously to meet deadlines and deliver results.
BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES:
Action Oriented
Facilitating Change
High-Impact Communications
Problem Solving
Work Standards
Values Based
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Associate degree in business or equivalent.
Experience: 3+ years of related training and compliance experience.
Working knowledge of OSHA and railroad regulations.
Experience as a trainer with a functional understanding in the operation and maintenance of rail machines and equipment.
Experience with competency frameworks and training assessment tools and practices.
Excellent communication skills both written and oral and strong influencing skills.
Strong and engaging presentation and interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships.
Licenses/Certifications: Obtain and Maintain railroad safety training and certifications
Or 5+ years’ experience combining knowledge of adult learning methodologies, competency frameworks, and application of OSHA or FRA safety regulations in lieu of education.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in business or equivalent.
Experience: 3+ years of related training and compliance experience.
Tertiary qualifications in Adult Education, Education, HR, highly desirable.
Experience in rail maintenance or rolling stock/track machine operations highly desirable.
Expert knowledge in FRA railroad rules and regulations.
Expert knowledge of Roadway Worker Protection.
Expert knowledge in GCOR and experience working with these rules.
Licenses/Certifications: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt and safety/training compliance certifications.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Office deskwork, requiring sitting, walking, using phone & computer
May lift up to 30 lbs. occasionally
50% or more travel including international
Can stand, sit, walk, reach, balance, stoop, kneel, and hear.
Can see up close, distances, colors and has use of peripheral vision and depth perception
Can tolerate variable and sometimes challenging conditions during visits or inspections of company equipment in a railroad environment

Primary Location: 10415 Morado Cir, Austin, TX, USA
Division: Cox Automotive
Job Level: Director/Senior Director
Travel: Yes, 25 % of the Time
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Requisition Number: 216255
The Director, Product Management within Inventory Software Solutions (ISS) will support the KBB Instant Cash Offer (ICO) and vAuto brands within Cox Automotive. The candidate is responsible for partnering with product leaders, business leaders, technology leaders, and other stakeholders to lead and champion the development of new and existing products that delight clients, meet strategic and financial business objectives, and continue to position the ISS products to thrive and win in the market over time. KBB ICO and vAuto products provide data and insights to both dealers and consumers that help them acquire and sell vehicles in digital and traditional marketplaces.
The ideal candidate will bring a balanced mix of people leadership skills, strategic thinking skills, diverse communication skills, innovation, product management and product delivery skills.
The individual will not only lead the Product Managers, Product Owners and UX experts that support existing products but also is responsible for the innovation and growth of Cox Automotive Solutions & the ISS product portfolio.
This person will partner with the Engineering, Product, and Business Leaders to identify and implement process improvements to enhance our product suite, and they will work closely with the key business stakeholders to identify ways to improve our product lifecycle management.
The candidate will also develop and maintain relationships with our clients to better understand their needs and pain points with the ISS and other Retail Solutions Software in addition to other competitors in the marketplace.
Responsibilities (including but not limited to):
Lead and manage the full lifecycle of products within an ISS Product Line(s) / Release Train
Define the vision, strategy and product roadmap that balances market needs with internal resources that provide the companys Inventory Software product offerings with unique competitive advantages
Work with the Executive Team at ISS and Cox Automotive Retail Solutions to identify and prioritize new product initiatives on a quarterly and yearly basis
Provide regular updates to the ISS, Cox Automotive Executive Teams, and select Clients on the current and future objectives for ISS Roadmap
Establish strong relationships with a key group of our Clients to foster ongoing communication on current product features and future product concepts
Champion continuous process improvements within the Product, User Experience, and Engineering teams to both grow and develop team members and to drive higher customer value from the product delivery pipeline
Manage, provide ongoing mentoring and oversight for the Product Managers, Product Owners and UX experts.
Oversee the definition, design, development, and launch of new products and enhancements following Scaled Agile product development practices
Partner with technology and business leaders to ensure the Product Roadmap supports ISS and Cox Automotive business objectives
Work directly with Sales, Performance Management, Operations, Marketing and Client Support to maintain a solid understanding of both the competitive landscape and customer needs
Serve as the champion for product initiatives to the portfolio team, delivery stream, release trains and other roles from User Experience, Product Managers, Engineers, and Scrum Masters
Qualifications:
Where permitted by applicable law, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be considered for this U.S. based job. (Reasonable accommodations for medical and religious objections will be considered.)
10+ years of experience in a Product Management or Product Development role, preferably with B2B SaaS products
5+ years of leading product development teams using multiple methodologies
5+ years of experience directly managing and leading Product Management teams
5+ years of experience working in an Agile development environment
Strong technical background with the ability to quickly develop deep product knowledge and communicate the business values to the field and customers
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced cross-functional team environment with geographically distributed team members
Demonstrated ability to lead product ideation, discovery, and delivery in an Agile environment with a strong focus on collaboration between customers, stakeholders, and delivery teams
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with ability to present and translate complex information to executive, technical, and business partners
Ability to contribute to defining a strategic vision and to articulate it in front of a variety of audiences
Proven organizational skills; ability to multi-task and work on several assignments concurrently; detail-oriented individual
Excellent interpersonal skills, proven track record of building strong relationships and establishing credibility with customers, prospects, analysts, sales, R&D, and the management team
Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience
Automotive experience is strongly desired
Up to 25% travel may be required

Theres nothing ordinary about Cox Automotive. We are people of every background driven by our passion for mobility, innovation, client success and community outreach. Some of those team members work for our iconic consumer brands like Autotrader and Kelley Blue Book, while others are creating the future of automotive at industry-facing brands like Dealer.com, Manheim and vAuto.

Ready to fast-track your Salesforce career
Join the largest team of Salesforce certified professionals in the industry and champion innovation, leverage deep and cutting-edge Salesforce expertise and pioneer solutions to help transform the world’s leading organizations and governments.
Ready to solve complex problems Advance your skills Deliver next-generation Salesforce solutions
Now is the perfect time for you to join the Accenture Salesforce team, where you’ll:
Expand your experience with over 200 intelligent tools across all 12 Salesforce-recognized industries.
Lead in the development and implementation of new Salesforce-based solutions.
Benefit from our long-standing partnership with Salesforce to access the coolest Salesforce technologies, like Lightning, Einstein and Bolt, so you can put them to meaningful applications at scale.
Join more than 11,800 skilled Salesforce professionals, collaborating across multiple areas to drive enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale.
Build new skills and strengthen your expertise with unparalleled training and support—whether you're taking the more than 4,200 unique Salesforce certifications or working towards your Certified Technical Architect (CTA) certification.
Join Accenture and be empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community.
Job Description
The Salesforce Business Analyst is a key member of our Delivery organization in the US. In addition to being responsible for business analyses, the BA would work directly with the project team and clients gathering requirements to analyze, design and/or implement technology best practice business changes. They work with senior members of the team ensuring the successful delivery of Salesforce.com implementation. They should have solid functional and/or industry knowledge, as well as Salesforce products such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Marketing Cloud. They enhance Accenture’s marketplace reputation. Our clients are world leading organizations that are/have selected Salesforce.com to advance their business and the Consultant is an essential team member inside the organization.
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.

Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts
Typical Day Snapshot
Work with Delivery Lead/Project Manager to maintain and coordinate communication with the customer/client throughout each project.
Work with the project team to gather the business and functional requirements, by scoping, defining, and prioritizing requirements.
Mapping functional requirements to Salesforce.com features and functionality.
Understand and document requirements for configuring, testing and launching our CRM solution.
Understand CRM requirements and Identify product requirements for future enhancements.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile inconsistency and break down high-level information into details.
Work with Architects and Developers to transform new requirements into Salesforce.com design and implementation.
Develop, maintain and perform processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity in platform applications with Salesforce Administrator and functional managers to create training materials and documentation for Salesforce.com users and help train new end users on Salesforce.com and related applications.
Configure Users, Profiles Role Creation/Maintenance, Custom and Formula Fields, Validation Rules, Page Layouts and List views, Assignment/Auto Response/Escalation, Workflows & Approvals, and Process Builder.
Supports testing cycles (UAT, regression, system) and/or Training/Training Materials.
Supports PM with project updates, scheduling, invoicing, etc.

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of 2 years’ Business Analysis experience.
Minimum of 2 years’ as a Salesforce administrator or Salesforce App Builder.
Minimum of 2 years’ Experience implementing CRM solutions from start to finish, including the creation of business requirements and other formal documentation
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associates Degree, must have minimum 6 years’ work experience)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with sandbox and production environments to manage the distribution of system functional or process changes.

Are you someone who is energetic, loves to have fun and wants to make a positive impact in the lives of kids in your community? If so, you may be a perfect fit at Little Land. We are currently looking for someone to join our team as a BCBA!

The BCBA (board-certified behavior analyst) is primarily responsible for conducting functional behavior assessments and developing behavior plans based on these assessments. The BCBA is to ensure the effective implementation of all treatment plans and programming for their clients on their caseload as described by the fundamental responsibilities listed below.

Fundamental Responsibilities

Adheres to professional and legal requirements, the principles of behavior analysis and demonstrates sound professional judgment at all times.
Collaborates with families, caregivers and all service providers as necessary to ensure continuity of care.
Performs direct and indirect assessments to identify the function of client’s behaviors.
Develops a treatment plan (including behavior support plan) based on the functions of the behavior and treatment methodologies that are evidence-based.
Attends all relevant meetings for clients.
Adequately demonstrates their abilities to work effectively as a part of a clinical team.
Collects data before and during the implementation of the plan so that the plan’s efficacy can be assessed and data-based decisions can be made.
Provides direct instruction/ongoing supervision, training and support to clients, staff members and family members during regularly-scheduled visits.
Evaluates the effectiveness of the implemented treatment plan and modifies the plan as necessary.
Upon receiving information from the director, the BCBA will initiate services with new clients in a timely manner.
Manages caseload and prepares and submits all required documentation on time. This includes, but is not limited to: assessments, treatment plans/BSPs, insurance updates as required, session notes after every session, at least monthly analysis of the data, updating the treatment plans as needed, participation in calls with insurance companies, etc.
Supervises Registered Behavior Technician’s (RBTs), and graduate students, if assigned to their caseload.
Performs other duties as requested/assigned.

Qualifications

Must have MA degree in related field and BCBA certification number. Certification must be kept up to date.
Must be able to identify and resolve obstacles in a timely manner; gather and analyze data; develop alternative solutions; must work well in group problem solving situations.
Must maintain confidentiality at all times.
Must write clearly and informatively; edit work for grammar and spelling and complete sentences; vary writing style to meet the needs of the agency/client; must be able to explain anything in reports in layman’s terms to families.
Must follow policies and procedures; complete tasks on time or notify the appropriate parties if a deadline will not be met; support the organization’s goals and values.
Must display original thinking and creativity; meet challenges with resourcefulness; generate suggestions for improving work, develop innovative approaches and ideas.

About Little Land
Little Land was founded by a pediatric occupational therapist to provide a meaningful and engaging environment to the families that we serve. From developmental open play and classes to pediatric therapy services, Little Land offers a variety of experiences to children of all ages. With locations in the United States and China, Little Land is impacting lives around the globe.

As a part of the Little Land team, you will gain experience in childhood development and play a major role in the development of kids in our community.

Locally Owned
Each Little Land is locally owned and operated by an independent franchisee. If you apply for this position, your application will be forwarded directly to the appropriate franchisee. All hiring decisions will be made by the franchisee or their management team. If you have any questions about this position, please direct questions to your local franchise location.

positionName: Sr. BI Analyst - SQL, Python & Data Visualization
description:
Role:
As our Sr. BI Analyst, you will be a key member of the CDK/Roadster Analytics team, reporting directly to our VP of Analytics (Roadster). CDK recently acquired Roadster, so you’ll have the opportunity to experience what it’s like to work in a fast-paced Silicon Valley culture, but also have all the growth opportunities the larger CDK organization offers.
In this role, you’ll be working with some of the top Silicon Valley talent and have access to one of the largest and most comprehensive datasets in the Automotive industry. You’ll be working closely with Roadster’s customer-facing teams (Success, Sales, Marketing) teams as well as directly with some of the largest and most progressive automotive retailers in the world.
Our data is unique in that we are analyzing customer journeys. We’ve built a complete, high-fidelity and performant data warehouse (BigQuery & Snowflake) and we need someone who wants to help pioneer new ways to analyze and visualize the complex, non-linear journey customers take when buying a car.
You will use your advanced SQL and Python skills to assemble complex customer journeys, then use your data wrangling skills to blend it with other data from SalesForce or other APIs. Finally, you’ll either build advanced visualizations in Mode Analytics, enabling end-users to visualize the journeys and/or build models and algorithms to process the data in Python. We are a production shop, so the final step will be to harden your code and put it into production.
You’ll be joining a world-class analytics team, consisting of some of the best Digital Analysts, Data Engineers, BI experts. Furthermore, you’ll join a team with experience building real, productionalized analytics, generating real results. To get a sense of how the Roadster software works, check out these demos:
 https://vimeo.com/503514117 (2:20 min)https://vimeo.com/376907386 (2:05 min)https://vimeo.com/382641748 (1:27 min)
Your responsibilities will include:
Working with our field teams to understand what’s important to them and their customers.Working closely with our Engineering team and Data Engineer to acquire data sets.Building new visualizations and training the field staff how to use and interpret your insights.Building predictive and prescriptive models.Supporting what you’ve built into the future.
You may be a fit for this role if you have:
At least 2 years of experience with software, eCommerce or other customer-focused technology company.Advanced SQL skills, blending data in complex ways.Advanced Python skillsHave real experience building models in a production environmentAre excellent at building dashboards using a modern toolset (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.)Are really good at building simple, compelling Data VisualizationsAre an excellent storyteller - able to communicate complex analytic concepts clearly and simply.Solid Business Acumen, fluent in business analysis (revenue, gross margin, market share)

Nice to have:
JavaScript skillsAutomotive experienceExperience working in a startup or software company
