About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

positionName: Rewarding Digital Marketing Account Manager / Analyst
description: We manage tens of millions in digital ad spend annually in the pursuit of achieving record growth for our clients. That growth means we are always looking for the most talented, confident, well-adjusted independent thinkers to join our amazing team.A Day in The Life: · On Day 1, all new hires join a team· Fuel client growth through account and target optimization, data processing and analysis, running assessments, making recommendations, proposing strategy, and implementing tactics· Work in Excel to process, build and prototype tools, and solve interesting marketing-related problems· Use your organization, prioritization and innovation skills to improve team and company efficiency and efficacyWhat Success Looks Like: · Nimbly and intelligently analyze data, identify trends and craft insightful recommendations based on your observation and interpretation skills· Confidently communicate with company, team and clients and fearlessly participate in team discussions, planning, and brainstormingBenefits: Yes!Promotions: Yes!Great people to work with: Yes!FOREVER remote: Yes!Rewarding work: Yes!Fun ways to socially connect: Yes!Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication Question(s):Please describe your interest in applying for this job.Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Marketing: 2 years (Preferred)Microsoft Excel: 5 years (Preferred)Language:English (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsWork Remotely:YesWork Location: Multiple Locations

The Senior Market Research Analyst will drive our Americas Power Markets Research with data-driven insights. The ideal candidate will complete predictive and prescriptive analysis of power & energy markets, emerging technology and trends, competitive intelligence and provide pro-active insights/recommendations on growth strategies and improvement of business operations.
Employee in this role will proactively analyze data, and present insights to improve business outcomes and support growth strategy initiatives presenting it to executives and top management. Demonstrated expertise in/or experience with, complex markets and regulations governing those markets, including, but not limited to: competitive power markets, vertically integrated regulated markets, generation technologies, new energy research. Ideal candidates possesses a broad background to be able to conduct market trend research while also understanding the technical aspects of our products, including gas turbines, solar projects development and battery storage-new emerging technologies in the power markets.

Qualifications:
Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s Degree (B.S/B.A.) in Engineering, Business, Finance, Economics. Master’s preferred. At least 5-7 years related experience and/or training. Experience beyond 5 years highly desired.
Proficiency with production cost modelling softwares/ power system platforms: PLEXOS, PROMOD, Aurora
Handson knowledge of programming languages : MATLAB, Python, PSS/E
Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret research documents/white papers and market intelligence databases. Ability to write routine reports and creative presentations. Ability to speak effectively before C-suite executives as well as external audiences. Desirable: Multilingual (English, Spanish)
Mathematical Skills: Proficient in basic concepts of algebra and geometry.
Presentation Skills: Proficiency with PowerPoint presentations; and presenting business insights in a clear, attractive and concise manner.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be proficient with Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Experience with Tableau a plus.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Business Analyst - REMOTE

RESPONSIBILITIES


Works with other teams to interview stakeholders and elicit basic to moderate business requirements.
Assists facilitation of meetings to build deep understanding of functional business and it areas (e.g., customer, field operations) to understand business requirements.
Assists in translating business and design requirements into technical requirements.
Analyzes process/system changes, with supervision, to ensure design changes meet business requirements.
Develops experience with drawing process maps and using business process modelling techniques.
Manages overall catalogue of process flows for small to medium complexity projects.
Analyzes fairly complex data for projects with little to no supervision.
Performs QA against specifications.
Identifies issues with the quality and performance of products, services, solutions or processes and proposes improvements.
Supports small to medium complexity projects with some degree of supervision, including tracking issues and managing action items.
Appropriately documents knowledge and share lessons learned for medium complexity projects.
Assists with BA activities needed on agile scrum teams; displays understanding of agile methodology.
Analyzes, identifies, and directs solutions to eliminate problems, improve user effectiveness, and improve system accuracy.
Comes up with ideas and insights to share with senior business analysts that will optimize business results.
Works in an agile environment and engages in development practices such as XP, test driven development.

REQUIREMENTS


Developing knowledge of the practices, procedures and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis), benchmarking and audit compliance.
Strong familiarity with specialized business technologies and applications (e.g., workforce management, outage management, mobile dispatch).
Good understanding of customers business model, and different parts of the business (e.g., distribution, transmission operations).
Strong proficiency in standard software applications (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint). 3-5 years of experience
Bachelors degree strongly preferred

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.

Overview:

With a focus on the Government, Kearney & Company provides financial services, including auditing, consulting, and technology services. Our commitment to our employees and clients as well as to dedication and trust, critical values to our Firm, have led to Kearney’s recognition as one of the leading accounting firms in the country. Based on our employees’ feedback, we are also consistently rated a Best Place to Work. Employment at Kearney means a flexible, collaborative, and open-minded work environment. We hope it is your “first easy decision.” Learn more at www.kearneyco.com/careers.
COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new Kearney team members will be required to comply with Executive Order (EO) 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID-19 Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, and the corresponding COVID-19 Workplace Safety: Guidance for Federal Contractors and Subcontractors issued by the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force, mandating Federal Contractors, including Kearney team members, to submit proof of vaccination status prior to their first day of employment. Prospective or new Team Members may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement by contacting the Director of Human Resources (covid-19@kearneyco.com /703-931-5600) and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Client site vaccination requirements, if different or more strict, will take precedence over Kearney’s vaccination policy, complying with the mandates mentioned above.
Responsibilities:

Kearney & Company is seeking a Senior Analyst to join the team remotely. The Business Analyst Consultant will support a cross-functional team applying federal finance regulations (e.g., OMB, FASB) to CFO operations improving business operations with a focus on process and data. Responsibilities:
Support PPBE processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, develop and implement solutions
Support PPBE enabled business process diagrams
Participate in design and solution sessions to optimize processes with a focus on financial data
Analyze the PPBE data structure meets reporting objectives
Identify and implement PPBE data quality improvements
Assess report templates meeting operational demands
Support the data improvement strategy and plans
Author requirement and process documentation
#KCO1701
Qualifications:

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.

This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.

Clear Capital is building the future of real estate data, and we need your help! We are seeking experienced product builders: with your talent as a Data Quality Analyst, help us reach our goals of knowing more about a property than anybody else and in the process making home ownership valuations more fair and equitable for millions of people.
We are the innovation team supporting and developing the production modeling systems and massive scale simulations driving Clear Capital’s novel technologies. The Data Quality Analyst role at Clear Capital will work on a team to build products and features, participating in the process all the way from proof of concept to production release. You’ll be working with a talented team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Ops Engineers who, like you, value curiosity and collaboration.
We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to assist with the development and implementation of systems leveraging structured and unstructured data to deliver data science solutions at scale. As a Data Quality Analyst at Clear Capital, you are committed to enabling the best work of others on the team. You help yourself and your team to consistently “level up.” You think ahead to anticipate the needs of others and provide concise information for decision-making.
What you will work on
Solicit and analyst customer feedback on model quality issues, and help translate these to prioritizations for future model development
Monitor and analyze Machine Learning models in production
Establish and maintain Service Level Agreements for Machine Learning products.
Who we are looking for
Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience with technical data collection and 2+ years of overall experience
Strong technical skills in data profiling, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection. A keen interest in the details of data
Strong knowledge of SQL and ability write SQL scripts
Significant Python scripting experience
Significant Experience with Excel
Experience with Data Modeling
Experience with version control software (e.g. Git)
You iterate quickly and are a continuous learner and are comfortable in a face-paced environment
What You Can Expect
Competitive compensation and immediate contribution!
Inclusive benefits package offerings 401k plans and customizable benefits including dental, vision, medical, etc. for you and your dependents.
An innovative culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity.
Company supported and employee-driven ambassador groups that promote diversity, working on a hybrid schedule and philanthropy.
Learning and development programs to help advance your career and personal growth.
What we value
Wherever it leads, Whatever it takes! We believe in making the impossible possible!
Thrive personally, grow professionally―be happy!
Innovate, learn, lead- Knowledge and growth is never ending!
We believe in hiring nice people because anything is possible when you have the team's support.
Improving the lives around us- A smile could change the entire world.
Be the most trusted, respected, and loved real estate valuation company in the world.

Clear Capital is the premier provider of real estate valuation, analytics, and technology solutions. Powered by its more than 45 years worth of information on nearly every U.S. metro, neighborhood, and property, Clear Capital’s solutions are trusted by community credit unions and billion-dollar financial institutions alike. Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.

Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Overview:

Data Analyst III - REMOTE
Company Overview:
CoventBridge Group is the leading worldwide full-service investigation solutions company providing: Surveillance, SIU and Compliance, Claims Investigation, Counter-Fraud Programs, Desktop Investigations, Social Media, Record Retrieval, Canvasses and Vendor Management programs. With offices in the UK and U.S. the company provides top tier data privacy and security practices, deploys robust case management technology customized to clients’ needs and delivers worldwide coverage via its 1000 employees and affiliates worldwide.
About the Opportunity:
The Data Analyst III Performs high-level complex evaluation and analysis of data to support potential fraud cases and requests for information using claims data across multiple Medicare/Medicaid benefit types. The potential fraud cases involve high dollar amounts, sensitive issues, or otherwise meet criteria for referral to law enforcement, recoupment of overpayment, and/or administrative action based on reactive and proactive data analysis. Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analyst associates and assists management with special projects.
In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting CoventBridge Group's objective: To provide services to our clients that exceed their expectations and contribute to improved healthcare delivery by identifying and eliminating fraud, waste and abuse.

The Data Analyst III position will report to the Data Supervisor and will work in our Grove City, OH office or if not local, remotely from a home office.
Responsibilities/ Requirements:
Responsibilities:
Work with local management, investigators, and analysts to provide reactive and proactive case development support and to fulfill law enforcement data requests.
Communicate effectively with internal and external customers, including federal law enforcement officers.
Performs quality assurance and validates data analysis results and analytically identifies potential fraud, waste and/or abuse situations in violation of Medicare or Medicaid laws, guidelines, policies, and regulations.
Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analysts.
Develops and documents new processes and procedures to improve staff efficiency and better meet department and contract goals.
Works with Statisticians and Data Analysts to ensure quality data analysis results with statistically high probabilities of producing case referrals to law enforcement, overpayments, and/or administrative actions.
Prepares, develops, and participates in staff training as related to Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste and/or abuse data analysis.
Proactively monitors data sources (claims data, internet, etc.) to identify new and emerging Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste, and abuse trends.
Comply with and maintains various documentation and other reporting requirements as needed.
Assists with special projects that require complex analysis of data.
Requirements:
A minimum of three (3) years of previous experience in healthcare data analytics, with preference given to candidates with Medicare/Medicaid program integrity experience
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of health care information (health claims data; specifically, Medicare and Medicaid, ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM codes, physician specialty codes) is required.
Have high proficiency level with MS Office Products.
Requires a working knowledge of SAS and/or other software applications necessary to perform healthcare claims data analytics.
Full COVID-19 vaccination and documentation are required as this position directly or indirectly supports a Federal Government Contract. [2 doses of Moderna or Pfizer; 1 dose of Johnson & Johnson]. Medical and religious accommodations are considered for exemption.
Benefits:

Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision plans
Life, LTD and STD paid by the employer
401(k) with company match up to 4%
Paid Time Off and company paid holidays
Tuition assistance after 1 year of service
*CoventBridge is proud to be an EEO-AA employer M/F/D/V.*

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.

Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

American Specialty Health Incorporated is seeking a Business Analyst II to join our Customer Service – Fitness department. This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.
Uses SQL to help build queries to analyze issues reported.
Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Business, or equivalent experience. If equivalent experience, high school diploma required.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with software development teams.
Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum methodology preferred).
Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.
Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff in order to gather necessary details.
Ability to create business and system process diagrams.
Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in verbal and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

American Specialty Health Incorporated is seeking a Business Analyst II to join our Customer Service – Fitness department. This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.
Uses SQL to help build queries to analyze issues reported.
Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Business, or equivalent experience. If equivalent experience, high school diploma required.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with software development teams.
Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum methodology preferred).
Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.
Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff in order to gather necessary details.
Ability to create business and system process diagrams.
Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in verbal and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.
This job posting is not applicable in CO.

Description:
Digital Advisor services supports financial advisors, with their own book of business. Advisor Center, which is a web based, proprietary solution. They started trying to digitize paper-based actions and has now morphed into how do you bring digital experience to the advisors and avoid additional costs.
They are looking for a Business Analyst for this team to help with integrations and other projects for the Advisor Center. Currently there are 4 Product managers – each of them have a contract BA paired with them, including this open positions. It is a mature team and they will work with established dev teams. They are working with Agile, creating digital experiences.
This BA will be working with a fully onshore team. They need to be really well versed in Agile, understand how the story is written and how to execute and deliver a chunk of code. On this team the Product Manager is very process oriented and the Scrum Master understands agile inside and out so they need to love Agile. It would be nice if they have worked on digital product before, but they are really looking for someone focused on execution and delivery within Agile framework. And someone who wants to be fully accountable and responsible for something.
EVP:
This is a HUGE resume builder. And you are working within an execution team during a very critical time. The integration is one of the largest in financial history. That combined with the fact that Advisors Services is over half of the revenue and they are going through a huge digital transformation effort.
Required Skills:Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering business process requirements and use cases is required.
Solid experience and understanding of Agile Scrum and Rational Unified Process Methodology in developing use cases, use case model, supplementary requirements, and business rules is essential.
Solid understanding of relevant business issues.
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and iGraphx or Visio Drawing tools along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required.
Preferred:Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments, a background in the financial services industry, BA/BS degree and/or PMP certification.
Responsibilities:Act as requirements lead directly plugged into the development team.
Partner with a Product Manager to understand and execute on vision in an effort to deliver new digital capabilities to production in a timely and efficient manner. Partner with business users and act as a liaison between business and technical teams.
Coordinates development, testing, and implementation of solutions with vendors, where necessary.
Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering business process requirements and use cases is required.
Solid experience and understanding of Agile Scrum in developing use cases, use case model, supplementary requirements, and business rules is essential.
Solid understanding of relevant business issues.
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
The following is preferred but not required: Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments, a background in the financial services industry, BA/BS degree and/or PMP certification. Experience with Atlassian suite of tools for managing backlogs and requirements.

Business analysis, Agile, Requirements gathering, User stories

Business analysis,Agile,Requirements gathering,User stories

Must have a love of Agile, be a team player and collaborative

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Company Info:

About Legrand
Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.
About Legrand North and Central America
Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401K match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.
About Legrand’s Data Center Power and Control Division
Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best in class overhead power supply system’s, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design. For more information, visit raritan.com and servertech.com

Thank you for considering a career at Bon Secours Mercy Health!
SUMMARY
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for translating and programming vast amounts of data into understandable, relevant and actionable information. Interfacing with business units (finance, HR, etc.) across the organization, this position will use their expertise to provide business insights, design and deliver reports, and drive self-service reporting capabilities across the organization. It is critical for this role to be actively engaged in developing and promoting effective data governance through documentation and adherence of standards to assure that the information produced and provided by the Analytics team is accurate and trusted as the source of truth.
***Remote/work from home - eastern time zone hours
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Responsible for identifying, understanding, acquiring, merging, and transforming data from a centralized data warehouse
Partner with business unit teams to understand their operational needs, recommend solutions, assure compliance with standards
Translate data needs of the business and work with data engineers or architects to build processes and tools that help automate effective data delivery and reduce resource utilization and redundancy
Engage in the overall data governance of the organization and take an active role in the development, documentation and on-going maintenance of a data governance operation
Develop effective auditing and validation processes between the source systems and the centralized data warehouse to assure accurate and timely availability of data
Develop, test, and deliver reports and extracts from the centralized data warehouse using appropriate BI tools
Constantly look for better ways of solving technical problems and designing the solution, not afraid of challenging the status quo
Mentor and coach the broader Analytics Delivery team
Be hands on and engage in coding to help the team to develop his / her solution and solve all surfacing problems at hand
QUALIFICATIONS
Required Minimum Education:
Bachelors
Experience:
Required- 5 years of experience working in a Business Analyst or Data Analyst role
Preferred- 5+ years of experience working in Business Analyst or Data Analyst role at a healthcare provider
ADDITIONAL SKILLS
Coding skills (SQL)
Attention to detail
MS Office (Excel)
Critical thinking
BI tools (Tableau or PowerBI)
Ability to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Healthcare system knowledge
Translation of complex technical concepts
Experience with unstructured datasets
Agile work process
Statistics (basic understanding)
Desire to learn / Intellectually curious
WORKING CONDITIONS Periods of high stress and fluctuating workloads may occur. General office environment. Remote - Rarely required to report to a work location In-person collaboration maybe required when necessary. Associates may live anywhere but recommend in the footprint when possible.

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

About Legrand
Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.

Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best in class overhead power supply system’s, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design.
